* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy secong hand Xerox machine, bond paper, toners and ink, and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Moeun K., age 31, sells used clothes at the busy local market in the province of Battambang. From that she is able to earn about $5 a day to support her family. She has been married for many years to Mr. Loerk Sarat, 37, a motor taxi driver, and they have four children, all of whom are single and still living under their roof. 

Recently Mrs. Moeun K. sold nearly all her inventory to her buyers and she wants to replenish her stock, but she lacks capital. Therefore, she is asking for a loan in order to purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita M. is 53 years old and married. She supports her family by operating a fishing/fish vending business. She lives in Purok Ipil-ipil, Brgy Bulanon, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1996 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing/fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP). Teresita is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she could purchase materials for fishing. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Teresita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Shaadiinsa's Group

texts.en:
Shaadiinsa B. is the leader of this group. She is 45 years old and married.  Shaadiinsa is the resident of Kadamjai, a small town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Her husband works as a power engineer. Together they are raising two sons and three daughters. Their two older daughters work in Russia and the other children are students. Shadiinsa works as a school teacher. She also breeds, raises, and sells cattle, from which she earns 3000 soms per month. With money that she receives from this loan, she wants to purchase a calf to breed. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy A. is from the village of Talon, Gingoog City. She is 22 years old. Jovy is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Jovy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, junk foods and canned goods in the local community. Jovy has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jovy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Jovy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Jovy is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages and junk foods. This will be the third loan taken out by Jovy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Abduvahob

texts.en:
A livestock breeder for six years, Abduvahob was born in 1975 in Gafurov, Tajikistan. He is married and is responsible for four people consisting of his wife and three children. Very dynamic, serious and entrepreneurial, he is proposing to expand his herd and repair his enclosure, so as to meet the needs of a rather large clientele from his village and its neighborhood, who buy animals from within 20 km of his village. With this goal in mind, Abduvahob is requesting a loan that will serve him as business capital. The profit he will make from this business will allow him to improve living conditions for his household and also make some investments.   
  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle for developing business

loans.name: Arnida

texts.en:
Arnida D. is from the town of Trinidad.  She is 28 years old.  Arnida is married and has 3 children ages 9, 7 and 4 years old.  To make a living, Arnida owns and operates a fishing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market.  Arnida wishes for her business to grow.

Arnida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Arnida has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI.  Arnida is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita L. is from the village of Sibugon. She is 60 years old. Esterlita is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Esterlita owns and operates a new clothing business. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Esterlita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Esterlita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Uvaldo

texts.es:
Uvaldo tiene 54 años de edad, tiene seis hijos y vive en la ciudad de Pisaq de la provincia del Calca departamento del Cusco, Perú.
 
Uvaldo se dedica a la venta de repuestos de moto en una pequeña tienda, él también se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte urbano en la ciudad de Pisaq. Ya son 6 años que se dedica a la brindar servicios de transporte en su propio mototaxi y le ha ido muy bien. En esta oportunidad Uvaldo para comprar repuestos como por ejemplo llantas y muchas cosas que falta en la tienda.   
     
Uvaldo pertenece al banco comunal “Mosoq Ñusta” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Uvaldo is 54 years old, has six children, and lives in the city of Pisaq in the Province of Calca, Department of Cusco, Peru.

He has a small shop where he sells motorcycle parts. In addition, Uvaldo provides urban transportation services in the city of Pisaq. He has been providing transportation services with his own motorcycle taxi for six years and has done very well. Uvaldo is taking this opportunity to buy parts such as tires and other items that his store is lacking.

Uvaldo belongs to the Communal Bank “Mosoq Ñusta”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity provided and promises to complete his payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle parts to sell

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HACIA EL TRIUNFO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Angelica, La socia tiene 42 años de edad, la socia  es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 15 años de edad, la socia trabaja como promotora de una institución pública, la socia también elabora todo tipo de mermeladas y manjares y los vende a sus compañeros en su institución según sea el pedido que le hagan. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de mermeladas y manjares.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This lady is a member of the “HACIA EL TRIUNFO” Banco Comunal, which is located in the district of Huanchac, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

She is called Señora Angelica and she is 42 years old, married, with one child who is 15 years old. She works as a marketer in a public institution. She also makes all kinds of delicacies and jams, which she sells to order to her co-workers at the institution. Señora Angelica is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for making the jams and delicacies.

She is happy to be receiving this loan and committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make jams and other delicacies

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie, 30 years old, married, and blessed with school-aged children, is from the village of Sulipat, Calamba, where she manages her grocery store business. She is also engaged in vulcanizing and is able to earn a monthly net income of 3500.00.

In 2008, Emie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 9,000.00 PHP from PMPC that was used to expand the business, she is requesting her sixth loan for 8,000 PHP to help renovate her house.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 46-year-old man, married to two ladies and has 3 children: 2 sons and a daughter. 

Using his 12 years of experience in trading and business, Mohammad decided to start his own business by renting a shop to sell frozen goods two years ago. He has been successfully running it since then. 

Mohammad applied for a loan to expand his business; he will be using the loan to buy more display refrigerators to introduce new varieties of goods to cover the needs of the people in his area.

loans.use: to buy more display refrigerators to introduce new varieties of goods

loans.name: Merly Esther

texts.es: Merly tiene 23 años de edad. Es madre soltera de una hija. Vive en casa de padres con su hija en la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Merly se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo. Sus clientes hacen sus pedidos y Merly reparten la mercadería cada semana. Ella cuenta con clientes fidelizados en este negocio. Tiene una experiencia de más de 02 años en esta actividad. Adicionalmente cuenta con una mototaxi propia que alquila a un familiar, el cual le genera ingresos de forma diaria. Con los ingresos de estas actividades, Merly puede solventar sus gastos familiares. Desea aumentar su mercadería de ropa con más productos que puede vender durante la nueva temporada escolar en Perú. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa. Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Walther is 46 years old, married, and has four dependent children.  He lives in his own home in the rural part of La Victoria district, twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than two years, Walther has been earning a living providing a transport service through a taxi company in his community.  He currently uses a vehicle which he hires by the day.

Walther would like to use part of the loan that he has requested from Edpyme Alternativa to enrol in a specialization course which will help him in his work and help him to increase his income.  He would like to use the rest of his loan to cover his children's school expenses now that the school year has begun in Peru.

Walther is very hard working and would like to continue improving in his field so that he can continue making a good income.  His biggest wish is to provide his children with a good-quality education.

loans.use: aumentar su mercadería de ropa con más productos que puede vender durante la nueva temporada escolar en Perú

loans.name: Stellaphine

texts.en:
Stellaphine M., 39, is married to Steven Kitui, a 40-year-old businessman, and they have four children: Irene, 14 years old in class seven, Evans, 9 years old in class four, Mercy, 3, and Meshack, who is a year old. They live in Lukenya where Stellaphine has run a quarry business for 10 years, earning a monthly profit of Kshs.5,000.

Introduced to Kadet Ltd by the credit officer in charge of the Kitengela office, Stellaphine is requesting her first loan for 50,000 to purchase another quarry. If the loan boosts her income, she will buy a piece of land upon which to build a house to live in with her family.

Stellaphine describes herself as hardworking and dreams of becoming a prominent business lady.

loans.use: to purchase another quarry

loans.name: Safa

texts.en:
Safa is a young woman from Palestine, married and a mother of one daughter and one son. Both her children are school students. Safa's husband has a laundry shop that serves a good number of clients in the city where Safa and her family live. Safa's husband needs a steam iron to improve the services offered by his shop. Since he can't afford to buy it from the shop's income and keep running the house and shop, Safa took out a loan from FATEN to buy the Iron.

Safa's husband appears in the picture here in the laundry shop where he works instead of her, as she is a conservative woman.

loans.use: to purchase a clothes iron for the laundry shop

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 24 years old and a single mother to a 3 year old child. She is a tailor in Kiganjo. She has been running her business for a period of about 2 years, with an income of approximately 5,000 Kenya shillings a month.

This is her first loan with KADET, after being introduced to Kadet by a friend. She wants to use the loan to buy cosmetics for her shop and materials to make clothes, which she will later sell. She hopes to buy a piece of land and develop it in order to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her shop and material to make clothes.

loans.name: Willian

texts.en: Willian lives in a small village in the Choluteca region of Honduras with his four small children. He has been operating a small convenience store out of his home for the past 15 years, getting up at 5:00 a.m. every morning to attend to customers.  Willian is a returning client and is requesting a loan of Lps. 20,000 to buy more general merchandise for his store. In his free time on weekends, he likes to attend church.

loans.use: buy merchandise for his store

loans.name: Florecita Group

texts.es:
El grupo Florecita lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Rosa Argentina  de 40 años, tiene cinco hijos de los cuales dos son menores de edad. Ella se  dedica a la realización de cepillos para lavar pachas desde hace 14 años. Este negocio lo aprendió de su hermano el cual trabajaba en ello y poco a poco toda la familia se involucró.
Ella invertirá en materiales nailon, alambre, madera…etc. y su meta es iniciar otro negocio que sería el comercio de ropa.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Maricela del Carmen de 35 años quien vende frijoles cocidos y nacatamales, comida típica a base de maíz y cerdo, y María Isabel quien realiza cepillos de lavar ropa y cepillos de lustrar.
texts.en:
The Florecita ("Little Flower") group is composed of three hard-working, enterprising, women. 

One of them is Señora Rosa Argentina. She is 40 years old, and has 5 children, 2 of whom are of school age. For the past 14 years, she has dedicated her time to making brushes for washing baby bottles. She learned her business from her brother, who did the same work and who little by little got the whole family involved. She will invest in the necessary materials (nylon, wire, wood, etc.) and her goal is to start up another business, selling clothes. 

The other members of the group are Maricela del Carmen, age 35, who sells refried beans and nacatamales - a local dish based on cornmeal and pork - and María Isabel, who makes brushes for cleaning clothes and polishing shoes.

loans.use: en materiales nailon, alambre, madera…etc.

loans.name: Riham

texts.en:
Riham is a young woman from Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip. She is married and a mother of one son. Riham took out a loan of $1,000 to purchase new home furniture instead of the old ones she has. Her husband is an employee with a decent salary. FATEN's loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, helped her buy better furniture. Getting this loan will make Riham and her family live in better home conditions.

Riham is a religious woman as are most of Gaza Strip inhabitants. Therefore, her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo, es un artesano de 51 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus seis hijos de 25, 22, 20, 18, más dos chiquitines, su principal fuente de ingreso es la fabricación y venta de loza de barro, es un trabajo de familia, tienen  muchos años de estar en esta actividad, sus hijos trabajan junto a él, unos fabricando y otros quemando lo fabricado, luego los llevan a comercializar, su dificultad es que no disponen de suficiente capital para comprar materia prima.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales barro, nacazcol y leña, teniendo este material ellos podrán aumentar la producción y por lo mismo tener más oportunidades de vender.
Él ha apoyado siempre a sus hijos, su sueño es dejarlos preparados para que puedan tener su propio hogar, en una condición estable y que crezcan en el negocio.
texts.en:
Pablo is a 51-year-old artisan.  He lives with his wife and six children who are 25, 22, 20 and 18 years old plus two little ones.  His main source of income is the manufacture and sale of clayware.  It is a family business.  They’ve been doing it for many years.  His children work with him, come of them forming and other firing what’s made.  Then, they take them to be sold.  His difficulty is that he lacks enough capital to buy raw materials.

Currently, he’s asking for a loan to buy clay, nacazcol (a black dye) and firewood.  By having these materials on hand he can increase production and have more opportunities to sell.

He has always supported his children and his dream is to leave them well prepared to be able to have their own homes in stable conditions and that they will be able to grow with the business.

loans.use: to buy clay, nacazcol (dye) and firewood to make clay crafts.

loans.name: Rubén Edgardo

texts.es: Rubén Edgardo de treinta y siete años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus hijos. El posee una panadería muy conocida en la localidad donde residen porque venden el pan más exquisito y a los mejores precios, el tiene muchos años de ser un artesano del pan, como él mismo se llama; además Rubén les da el mejor servicio, siempre está a la orden del cliente; él es un hombre lleno de metas por alcanzar y una de ellas es ver crecer su negocio él piensa que aquel que ama a su trabajo también se ama a sí mismo  y sus sueños es por eso que muy decidido le solicita  INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima como harina, levadura, azúcar, bandejas entre otros. Rubén Edgardo tiene la esperanza que su humilde trabajo le permitirá darle a su familia seguridad económica y una vida plena.
texts.en: Ruben Edgardo is thirty-six years old and he lives with his life-partner and their children. He has a well-known bakery in the community where he lives. He sells the most exquisite breads and at the best prices. He has been a bread artisan for many years, matching his name. Ruben also provides the best service and he is always ready to serve his clients. His is a man who has many goals to attain and one of them is to see his business grow. He thinks that those who love their work also love themselves and their dreams. It is the reason why he has requested a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) to purchase ingredients such as flour, yeast, sugar, baking trays, etc. Ruben Edgardo hopes that his humble work will permit him to provide his family with financial security and a full life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, yeast, sugar, and baking trays.

loans.name: Dora De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Dora, es originaria de la ciudad de León, esta casada, es madre de 4 hijos. Ella estudio contabilidad pero es dueña de una pulpería. Ella inicio su actividad de comercio hace 25 años cuando puso la pulpería este ha sido su segundo negocio. Anteriormente tenia un puesto de sodas donde distribuía al por mayor y al detalle el negocio lo administraba su esposa mientras ella trabajaba en una empresa agrícola ella se desempañada en el área de contabilidad pero la despidieron y con el pago de su liquidación puso su negocio de pulpería en la que actualmente vende productos varios tales como granos básicos, sodas, leche, huevo, verduras, jugos enlatados.  
Requiere el préstamo para comprar pollo y carnes al por mayor. Ya que estos productos son muy demandados por su clientes y generan buena ganancia. En sus planes futuros ella quiere comprar un vehículo para entregar productos comestible que ella vende a domicilio con esto daría mas rotación a su inventario. Posteriormente le gustaría convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora de alimentos.
texts.en:
Dora, a native of León, is married and the mother of 4 children.  She studied accounting but is the owner of a general store. She started this business 25 years ago when she established the store beside her second business.  Previously she had a soda stand where she sold wholesale and her husband ran the business and handled the finances while she worked for an agricultural company.  She worked in the accounting department but they let her go.  She used the severance pay to open the general store where she currently sells various products such as basic grains, milk, eggs, vegetables and canned juices.

She needs the loan to buy chicken and meat wholesale since these products have a big demand from her customers and generate good earnings.  In her future plans she wants to buy a vehicle to deliver her products, fuel that she will sell to homes, and these will give her more inventory rotation.  Later she would like to convert her general store into a food distribution center.

loans.use: To buy chicken and meat wholesale.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng is 26 years old, married, and lives with her husband and her one lovely child. Seng is a farmer who grows a rice crop. From this business, she earns a low income per day. To assist her revenue, her husband runs a business as a motor taxi driver and he earns approximately $3 per day. 

Since her husband’s motorbike is broken, she would like to purchase a motorbike but lacks money so she has decided with her husband to request some funds through HKL's partner Kiva to buy a new motorbike for servicing clients. She hopes that this fund will change her family’s situation.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike .

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Tambo Real, en la Provincia de Anta y Departamento de Cusco.  
La socia Norma; La socia tiene 43 años de edad; la socia es casada y tiene 4  hijos; La socia se dedica  a la atención de sus vacas, ella tiene ganados vacunos, la socia trabaja vendiendo leche, ella reparte la leche a sus amistades y cuando se le acumula la lleva a la feria en los poblados aledaños a Tambo Real; la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de sales minerales para sus ganados, ella tiene 20 vacas lecheras y 3 toros, la socia también tiene animales menores. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de sales minerales para sus ganados.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Introducing Norma, a member of “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” (Cachimayo Solidarity), a communal bank located in Tambo Real, a district of the province of Anta in the Cusco department.
Norma is 43 years old, she is married and she has 4 children. She breeds cows and tends to them. She sells milk, distributing a part of it to her friends, and taking the exceeding quantities to the fair in the neighboring villages in Tambo Real. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of mineral salts for her animals. She has 20 dairy cows and 3 bulls, and she also keeps small animals. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of mineral salts for her animals.
She is grateful for the support she will receive and at the same time she commits to complying with fully repaying her dues.

loans.use: To buy mineral salts for her cattle.

loans.name: Chernor

texts.en: Chernor is a small-scale businessman in the northern city of Makeni. The 38-year-old is a native of Makeni city. He is a husband and father of two children. His wife is a nurse and one of his children is attending primary school. Chernor sells medicines and has been running this business for the past three years. He has requested a loan of 3,000,000 SLL from Kiva field partner SMT, in order to improve his pharmacy. He will use this loan to buy different types of drugs to add to his pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy different types of drugs to add to his pharmacy

loans.name: Estefania Lilibeth

texts.es:
Estefanía de 21 años, una mujer trabajadora y honrada que ha sabido como ganarse la vida honradamente.
Su negocio es un salón de belleza ubicado en la parte delantera de su vivienda, empezó esta actividad realizando varios cursos.

Es madre soltera, tiene un niño de 5  años de edad, su dificultad es el polvo ya que por donde ella vive  su calle no esta pavimentada, ya que esto le afecta mucho a la clientela.

Ella solicita este préstamo para ampliar y mejorar e incrementar su negocio el dinero restante lo quiere para comprar accesorios para su  negocio    como: tijeras, tinte para el cabello, sillas, etc.

El sueño de ella es que su calle sea pavimentada y que su hijo pueda terminar su carrera escolar.
texts.en: Estefanía, 21, is a hardworking, honest woman who has known how to earn her living honorably.  Her business is a beauty salon located in the front part of her house.  She started this activity taking several courses.  She’s a single mother of a five-year-old son.  Her difficulty is dust because in the area where she lives the street is unpaved and this affects her clientele quite a bit.  She asks for the loan to expand, improve and enlarge the business.  She will use any money left over to buy supplies for the business like scissors, hair color, chairs, etc.  Her dream is that her street is paved and that her son can finish his schooling.

loans.use: to buy furniture, scissors and hair color.

loans.name: Manua

texts.en:
Manua is 27 years of age and married with one child. Manua owns & operates a business venture, driving a taxi.  She has 2 years of experience in this business.  Manua needs a loan of WST $1500 to renew vehicle license.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Manua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Manua's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to renew vehicle license

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga is a loving husband and father of three. He lives in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent, in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business. His two oldest children live independently and the youngest one is a school student. 

Gantulga started his business making wooden furniture at home in 2002. His furniture is well known for its quality and design. His wife sells his furniture in the market. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says "I have done everything I can to support my children. Now that they are old enough, it is time to concentrate on my business." 

He is requesting 2,000,000 Mongolian Tugrik (MNT) to buy wood, panelling and an oven.

loans.use: to buy wood, panelling and an oven.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр живет и трудится в Каменке. Он занимается сельским хозяйством и, в частности, выращивает ранние овощи: помидоры и редис на продажу. У Александра есть два участка земли: на одном – большая теплица, на втором – две построенных и еще одну строит. Каждый год Александр садит 5 000 высокорослых помидор. В сельскохозяйственном бизнесе он уже 9 год. На данный момент Александр уже вложил в хозяйство 65 000 гривен. Затраты на семена и пленку ежегодно составляют 30 000 гривен. 

Александр планирует использовать кредит КИВА в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закончить строительство дополнительной теплицы, купить пленку и установить отопление в уже существующих теплицах. Недавно купив участок в 10 соток, Александр планирует развиваться за счет него и строить там новые дополнительные теплицы. Это позволит ему расширить хозяйство и увеличить доход.   
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Alexander lives and works in Kamenka.  He is involved in agriculture and grows various vegetables, such as tomatoes and radishes, for sale.  Alexander has two plots of land, one of which has a large greenhouse and the other has two completed and one unfinished greenhouse.  He plants 5,000 tall tomatoes every year.  He has been in the agricultural business for the ninth year now.  Alexander invested 65,000 hryvnia into his business to-date.  His annual expenses for seeds and plastic is 30,000 hryvnia.  Alexander plans to use the Kiva loan of 15,000 hryvnia to complete the construction of the additional greenhouse, buy plastic and install heating in the existing greenhouses.  Having recently bought a land plot of 10 sotkas, Alexander plans to grow there and build additional greenhouses.  This will allow him to expand his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to complete the construction of the additional greenhouse, buy plastic and install heating in the existing greenhouses

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a farmer and has been growing and selling rice for 19 years. Ignacia earns 6000 PHP each month doing this farming. She does her best to support her family and send her children to school.

Ignacia requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Ignacia hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Faavale

texts.en:
Faavale is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Asau Vaovai. She is married and has no chlidren. Faavale owns and operates a business making and selling fried foods in the local community.  Faavale has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 600 WST a month from it.

In 2010, Faavale joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Faavale has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD, which was used to invest in expanding the business.  Faavale is now requesting her second loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Faavale plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Besta

texts.en:
Besta is 40 year-old a married woman with two children. one of them is in school.  She has had a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Besta is requesting this loan through Kiva partner BRAC South Sudan in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan is 48 years old and a loving mother of three single children. She resides in the Prey Chor district of the Kompong Cham province. She is in two businesses: cultivating rice and recycling used materials. After she has just finished the bustle of her farming work, Kan intends to invest her time in collecting the recycled materials from place to place around her commune.

However, she doesn't own a motorcycle for long distance travelling. To solve that problem, she decided to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to make good progress in her recycling business. She'll keep the remaining funds as capital to buy recycled materials. She hopes that her business will grow and make her a good income to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina is 35 years old and married. She has four children and two of them are in school. 

She has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan, for five years.

Edina is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oranges, avocados, kale, tomatoes, pineapples, plums, bananas and mangoes.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is a resident of Birere, in Isingiro District, with four biological children all in school. She started a small retail shop some 20 years back but could not yield anything because of limited capital. That is when she got to know about Ugafode Microfinance and acquired a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX), which helped increase her retail business's growth, and because of her hard work she continued expanding and eventually made enough money and started building a residential house for her children. Now she is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to buy construction materials to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Maria de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales de gallinas, tiene 12 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, por esa razón posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Maria esta solicitando nuevamente otro crédito para la compra de gallinas, maíz, verduras, tomates entre otros ingredientes que utiliza y asi poder continuar con sus venyas ya que le genern buenas ganancias.

loans.use: para la compra de gallinas, maíz, verduras, tomates entre otros ingredientes

loans.name: Karina Liliana

texts.en:
Karina is an engaging and hard working woman with two small children aged 5 and 2 years. She found herself needing to start her own business to support her family and provide them with the basic necessities. Karina sells used clothing and she has been doing so for more thna a year now, a business she opes to expand with the income she earns.

She requires a loan of $200 to buy more used clothing and to increase the variety of items she has for sale. Karina hopes that this will help her increase her sales and allow her to expand her business. She is grateful for your help and your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Karina es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora tiene dos pequeños hijos de 5 y 2 años, ella se vio en la necesidad de emprender su negocio para apoyar a su propia familia de tal forma que desea tener un mayor ingreso para cubrir con las necesidades básicas de la familia. Karina se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y tiene más de un año en este negocio, por lo que ella espera que crezca y que día con día sus ingresos aumenten.

Ella requiere de $200 USD para comprar mercancía como ropa usada para aumentar la variedad de artículos que tiene a la venta, ya que Karina espera que de esta forma sus ventas se incrementen y su negocio vaya a crecer. Ella espera de tu ayuda y generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en:
This 37-year-old man is married and has 2 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Kurdmahmudlu village.
5 years ago Ilgar decided to start cattle breeding .
Having borrowed $600 he bought 3 calves.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 5 calves and improve his business. 
His business success will allow him to cover his family expenses.

loans.use: To buy 5 calves

loans.name: Ellsie

texts.en: Ellsie is a mother of two children.  She is twenty-nine years old.  She admits that the income from her business determines whether her children have enough to eat and can stay in school or not and that this creates a lot of pressure for her to be a successful businesswoman.  Ellsie buys handicrafts and clothing handmade by local villagers and resells their products at the larger market in town.  She says that her business is suffering from competition because there are so many nearby stalls that sell similar goods.  Ellsie is thus applying for a loan from SPBD.  Her plan is to use loan funds in order to purchase merchandise that can differentiate her product line from her nearby competitors.  SPBD is confident that loan funds combined with Ellsie’s ingenuity will ensure that the income stream from her stall remains healthy.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her flea market stall

loans.name: Maria Sanjuana

texts.es:
Maria is originally from the town of Escobedo, in the Mexican state of Nuevo León. She's married and has two children, ages 16 and 25. Her husband is a teacher at a local school, but his salary isn't sufficient for them to afford the children's education. Out of necessity, five years ago Maria started selling used clothing, and little by little she has increased her supplies and her sales. Now she has posts in three local markets.

In order to keep her business growing, Maria is requesting a loan of $475, which she will use to buy more clothing for resale. This will allow her to offer a wider selection to her customers. She plans to repay the loan within six months. You can be an important part in improving the quality of life for Maria and her family. They are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Maria es originaria de la localidad de Escobedo, Nuevo León, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 16 y 25 años de edad. Su esposo se desempeña como profesor en una escuela de la localidad pero su salario no era suficiente para poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, ante esta necesidad, desde hace cinco años Maria inició con la venta de ropa usada, poco a poco fue surtiendo más mercancía e incrementando sus ventas, ahora ya se instala en tres mercados rodantes.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio Maria necesita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía, esto le permitirá ofrecerle a sus clientes una mayor variedad y promete devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de mejorar.

loans.use: Purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Gloria Rodrigues

texts.pt:
Gloria is single, in addition to being a teacher in a rural school she also sells used clothes. This is the first time she is requesting a loan, she plans on using this loan to buy construction material and buy more used clothes to resell. She sells them in a market in XaXai. She does not have children yet, but with her business she hopes to be able to help her future husband in supporting the family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria e solteira e e professora numa escola em uma zona rural.Para alem de ser professora ela tem o negocio de venda de roupa usada. e Faz este negocio durante o tempo em que nao esta a trabalhar.E a primeira vez que vai tomar dinheiro emprestado. Ela pretende usar este valor para juntar com os poucos rendimentos que ela tem para a compra de materia de construcao e adquirir mais fardos de roupa usada para a venda. Ela faz o seu negocio num mercado localizado na cidade de Xai-Xai.Ela ainda nao tem filhos. Pensa um dia casar ter e filhos. Com o seu negocio podera apoiar o possivel futuro marido nas despesas do lar.

loans.use: buy construction material and increase inventory

loans.name: Zibeyda

texts.en: Zibeyda M. lives with her husband and two children in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. Zibeyda’s husband (her husband is pictured) makes doors and fances in his yard from iron. He has ten years experience in this business. They need a $1200 loan to buy more materials for their job.

loans.use: Zibeyda would like to expand her husband's door- and fence-making business.

loans.name: Mulivai Ah

texts.en: Mulivai Ah P. is thirty-two years of age and is married with three kids. Her husband works as a carpenter and this is the only source of income for the family. Mulivai heard about SBPD loans and she thought that this would be the best opportunity for her to join in. Mulivai likes flowers and planting flower plants, and this is why she thought that this could be the way of putting her imagination into action. This is her first loan to start up the business and she said that she will make good use of this loan. She has three kids who are attending the village primary school, and she will make sure that these loans help them succeed in the future.

loans.use: To buy a spade, pots, plastic bags, wheel barrow, and a hoist for irrigation for her flower garden

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en: My name is Shazia S.. I have very good members in my loan group and we are responsible for each other's loans. I have two daughters who are not of school age yet. I am acquiring credit for the third time from Asasah, a microfinance institution in Pakistan. My husband has a construction business and I perform my household chores and take care of my kids. I request a loan for my brother who makes light arrangements on weddings and other various occasions. I would like to borrow in a group with a few women.They are: Naseem B., who needs a loan to buy cattle; Nusrat B., who will use this loan to expand their sanitary store and buy items such as taps, pipes etc.; Jameela B., who will use this loan for their construction business; and Rafia B., who requests this loan for her husband who is a constructor. I believe we all will be able to pay off your loans on time.

loans.use: To expand current business

loans.name: Urozaly

texts.ru:
Urozaly I. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 52 years old, is married and has 8 children. He has a high school diploma. Urozaly has an animal rearing business. He would like to receive a loan in order to purchase young calves, which he will then feed and then resell. This is the only way to obtain income for Urozaly's family. Additionally, support of private animal rearing businesses gives an opportunity to develop the whole economic sector, which helps to keep meat prices stable. The client plans to repay his loan within 3 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Имомназаров Урозали Арзикулович житель города Яван. 52 года ,женат ,имеет 8 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Кредит запрашивает для того.чтобы купить бычков для откормки и последующей их реализации.Этот вид бизнеса является единственным источником дохода его семьи.Так же развитие животноводства в частном порядке дает возможность развитию всего сектора, что позволяет сохранять цены на мясо.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 3 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of young calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in the buy of raw materials to produce food for a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru:
Bahodur Homirzoev lives in Shahrinav region of Tajikistan. He is 32 years old, married and has 2 children. To provide for his family Bahodur has been managing his own business for the last 6 years. He owns a cafe where he makes kebobs and bakes sambusas (fried pastry with meat filling). Recently the prices for flour have been rising and Bahodur wants to buy a large batch of flour so that he can keep his food prices low despite the rising flour costs. This will help him keep his regular customers and attract new ones. But he needs money to be able to purchase such a large batch of flour. That is why Bahodur has planned to take out a loan of 450 dollars which he wants to pay back in the next 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Холмирзоев Баходур Проживает в районе Шахринау. Ему 32 года. Баходур женат и имеет 2 детей. Для того , чтобы обеспечить свою семью клиент занимается бизнесом. Имеет свое дело.Имеет столовую ,где готовит шашлыки и выпекает самбусу. Занимается этим видом бизнеса Баходур уже 6 лет. В связи с увеличением цен на муку ему необходимо закупить и запастись данным видом сырья, для того чтобы сохранить цены на предлагаемую продукцию. Это поможет клиенту сохранить постоянных клиентов и привлечь новых. Для этого ему нужны деньги. И поэтому он запланировал получить кредит в размере 450 долларов. Погасить кредит он сможет в течение 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to buy more clothing for sale

loans.name: Jamil

texts.es:
Jamil works as an independent auditor and accountant. He lives in the Pampahasi neighborhood in La Paz, Bolivia. This is the fourth loan he requests at Impro. His credit history earns him a grade of client 1, that is, a person who has met his payments well. The loan will be used to pay for registration and tuition of Auditing refresher courses, which will enhance his resume and work conditions. His work and sense of responsibility have given him the opportunity to obtain this loan, because he has responsibly met his financial obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva tranlator

Jamil trabaja como auditor independiente y también realiza trabajos de contabilidad. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz.. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El crédito será destinado para el pago de estudios de actualización en la rama de auditoria y así mejorar sus currículo y condiciones laborales. Su trabajo, y responsabilidad le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito ya que es una persona responsable en el pago de sus obligaciones.

loans.use: Registration and tuition for Auditing refresher courses

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos is a producer of cow milk at the same company that sells PIL, and he also sells beef in nearby communities. These activities are his main source of income to cover the expenses of his three children and wife.

He lives in the community of Akjerana - Achacachi (three and a half hours from La Paz).

The credit will be allocated for the purchase of a medium-sized cow to increase milk production.

This is his second credit with Impro, and the loan requested by Marcos has been approved due to good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcos, es productor de leche de vaca, la misma que comercializa en la empresa PIL, también comercializa ganados vacunos al por menor en las comunidades cercanas a la de él; estas actividades son su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos y esposa.

Vive en la Comunidad de Akjerana - Achacachi (A tres horas y media de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche.

Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar el préstamo solicitado por Marcos.

loans.use: To purchase a medium dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Mary is a 40-year-old married woman with three children. She owns and operates a beauty salon that she just established four months ago. By working 13 hours a day for six days every week, she is already showing a monthly profit of $US200 from the salon! Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own.

Mary is requesting a loan $US275 to buy additional supplies such as hair dryers and other hair products for her store, which will allow her to serve more customers and generate additional income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies for her beauty salon

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: KHADY B. est une femme commerçante née le 05/01/1956 à bambey .elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants au quarier leona de bambey .depuis presque huit ans elle vend au détail de l'encens qu'elle mélange elle meme de façon artisanale.c'est dans le but de renforcer son stock de matieres premieres qu'elle sollicite ce pret afin de satisfaire sa clientèle pendant l'hivernage.
texts.en:
Khady B. is a saleswoman born on January 5, 1956 in Bambey. She lives with her husband and children in the Leona neighborhood of Bambey. As an artisan, she has been making her own incense and selling it as retail for almost eight years. She is requesting this loan in order to strengthen her supply of raw materials and satisfy her clients during the winter season.

Translated from French by Erin Johnson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incense sales

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en: Chhon S., 26, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the Siem Reap province. Since 2004, she has been selling many kinds of vegetables to earn a living and is able to make about $3 USD each day. Her husband, Lon Chan, 26, typically makes about $5 USD from a motor-taxi business. Chhon S. would like to take out a loan of $1000 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run his business. In the future, if she has enough money, she will purchase a store in the market where she will be able to attract more customers.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Truy

texts.en:
Mr. Truy V. lives in Sream Chieng Village in Kampong Cham Province. He has a hectar on which he cultivates rice, which allows him to earn a living. He now faces a small problem because his field is infertile, which makes it difficult to grow his crop. To solve this problem, he has decided to request a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and make his crop more productive.

His wife Mrs. Phal Svoeun helps him on the plantation.

Mr. Truy V. is 37 years old and the father of four children. Three of the children attend the local school. The youngest child is only two months old.

His wife is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support his field

loans.name: Yola

texts.es: Yola tiene 19 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo de 5 añitos, vive en la casa de su madre. Desde los 16 años trabajaba en un restaurante como ayudante de cocina, pero hace un año decidió poner una tienda donde vende, alquila y reproduce CDs de música y películas. Este negocio, por el momento, le es muy rentable porque no tiene competidor, ella siempre añoró ese tipo de negocio. Su esposo trabaja en la chacra y cuando ya no tiene que cultivar le ayuda en el negocio, la dificultad primaria es que no cuenta con el capital necesario para surtir su negocio y convertirlo en un espacio más atractivo y acogedor. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero piensa comprar varios millares de CDs en blanco y películas de todas los tipos.
texts.en:
Yola, 19, is partnered and has a 5 year old son. She lives with her mother. When she was 16 years old, she started working in a restaurant as an assistant to the cook, but a year ago she decided to set up a shop where she sells, rents and reproduces music and movie CDs. For now, the business is very profitable because she doesn't have any competitors. She always yearned for this kind of business. Her husband is a farm laborer and when he's not working, he helps her with her business. Her main obstacle now is that she doesn't have enough capital to stock the business or make the space she uses for it more attractive and inviting. This is her first loan with MFP. With the money, she plans to buy a few thousand blank CDs and movies of all kinds.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy CDs for resale.

loans.name: Sematu

texts.en:
Sematu A. is married with four children. She is a 53-year-old entrepreneur. She runs a mother care shop and has been selling assorted kiddies' wear and mother-care materials like diapers, napkins, Pampers, soaps, etc. for three years now. She lives with her family at Atebubu.

Atebubu is a farming community; people there are mainly into farming crops such as maize, beans, and groundnuts. Sematu identifies mother-care products to be the things most mothers require. Her business started on a small scale, as she was thinking that her market size would be static. Upon the advice of an officer on how to treat and retain a customer, she has lived on that advice which is working for her business. And now she can boast of an increase in her market size.

Sematu does not have sufficient working capital to run the business as her customers are increasing. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to scale up her business progress. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for that assistance when it is given to her, and she says this would help her to save more for taking care of her kids in school. She is member of the group called ‘Ahobrase’ meaning Humility Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy more napkins, diapers, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Jama Khan

texts.en:
Jama Khan lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan; he is married with three children and he is a wood seller. He needs a small loan for his brother’s business because he is new in this business. 

He has requested an individual loan of 42000 Afghani for a term of 17 months; he wants to make his business larger and expand it. Also, he wants to complete the inventory of his business and buy necessary materials for his shop.

Jama Khan is really happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders and AFSG in Afghanistan.

loans.use: complete the inventory of his business and buy necessary materials

loans.name: Lidya

texts.en:
Lidya is divorced and has two adult sons. She sells clothing at Pavlograd market. Her net income is 2,500 UAH per month.

Lidya has been in this business for 3 years. Being a very entrepreneurial person she wants to increase her sales. To do this she wants to open a second sales place and sell different products there. It is almost like starting a new business. For this Lidya needs 4,000 UAH. Her business is the only income she has and her goal is to make it as stable as possible.

loans.use: to open second location

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Married with two children, Ruth G. is a fifty-one-year-old trader. She trades in maize. She has been trading for the past twenty years and has been very resourceful to her family. She treks to the farming communities such as Techieman in the Brong Ahafo region to buy her foodstuffs and retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She hopes to receive GHS 700 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her children in school. Ruth belongs to a village bank called ‘Enoch’.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cheese and animals to sell.

loans.name: Rusia M.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 22-year-old Rusia J. from Kyela. She is married with one child, age 8. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents died of HIV.  Rusia has been running a cocoa business since 2008. She buys cocoa from farmers and sells them in town for a higher price. She works at the business for 9 - 12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Rusia currently earns about 120 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more cocoa in bulk. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business. Rusia thanks you for your support!
ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more cocoa in bulk

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina es socia del Banco Manuela Ramos del Distrito de Mazocruz, Provincia del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 68 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 4 hijos.  Vive en el Barrio 3 de Mayo. Es iletrada (analfabeta).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 11 año, es socia fundadora e inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de carne de chancho y verduras.
En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo, el cual solicitará por el monto de 1000.00 Nuevos Soles para comprar mayor cantidad de carne y mas verduras y así  ampliar su negocio.
Ella piensa seguir trabajando para su vejez.  Manifiesta que le gusta mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alejandrina is a member of Kiva partner Manuela Ramos Bank in the district of Mazocruz, province of Collao, department of Puno. She is 68 years old, married, has four children, lives in the May 3rd neighborhood and is illiterate. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 11 years and was a founding member who began with a loan of 300 new soles, which allowed her to increase her capital for her business selling pork and vegetables. Currently she needs a new loan, which she is requesting in the amount of 1,000 new soles to buy a greater quantity of meat and more vegetables, so she can expand her business. She plans on working into old age. She says that she enjoys the communal bank meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pork and vegetables

loans.name: Domitila Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz es socia del Banco Comunal “Yunga Uyo” situado en el Distrito de Yunguyo, la  provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, estado civil casada y tiene 9 hijos. Vive en el Barrio Bolognesi,  ella tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (2do grado). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de artículos de abarrotes como betunes, jaboncillo, tijeras, candados, pilas, champús, hilos, etc.   Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, podrá comprar variedades de productos como betunes, jaboncillo, tijeras, candados, pilas, champús e hilos en mayor cantidad.
Su mayor deseo es poner una tienda para vender al por mayor y generarse mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the Yunga Uyo community bank, which is located in the Yunguyo district, Chucuito province, Puno department. She is 50, married, and has nine children. She lives in the Bolognesi neighborhood. She has a second grade education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. She sells grocery store items like shoe polish, soap, scissors, padlocks, batteries, shampoo, thread, etc. Her first loan was for 300 PEN. With this loan for 1,500 PEN, she will be able to buy a variety of items like shoe polish, soap, scissors, padlocks, batteries, shampoo, and thread in larger quantities. Her greatest wish is to set up a store to sell wholesale and generate greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy shoe polish, soap, scissors, padlocks, batteries, shampoo, and thread

loans.name: Abdulmumin

texts.ru: Эргашев Абдумумин проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 36 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Абдумумин более 10 лет занимется животноводством т.е. откормом и перепродажей скота. Ему по бизнесу помогают дети. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы купить скотину.
texts.en:
Abdulmumin E. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. He is 36 years old, married, and has three children. Abdumumin has raised livestock for over 10 years, specifically he feeds and resells animals. His children help with the business. This client is requesting a loan to use to purchase animals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Cheikh Mbacké

texts.fr: Cheikh Mbacké M. est un mareyeur qui a ses activités au niveau du port de pêche de Mbour ville de la petite côte. Il vend du poisson et des fruits de mer aux hôtels et les usines de transformation. Ce prêt lui permettra d’augmenter ses achets de marchandises sur les pirogues afin de les revendre. Ce métier lui permet de nourrir sa famille.
texts.en:
Cheikh Mbacké M. is a fish wholesaler at the fishing harbor of Mbour, along the Petite Côte. He sells fish and seafood to hotels and transformation factories. This loan will enable him to buy larger amount of fish on the pirogues, and to sell more. This job enables him to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large amount of fish for reselling

loans.name: Las Activas Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal "Las Activas" representadas por la señora Lucia  y conformadas por 12 miembros dentro D. las cuales existe un parentesco entre la señora Jacqueline y Roxana, Ambas con ingresos totalmente independientes una D. la otra. En general las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como cosméticos, comida, zapatos, abarrotes, otros D. los miembros se dedican a la elaboración D. prendas D. vestir y al servicio D. transporte público. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas D. trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. Las socias cuentan con experiencia crediticia ya que algunas ya trabajaron en nuestra institución y van cursando su segundo ciclo y los miembros nuevos conocen la modalidad del crédito solidario.
texts.en:
The members of the cooperative bank “Las Activas” are represented by Mrs. Lucia and up to twelve other members. (Jacqueline and Roxana are related although their income is completely independent of one another.) In general, the members sell products such as cosmetics, food, shoes and groceries. Other members make clothes or proviD. public transportation. The member’s experience in the commercial realm is high. They know how to move forward thanks to their experience and work ethic. The purpose of the loan is for the acquisition of materials, goods and tools that help them generate the largest income. The money will help them to support their families. The members have credit experience as some work in our institution and are in the second cycle of their studies. The new members know about the modality of individual loans.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a 42-year-old mother to Zoe, her 12-year-old boy. She is married to Pepe who is a rickshaw driver and a 41-year-old responsible husband. She lives in the busy town of Teresa, which is in the Rizal province of the Philippines.

Since Florencia was young, she always promised herself that if she had her own family she would do everything possible to rise above poverty.  In 2002, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines in hopes of borrowing capital for her business. Her previous loans have been carefully utilized as capital for her sari-sari store (general store). Also part of her loans were for maintenance on their rickshaw. Together their businesses bring enough earnings to cover their daily needs.

Now Florencia requests her 11th loan, in the amount of 30,000 pesos, to use as additional capital for her store and for the maintenance of her husband's rickshaw. She hopes that with the help of ASHI and KIVA, she can reach her dreams for her child to go to school until college. She also aspires of making her sari-sari store into a grocery store.

loans.use: As additional capital for her store as well as rickshaw maintenance.

loans.name: Marry

texts.en:
Marry is a member of the Mlandege borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 29 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.

Marry started her own clothing business selling used clothes 2 years ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Marry`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more used clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan Marry hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Mirzomahmad

texts.en: M. Mirzomahmad, 50, is a farmer. He is very experienced in this business as he has been farming since 2003. He is married with six children and his elder son and wife help him with the business. Unfortunately Mirzomahmad's farmland is infertile, so he is in need of a loan in the amount of 3,000 Somoni to purchase seeds and fertilizer to use on his crop. He hopes the loan will allow him to increase his crop above and beyond what it was in previous years. As for his future plan, Mirzomahmad wants all of his children to go to university and to get good jobs. Be an important part of the well-being of this humble family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Vanna Nob Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna N. owns a small restaurant. She is also a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. M. Touch, is an administrator in the garment factory. Mrs. Vanna N. is 48 years old and the mother of five children: two of them are employed in a garment factory, while another is a beautician and the others are attending the local school. Now she is requesting a loan to buy grocery products to sell and fertilizer for the rice field.

Mrs. Vanna N. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. Eighteen people, who are all living in Kdol village in Takeo province, make up this village bank loan. They will each use the loan for different purposes. All of the members are in the photo (some of them are blocked by others).

Five members in this group loan have end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those with EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. EoT loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy grocery products to sell and fertilizer

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a 47-year-old woman living in Consuelo, a small town near San Pedro de Macorís, Dominican Republic. Rosalia has three children, but all have moved out of her home. Her youngest is 20 years old, and Rosalia is helping send her to university to study communications. Rosalia will use the loan to pay for a brand new bathroom that has been built behind her home.

Currently, Rosalia has a frituria (fried food stand) on the main street near her home. Here, she makes johnnycakes and other goodies for her neighbors and those working in or around the businesses on the street. She also sells coffee and tea to those on their way to and from work. Rosalia’s frituria is very popular, and the locals are always quick to grab a treat from her.

Rosalia lives in a neighborhood without many utilities. Living in a small town in the Dominican Republic can mean frequent power outages (if you have power to begin with), no plumbing, and insufficient shelter from the elements. Having a new bathroom has made her home more sanitary both for herself and for the preparation of food for the morning rush at her frituria. Having a bathroom means she has one less thing to worry about in her day to day activities. This is Rosalia’s seventh loan in five years with Esperanza, and her first housing development loan. Thank you for lending to Rosalia!

loans.use: Construction of new bathroom to make home more sanitary for food prep

loans.name: Lakisa

texts.en: M. Lakisa is forty years old, has a family of five and owns a shop selling clothes specifically men's trousers, ties, shirts, t-shirts, belts, etc. The shop is located at Kasese main market in Kasese Town. She operates her business in a rental house but hopes to own her permanent shop some day. Lakisa dreams of developing her retail shop into a wholesale business but has little funds at present. She is requesting this loan to add capital into her business and purchase more supplies of men's clothes so that she can increase her profits and achieve her dream in near future.

loans.use: To add capital into her business and purchase more supplies of men's clothing, for example trousers, ties, shirts, t-shirts, belts, etc

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 32 years old. She is widowed and the mother of two who are both in school. Doris lost her husband through a prolonged sickness although she fought with all her money to give him life. Right now, all family responsibilities rest on her shoulders.

Doris prepares and serves her customers pastries like meat pie and doughnuts. She prepares them in bulk and sells through hawking (selling on foot) in the community market and its surroundings. She takes delivery of stock like flour, sugar, vegetable oil, etc., from Kade market.

Doris requests the loan assistance to buy stock to remain in business. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy flour, margarine, sugar, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Ra Kum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
