Twelve people who are all living in Tonle Bati village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Ra K. is the village bank president who has been selected the members. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Ra K. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from farming this plantation, she sells fish caught by her husband, Mr. Pun Chroeng, who is a fisherman.

With his fishing, Mr. Pun Chroeng faces an obstacle because he does not have enough fishing nets and this affects his income. Thus, Mrs. Ra K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishing nets for her husband’s fishing.

Mrs. Ra K. is 44 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets for her husband

loans.name: Amara

texts.en:
Mr. Amara C., 27, is single and lives with his siblings and parents (his mother is pictured) along National Road number one about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Mr. Amara C. has been a construction contractor for 7 years. He does not have enough materials to operate his business, so he is asking for his first loan of $1,200 to purchase additional construction materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia de 32 años, vive junto a su esposo Eladio de 38 años y sus dos hijos Elena de 13 y Ever de 7 años, en su propia casa, Ella es una mujer muy luchadora y aunque solo pudo acabar la primaria esta dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para darles a sus hijos unos buenos estudios. A pesar de las variaciones climáticas Lidia sale desde muy temprano en compañía de su esposo a conseguir leche que ordeñaron los ganaderos, para luego dedicarse a la preparación de quesos y que posteriormente son vendidos en los mercados de Juliaca y Huancane. Ella disfruta mucho de su trabajo, y por lo que lleva haciendo esta actividad más 10 años y considera que lo más difícil es conseguir la cantidad de leche necesaria para preparar los 30 quesos que produce diariamente. Lo que más anhela Lidia es tener una tienda muy grande en la ciudad de Juliaca  donde pueda vender sus deliciosos quesos con más tranquilidad. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y espera no fallar en los pagos de sus cuotas, asimismo ya se siente comprometida con sus demás compañeras de su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, incrementará su capital de trabajo, para así poder comprar más leche y mejorar los implementos con los que prepara sus quesos.
texts.en:
Lidia is 32 years old. She lives with her 38 year old husband, Eladio, and their two children, Elena, age 13, and Ever, age 7, in their own home. She is a fighter and although she only could finish primary school, she is prepared to work very hard to give her children a good education. Despite the climatic variations, Lidia leaves very early with her husband to obtain milk that the livestock farmers milked. She then prepares cheeses which are sold afterward in the Juliaca and Huancane markets. Lidia enjoys a lot about her work. From doing this activity for over 10 years, she believes that the hardest part is obtaining the amount of milk needed to prepare the 30 cheeses that she produces daily. What Lidia longs for the most is to have a very large store in the city Juliaca where she could sell her delicious cheeses with more ease. This is her first loan with MFP and she hopes not to miss payments of her fees. She also already feels committed to her other companions from her village bank. With the thousand nuevos soles requested, she will increase her working capital so that she can purchase more milk and improve the tools with which she prepares her cheeses.

Translated from Spanish by Elycia Mulholland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more milk and tools to prepare cheeses

loans.name: Tawab Qasemy Group

texts.en:
Ghancha is the group leader of the Tawab Q. group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for her/his business. Ghancha is a married woman with four children. She wants to take a loan for her husband's business of selling dried fruits. He wants to make his business better.

Bibi Sema wants to take a loan for her business, which is performing tailoring in her house. After the loan, she wants to make a new shop for her business and buy necessary items for her business. 

A. Tawob wants to take a loan for his business of selling clothes. He wants to buy original clothes for his shop and wants to expand and progress his business.

They want to thank all lenders for this process in Afghanistan. And they also thank the AFSG for supporting poor people.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María Elena S. de 49 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Martín, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y un hijo, el cual se dedica a estudiar. Ella cuenta con 7 años de dedicarse a la venta y elaboración de tortillas y pupusas, dos tipos de alimentos, los cuales son muy básicos en la alimentación diaria de los salvadoreños. Razón por la cual María solicita un préstamo, ya que desea poder invertir más en su negocio, comprando mayor cantidad de maíz, arroz, frijoles, chicharrón y todos los productos necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos. Debido a que es la única venta de tortillas y pupusas que esta ubicada en las cercanías de su hogar, ella cuenta con mucha demanda por parte de clientes los cuales compran en ese lugar debido a la dedicación que Maria tiene para elaborar sus productos. Tanto María como su esposo y su hijo, dependen en gran manera de este negocio, debido a que es el que les permite solventar gran parte de sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
. María Elena S., 49, lives in San Martín, San Salvador department, with her husband and son, who is in school. She has sold tortillas and pupusas (maize dumplings) for 7 years; these are two types of food that are basic to the Salvadoran daily diet. Maria needs funding to invest more in her business by buying larger amounts of corn, rice, beans, chicharrón (fried pork) and all the other ingredients needed to make her products. Because this is the only business of its type in her surrounding area, demand for her products is high especially because Maria shows so much dedication in making them. María, as well as her husband and son, depend to a great degree on this business because it provides for a large part of family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, rice, beans and chicharrón (fried pork).

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en el Distrito de Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 41 años, es madre de 2 hijos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a administrar su bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su vivienda, es divorciada. Patricia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas 2”, desde hace 4 años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido  en la compra de gaseosas.
Con este crédito de 500 soles, comprará productos para su bodega como arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. La meta de Patricia es ampliar su negocio y seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Patricia is a very hardworking woman. She lives in the Calleria District of the Ucayali region. She is 41 years old, divorced, and the mother of 2 adult children. She runs a grocery store out of her home. Patricia has been a member of the “Las Golondrinas 2” Community Bank for 4 years. The first loan that she received was for 300 soles which she used to buy soft drinks. With this loan of 500 soles she will buy products for her store, such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc. Patricia's goal is to continue progressing and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her store, such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc

loans.name: Basooka Kwavula Group, Mukono

texts.en: N. Harriet at the top left also appears in the group photo and she is the leader of her group in Mukono. She is 40 years old and married with 3 children as she takes care of her parents. She deals in the selling of fresh fish from Kame market in Mukono and the biggest challenge she has is finding the ice to preserve her fish. She has been in the business for 7 years and she is able to make some profits that enable her take good care of her family and boosting her business. Harriet is good at handling her customers and her goal is to expand her business further and have different stalls from which to transact her business. She needs a loan to help her with a bulk purchase of fish from the fishermen on the lakes.

loans.use: Purchasing fish in bulk.

loans.name: Elda

texts.es:
La Sra. Elda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 35 años y 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella y están en etapa escolar.

Su espíritu luchador que siempre le  ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de productos de belleza de la línea Unique, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y moradores de la comunidad, hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. 
Con su primer crédito de 300 Nuevos Soles, Elda implemento más su negocio, comprando productos para su stock cómo, perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños, cremas de manos y cuerpo, lápices labiales y mucho más y así satisfacer a su clientela. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,300.00 Nuevos Soles comprará; Productos para su stock, cómo, colonias para bebes, talco de cuerpo y pies, etc. Cuenta con clientela sofisticada que a diario acuden a su casa a realizar sus pedidos.

Elda, se siente una mujer feliz, por su trabajo que a diario lo realiza  y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Elda, 35, is a member of the “Las Orquídeas” (The Orchids) communal bank, which is in Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is married and has two children, both of whom are school-aged and still dependent on her. Her tenacious spirit and wish to get ahead through her own efforts led her to start selling Unique brand beauty products. Gradually she became better known among her customers and residents of the community. Today she tells us that she does well with this type of commercial activity. She used her initial, 300 new sol, loan to stock her business; she bought such items as: perfumes for women, men and children, hand and body creams, lipsticks, and much more to satisfy her customer demand. She will use this 1,300.00 new sol loan to buy stock items, such as: colognes for infants, body and feet powder, etc. She has a sophisticated client base that come by her house daily to place orders. Elda is a woman that is happy with the work she does every day and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to her meeting her goals and having her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Elena Elisa

texts.es:
Elena P. de 27 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, es madre soltera ella tiene 3 hijos. 

Elena inicio vendiendo  ropa por catalogo y haciendo trabajos de gabinete. En la actualidad sale desde muy temprano ha ofrecer sus servicios de estilista, va personalmente ha la casa del cliente a hacer pedicure, manicure, cortes de cabello, etc. Aunque otro ingreso que tiene es un pequeño puesto de ropa, sigue buscando más oportunidades de crecer en sus negocios para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos. 

Una de las dificultades que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector por donde vive, pero con el préstamo quiere construir mejor su casa para más seguridad.

En el futuro quiere poder construir mejor su casa y incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elena P., 27, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil; her house is cement and has all basic utilities. She is a single mother of three children. Elena started out selling catalogue clothing and doing beauty salon work. Currently, she goes out very early in the morning to offer her services as a stylist. She goes personally to the customer’s home to do pedicures, manicures, haircuts, etc. Even though she has another source of income, a small clothing sales stall, she continues to seek other opportunities for growth in her businesses in order to insure a better future for her children. One of the difficulties she faces is the high crime rate in her area; she wants to use the funds requested to build her house more securely. In the future, she would like to make her house more secure and increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Selvex

texts.es:
En el barrio la mercedes    Municipio de Somotillo 
El señor M. M.  realiza su trabajo como gestor aduanero (realiza los tramites legales para que den salida alos camiones con carga de la Aduana Guasaule el tiene sus propios clientes)
 El  quiere el crédito para comprar de  2 puertas para su casa de habitación y de esta manera dar seguridad para el y a su familia.
texts.en:
En el barrio la mercedes Municipio de Somotillo El señor M. M. realiza su trabajo como gestor aduanero (realiza los tramites legales para que den salida alos camiones con carga de la Aduana Guasaule el tiene sus propios clientes) El quiere el crédito para comprar de 2 puertas para su casa de habitación y de esta manera dar seguridad para el y a su familia.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de 2 puertas de hierro para su casa de habitación.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.es: LA SEÑORA FELISA ES MADRE SOLTERA Y TIENE UNA HIJA YA MAYOR, TIENE UNA EXPERIENCIA DE 23 AÑOS EN LO QUE ES LA VENTA DE ROPA, ELLA INICIALMENTE COMENZO EN UN PUESTO BASATANTE REDUCIDO EN LA PUERTA DEL QUE AHORA ES SU DOMICILIO. YA LUEGO DE SER MADRE SOLTERA  ELLA TENIA LA NECESIDAD DE GENERAR  ALGUN TIPO DE INGRESO NO TENIA NINGUNA ACTIVIDAD Y UNA DE SUS VECINAS LE DIO LA OPORTUNIDAD DE VENDER ROPA SE HIZO DE CAPITAL Y COMPRO MERCADERIA EMPEZO DE POCO PERO AHORA YA TIENE UNA TIENDA DONDE OFRECE SUS PRODUCTOS, FUE AHI DONDE LE NACIO LA POSIBILIDAD DE REALIZAR ESTE NEGOCIO, AHORA ELLA YA QUIERE ABRIR OTRA TIENDA DE ROPA DONDE SE ENCARGUE DE LA VENTA SU  HIJA, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA PARA ABRIR UNA NUEVA TIENDA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Felisa is a single mother who has a grown daughter. She has 23 years of experience selling clothing. She started out selling through a very small post at the door of what is now her home. Then, upon becoming a single mother, she needed to generate income and she didn't have any means to do so. One of her neighbors gave her the opportunity to sell clothing. She accumulated capital, and gradually bought merchandise. Now she has a store where she offers her products. It was there that she came up with the idea of this business. Now she wants to open another clothing store where her daughter will be in charge of sales. With the money from this loan, she will buy merchandise to open a new store. She is very grateful to Empreder and Kiva for the confidence provided in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Easter Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesswomen in the northern city of Makeni. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 800,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, feeding and clothing them. 

Kadiatu C. (pictured receiving the loan) is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni thirty-one years ago. Kadiatu is married and has two children. Her husband is a tailor and one of her children is attending primary school while the other is still a baby. 

Kadiatu sells slippers and clothes.  She has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying slippers and clothes to add to her current stock.

In the picture are members of the 'Easter' group and loan officer Daniel Banya, handing over the loan.

loans.use: Buy slippers and clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some necessary items for his shop

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal YANAPAKUY; La socia vive en el distrito de Santiago en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia Josefina tiene 25 años de edad y tiene 1 hijo de 4 años de edad, la socia es madre soltera y ella se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia vende ropa y también es dueña de un restaurante pequeño, ella alterna sus actividades de esta manera, la socia siempre vendía ropa a sus amistades y recientemente inauguró su restaurante, el sueño de ella es ahora poner una fotocopiadora frente a la universidad, este lugar le resulta estratégico por que los alumnos constantemente hacen uso de las fotocopiadoras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una fotocopiadora.
 
La socia agradece y valora infinitamente el crédito otorgado y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Yanapakuy Communal Bank. She lives in the Santiago district in the Cusco province, Cusco department. Our member, Josefina, is 25 years old and has a four year old son. She is a single mother. She is a commercial businesswoman, and she sells clothes. She also has a small restaurant. She alternates these activities. She always sold clothes to her friends, and she recently started her restaurant. Her dream now is to place a photocopier in front of the university. This is a strategic location because the students always use photocopiers. The member is infinitely grateful for and values the loan. She pledges to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a photocopier

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha Y. sells dessert at her house in the village; her husband, Mr. Sros Soeung, is a farmer. They have been married since 1993 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. Chantha has applied for a Kiva loan twice already (see here and here). Her second loan was used to purchase a motorbike for commuting. She now is asking for $1,000 as her third loan to buy another motorbike for her son to launch a motor taxi business. Chantha will also use a part of her loan to connect her house to a private electricity utility service.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to drive as a motor taxi and to connect her house to an electricity supply

loans.name: Annonciatha

texts.en:
Annonciatha is 27 years old and married. She has been in the business of selling new clothes and cosmetic goods for about eight years. The hours of her business are from 7 am to 6 pm every day.

Annonciatha needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. This loan will allow her to expand her business by purchasing different cosmetic goods and different sizes of modern clothes. With the use of this loan, Annonciatha will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will be used for reinvestment as well as for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for children of both sexes and cosmetic goods

loans.name: Brenda Group

texts.es:
El grupo Brenda lo conforman Brenda Irene B., Esther Martínez Mendoza y Martha Esperanza M. tres personas con deseos de salir adelante. La coordinadora, doña Brenda, se dedica desde hace 20 años al comercio de ropa y zapatos.

Las otras integrantes, Esther quien es la más novata en materia de comercio, se dedica a la venta de ropas usada apenas hace un año y Martha se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa usada desde hace 10 años. Ellas con el crédito otorgado invertirán más en materiales e insumos para mejorar sus negocios y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The group Brenda is made up of Brenda Irene B., Esther Martínez Mendoza and Martha Esperanza M., 3 people who want to move forward. The coordinator, Brenda, has been selling clothes and shoes for 20 years. The other members are Esther, who is a novice in the field of commerce, has worked selling used clothes for a year, and Martha has sold cosmetics and used clothes for 10 years. With the loan they are seeking the members will invest in more materials and products to improve their businesses and move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials and products

loans.name: Rafael Evaristo

texts.es: El señor Rafael Evaristo, el tiene 36 años de edad es casado y tiene 2 hijos de ocho y doce años cada uno. Su esposa trabaja como maestra en la escuela de la comarca El Aguacate. Rafael se dedica a la venta de recargas electrónicas y tarjetas de telefonía, el trabaja principalmente con la empresa Claro en una ruta establecida por la empresa, con un buen numero de ventas. Sus ventas las realiza principalmente al contado, las personas le llaman y el envió de la recarga, para después pasar recogiendo el efectivo que es entre 2 a 3 días después. El señor se introdujo en este negocio desde hace dos años, el cual empezó debido  a la falta de empleo de su parte. El está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de tarjetas telefónicas y recargas, a ser distribuido. Su sueño es llegar a aumentar el mercado de oferta, esto con el propósito de incrementar las ganancias percibidas por el señor y de esta manera apoyar más a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
Rafael Evaristo is 36 years old. He is married with two children, who are 8 and 12 years old. His wife works as a teacher at a school in the region of El Aguacate. Rafeal sells telephone cards and reloads phones with more call time [most phone plans in Latin America are pay-as-you-go]. He works primarily with the telephone company Claro on a route established by the company. He has good sale numbers. Most of his sales are done in cash. People call him and he reloads time on their phones. About two to three days later, he goes around collecting payment. Rafael began working in this business two years ago as he was then unemployed. Rafael is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of telephone cards, which he will distribute. His dream is to increase his product offerings to increase his profits, which will better allow him to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying telephone cards

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza es socia del Banco comunal “Chojchoni” desde hace tres años atrás, que pertenece al distrito de Copani, provincia Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con grado de instrucción primaria (incompleta), tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales tres son independientes.
Lorenza se dedica a la venta de llicllas que lleva a Bolivia, de mismo modo trae animales menores a lado Peruano, para comercializarlo. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1700.00 nuevos soles, para aumentar  mercadería de llicllas.
Su visión es llevar llicllas a Bolivia al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Lorenza has been a member of the community bank named Chojchoni for the past 3 years. she lives in the district of Copani in Yunguyo, Puno. She is 48 years old and she is married. She did not complete primary school. She has five children and of them, three are independent. Lorenza sells sarong wraps in Bolivia. The same way she brings small animals form the Peruvian side of the country for resale. The first loan requested from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) was in the amount of 300 nuevos soles and she used it to supplement her capital funds. She requests a new loan in the amount of 1700 nuevos soles to purchase more sarong wraps. Her dream is to sells wraps in wholesale in Bolivia. What she most enjoys about her community bank is the savings program.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sarong wraps.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy coffee husks for mulching the plantation

loans.name: Efua Aye Theresa

texts.en: Efua Aye Theresa T. sells "bodoo" (a local dish made from corn) and pineapple at Elmina. T. has no educational background. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a fisherman. T. has been in this business for two years. She responsibly supports her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare "bodoo" for distribution and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business in helping her husband take care of her children.

loans.use: buy more maize to prepare "bodoo" for distribution

loans.name: Joruls

texts.en: Joruls D. is currently in the business of selling beans, onions and sim sim seeds and is requesting a loan so she can stock more current items to sell. Joruls is 45 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has four children, two of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of items to sell

loans.name: Beteliana

texts.en:
Beteliana L. is from the village of Usocan. She is 45 years old. Beteliana is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Beteliana owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Beteliana has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Beteliana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beteliana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. Beteliana is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP that will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Beteliana from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un C., 31, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Un C. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of about USD 5 each per day. She has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 7 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month.

She is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Seydilda

texts.en:
Seydilda D. is a 54-year-old farmer and has three children. He graduated from agricultural college and worked as a tractor-driver in his local area. In order to support his family and find a means of subsistence, he decided to engage in cattle breeding and land cultivating with perennial herbs, which serve as a concentrate of forage for his cattle. His wife helps him develop their family business and sells their milk yield to the local diary factory.  

Seydilda wants to take a loan of 70,000 KGS to buy milk cows, which will allow him to increase the milk yield. With the revenues, he plans to buy his own tractor in order to provide services in harvest gathering to farmers.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Emily Waithira

texts.en:
Emily is 32 years old, married and has two children. For the last two years, she has made a living by running a retail shop in the Ikumbi Centre where she sells food items. In a typical month, she earns about Kshs. 8,000.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use it to buy sugar, rice and flour to sell to her customers. Her goal is to make enough money to start a wholesale shop, give her children a quality education and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and flour to sell to her customers

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph C. is 36 years old, married to Janet Chepkwon who is a farmer. They have one child who is three years old. Joseph runs a retail shop and he has been in this business for ten years. His monthly income is Kshs 5,500.

He is taking out a loan of Kshs.38,000 and he plans to use the entire loan amount to purchase sugar, flour, cooking fat, tea leaves and salt for his retail shop.

He will save the anticipated profit. This is his second loan and he repaid his previous loan successfully. His hope and dream is to have a big plot of land and a nice family.

loans.use: To expand the business by buying sugar, flour, cooking fat, tea leaves,and salt

loans.name: 72- Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Lưu P. Thị (104) is a 53-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Lưu is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 72 Quảng Hưng (18-3-72 Quảng Hưng).

Lưu is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Lưu owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products in the local community, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste. Lưu has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lưu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lưu is requesting a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women for the first time. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Lưu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. Thị Thân (107) is a 42-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  N. Thị Oanh (103) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  H. Thị Hằng (105) is a 22-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


4.  P. Thị Tươi (106) is a 44-year-old female who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Lưu P. Thị (104) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Lưu là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 72 Quảng Hưng  (18-3-72 Quảng Hưng).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Lưu thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Lưu kiếm được khoảng 1,500,000 VND.  Vào 2010, Lưu đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Lưu đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4,248,000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. Thị Thân (107) là 42 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,248,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. Thị Oanh (103) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,248,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  H. Thị Hằng (105) là 22 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,248,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  P. Thị Tươi (106) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4,248,000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en:
Meraluna C. lives in the village of Danao. She is 34 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she just opened a  sari-sari or general store. In 2003, she joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid nine previous loans from PMPC and is applying for a new one, for 20,000 PHP, to buy additional items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell to her customers

loans.name: La Confianza 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.es:
Luz está muy emocionada D. recibir su primer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional. Ella opera un negocio D. confección, donD. fabrica ropas, uniformes escolares, y decoraciones. Esta tomando este préstamo para invertirlo en telas, y accesorios para poder fabricar algunos productos y venderlos. Sus ganancias van a ser reutilizada en el mismo negocio, ya que desea expandir sus ventas y productos. 

Pertenece al grupo La Confianza, junto a otros 14 miembros, todos dedicados a la venta ambulante y en sus hogares D. diversos productos y mercancías. Está asociada D. Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque necesitaba capital para su negocio, D. esta manera pueD. invertir, ampliar su inventario y compartir con sus vecinos en un grupo que busca hacer crecer sus negocios, sus vidas y su comunidad. Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros D. su grupo y a los clientes D. Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la República Dominicana desD. Haití, algunos D. ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas D. escasos recursos en la República Dominicana, carecen D. agua potable y energía eléctrica constante.
texts.en:
Luz is very excited about receiving her first loan from Esperanza International. She manages a sewing business where she makes clothes, school uniforms, and decorations. This loan will be invested in fabrics and accessories used in making a few of the products that she sells. Her earnings will be reinvested in her business because she wants to expand her sales and her product line.

Luz is part of the group “La Confianza” (Confidence) along with 14 other members. All of them sell products and merchandise either as street vendors or from their homes. Luz joined Esperanza International because she needed capital for her business. She will also be able to invest, expand her inventory, and share with the other members of her group who also want to expand their businesses as well as improve their lives and their community. Luz’s story is representative of the other members of her group and clients of Esperanza. They are Haitians (most of whom have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some just recently) and Dominicans who live in the poorest communities of the Dominican Republic that lack potable water and reliable electricity.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, needles, buttons, and other supplies

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosario; la socia tiene 63 años de edad, casada y tiene 6 hijos; la socia se dedica a la venta de golosinas como galletas, dulces, chicles, gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva ya un buen tiempo en este negocio su carreta de dulces se encuentra ubicado en el paradero de los carros que salen al distrito de  Sicuani, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rosario, 63, is a member of the “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN” communal bank located in Cusco district which belongs to Cusco province, Cusco department.

She’s married and has six children.  She sells snacks like: cookies, candy, chewing gum and soft drinks, among other.  She has been in business for some time now and her candy cart is located at the bus stop for cars going to Sicuani district.  She is quite a cheerful person with much drive to get ahead.

She is asking for the loan to buy more merchandise for her business.  She is happy about the loan can commits to pay her installments.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Mrs. Tessie J. is from the village of Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Tessie is married and has four Adult-age children. To make a living, Tessie owns and operates a mini-grocery and restaurant business. Tessie has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In February 2011, Tessie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie is now requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used for additional capital in her mini-grocery and restaurant business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family especially in meeting their basic needs, savings for future use and loan repayment.

 About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to have access to working capital.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 19-year-old, single, ambitious lady, who graduated from high school and lives with her three brothers and her twin sister.

Since she has a sense of responsibility towards her family, she took sewing training and got a professional certificate in that trade and starting practicing it at home. She bought a sewing machine and started a small business to help in supporting her family and has been doing that for 10 months.

Now she is applying for this loan to purchase a new sewing machine in order to increase her productivity, so she can be able to open her own sewing workshop and employ more people.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira lives in Kasur, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its tannery industry. Her home is located in the area of Pakka Qilah and contains two rooms. She came here with her family 20 years ago. She is 40 years old and married to M. Irshad. To support her husband and to fulfill the basic needs of family, Tahira started a clothes-selling business three years ago. She takes orders from different clothes shops and from her community clients and fulfills them to earn income for the family. She purchases clothes from Lahore, which is a nearby city and the capital of Punjab province. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her clothes selling business. With the loan, she will purchase clothes in bulk, which will not only help her offer more variety to her clients but also cut the cost of traveling as a result of bulk purchasing. She is very hopeful that her business will improve after the loan and she will be able to provide better living facilities for her family as a result. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Bunny

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunny K., 39 years old, and her husband, Mr. Vanna Kong, 38 years old, (pictured together) have been married since 1991 and have four children: two sons and two daughters, all of whom are in school. The family lives in a village on National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Bunny sells kitchenware in the local market. Her husband is a carpenter. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to expand her business by purchasing additional kitchenware for resale.

loans.use: To purchase additional kitchenware for resale.

loans.name: Jamima

texts.en: Jamima currently sells tea. She is 46 years old and married with three children, two of whom go to school. Jamima borrowed a loan to stock more tea to sell. She hopes to pay her children's school fees with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more tea to sell.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga, 63 years of age, is married and blessed with five children. She has had a retail store in their village for almost five years. She earns 9,000 PHP monthly. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional grocery items to sell in her store. She hopes to start another business to increase her revenue and to continue borrowing from Kiva lenders to help reach her business goals.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mabel is pictured above. She has eight dependents. She has been educated up to senior high school.  Mable fries doughnuts for sale and she also sells rice in Elmina, which she has done for 8 years. Mable promises to use the loan to purchase flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients for doughnuts, and to buy rice for sale. With the new profits from expansion, Mable plans to reinvest in her business.  Her right hand is on a bag of flour and her left is on a bag of rice.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, oil, rice and other items

loans.name: William Alonso

texts.es:
William, es empleado y propietario de una dulcería, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 9 y 3 años de edad,  tiene 9 años de ser empleado y el negocio de la dulcería lo inicio hace un año.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para la dulcería como azúcar, canela, colorantes, con este préstamo tendrá mayor disponibilidad para elaborar la venta.
Para él, su objetivo es tener un local propio en el centro de la ciudad, que le permita crecer y generar mayores ventas.
texts.en:
William is a clerk and an owner of a sweet-shop.  He lives with his wife and their two children, who are 9 and 3 years old.  He has been a clerk for 9 years and he opened the sweet-shop one year ago.
William is requesting the loan to purchase materials for the sweet-shop such as sugar, cinnamon and food coloring.  With this loan, he will have greater availability to make sweets for sale.
William's goal is to have his own store in the city center, which would allow his business to grow and generate greater sales.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his sweet-shop such as sugar, cinnamon and food coloring.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is a 31-year-old married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is only 6 years old. 

Nerissa has been in the business of raising hogs for 4 years. She plans to use her loan to purchase hog feeds and vitamins. Each month, Nerissa earns 3,000 PHP through the hog raising business.

In the future, Nerissa hopes for her business to be stable and that it would enable her to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase hog feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es: Elizabeth de 34 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y 3 de sus 5 hijos en las edades de 2 a 19 años, pues los dos mayores son independientes. Elizabeth por iniciativa propia inició el negocio de vender mercancías sin ninguna experiencia y con apoyo en capacitación  de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, se arriesgó a iniciar su propia aventura. Este es su primer credikiva con el cual comprará calzado y una vitrina para exhibir de manera ordenada su mercancía, pues su creciente clientela le gusta observar y de inmediato comprar. Su meta más adelante es comprar en mayor volumen para ganar buenos descuentos y continuar creciendo hasta lograr convertir su microempresa en una fuente de empleo para la comunidad.  El máximo desafío de Elizabeth es lograr apoyar a sus hijos con tal de que se conviertan en personas exitosas y esto es justamente su máximo sueño.
texts.en: 34 year old Elizabeth lives in the city of Barranquilla with her husband and 3 of their 5 children, who are aged from 2 to 19 years old. The two oldest kids are now independent. Elizabeth started her business selling goods on her own initiative and with no experience, and with training and support from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she took the risk and started her own adventure. This is her first Kiva loan, and she will use it to buy shoes and a display case to show her merchandise in an ordered way so that her growing clientele can enjoy looking at things and immediately buy them. Her long term goal is to buy goods in greater volume so she can get good discounts and continue growing the business until she is able to convert her micro-enterprise into a source of employment for the community. The greatest challenge that Elizabeth faces is being able to support her children so that they become successful, and this is her greatest dream.

loans.use: to buy shoes and a display case to show her merchandise in an ordered way.

loans.name: Segundo Guilo

texts.es:
Segundo es un hombre de 40 años oriundo del cantón Latacunga en la provincia de Cotopaxi. Vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos. El reside en la parroquia Eloy Alfaro; el clima en el cantón es un poco frío ya que se encuentran a 2850 metros de altura sobre el nivel del mar. Es un cantón muy colorido y con muchas tradiciones, cada año son infaltables las celebraciones de la "Mama negra", "Baile de inocentes" y la "Fiesta de la Virgen de las Mercedes".


Un golpe duro y triste en la vida de Segundo fue la muerte de su madre ya que fue difícil de superarlo. Siempre se catalogó como un hombre frontal y trabajador, durante 20 años el trabajó en un taller de reparación de vehículos en donde aprendió sobre reparación de los mismos, hoy se dedica específicamente a dar servicio de pintura y enderezado de vehículos. Él necesita invertir en insumos para poder seguir dando este servicio, quiere comprar variedad de pintura para poder dar mejores opciones a su clientela. Para ello necesita un préstamo que le permita lograr su objetivo y así tener mayores ingresos y mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
Segundo is a 40-year old man who is originally from the canton of Latacunga in the province of Cotopaxi. He lives together with his wife and two children. He lives in the Parish of Eloy Alfaro. The climate of this canton is somewhat cool as it is located at an elevation of 2850 meters above sea level. It is a very colorful canton with many traditions. Occurring every year without fail are the celebrations of "Mama Negra" (meaning "Black Mama"), "Baile de Inocentes" (meaning "The Dance of the Innocents"), and "Fiesta de la Virgen de las Mercedes" (meaning "Feast of the Virgen of Mercedes). 

A hard and sad blow to Segundo's life was the death of his mother and it was difficult for him to overcome. He has always been known as a forward and hardworking person. For the past 20 years he worked in an auto repair shop and it is where he learned to repair cars. Today he provides paint and auto body repairs. He needs to invest the purchase of products to be able to keep providing service. He wants to purchase a variety of paints to offer his clientele wider options. He needs a loan to help him reach his objective, thereby improving his income and his life.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and paint for this auto body business.

loans.name: Oscar David

texts.es:
Oscar, tiene tres hijos de 11, 7 y 3 años de edad, vive con ellos y su esposa, él es motorista de una empresa que se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, tiene 11 años de laborar todos los días de 5:00am a 6:00pm, hasta la fecha no ha tenido inconvenientes.
El va a invertir un préstamo en la compra de materiales de construcción, ladrillo, cemento, arena, para la reparación de su vivienda, esto le ayudara para tener los materiales necesarios  y reparar su casa.
Para Oscar, ve el futuro como una oportunidad de crecimiento para sus hijos, que puedan estudiar y superarse.
texts.en:
Oscar has three children, aged 11, 7 and 3. He lives with them and his wife. He is a driver for a business that sells dairy products. He has been working everyday from 5:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. for 11 years. So far, he has had no problems. 

He is going to invest the loan in buying construction products, bricks and cements to repair his home. This will help him have the materials he needs to repair his home. For OScar, he sees the future as an opportunity for growth for his children, so they can study and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farmland.

loans.name: Gloria Renee

texts.es:
Gloria Renee tiene 49 años de edad es soltera vive con la mamá y con la hija de 18 años de edad en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Virgen de Guadalupe se encuentra ubicada en la Ciudadela 10 de noviembre, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a labores comerciales.

Gloria se dedica a la venta de ropa interior  para hombre y mujer  los compra en Huaquillas y los distribuye en Ventanas dos veces a la semana. Solicita el crédito para poder incrementar el negocio, comprar más mercadería.
El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder ampliar el negocio y comprar más mercadería para poder satisfacer las expectativas de los clientes.

El sueño es poder comprar un local para poder exhibir la mercadería, en los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar música y bailar.
texts.en:
Gloria Renee is 49 years old, single and living with her mother and 18-year-old daughter in Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Virgen de Guadalupe” communal bank are located in Ciudadela 11 de Noviembre belonging to Ventanas Canton.  They are in commercial activities.

Gloria sells underwear for men and woman.  She buys it in Huasquillas and sells it in Ventanas twice a week.  She’s asking for the loan to increase her business buying more merchandise.

The loan will be of much help for her to expand the business and to buy more merchandise to be able to meet customer expectations.

Her dream is to be able to buy a locale to display her merchandise.  She enjoys listening to music and dancing in her free time.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Madame Fatoumata  est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et vit au Sénégal. Elle évolue dans le commerce de poissons séchés, d’arachide et de kaolin. Elle a une expérience de 8 ans dans son activité.  Ce qui l’intéresse le plus  dans son activité ce sont  les revenus qui lui sont procurés et qui lui permettent de subvenir a ses petites dépenses .Elle est membre de l’un des guichets  de l’U-IMCEC depuis février 2010. Elle sollicite un crédit de 75 000 frs prévu pour l’achat  d’arachides et de kaolin destinés a la vente. Son objectif est de mieux rentabiliser son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Mrs. Fatoumata is 42 years old. She is married and lives in Senegal. She is a vendor selling dried fish, peanuts [ground nuts] and kaolin [a type of clay]. She has eight years of experience in this business. Her main motivation is the revenue brought in by this business that allow her to cover some everyday expenses. She has been a member of a branch of U-IMCEC since February 2010. She is seeking a loan of 75,000 West African Francs to buy peanuts and kaolin for resale.  Her goal is to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and clay for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
This is 33 year-old Joseph.  He is married, and has 4 children, aged 13, 10, 7 years and 6 months. He has one additional dependent who lives with him because he is his relative and he helps with schooling.  In 2005, Joseph established his bike riding and services business. He began his business as a spare parts dealer and later changed his business to bike riding and services. Joseph gets enough income from this business to provide a livelihood for his family. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business.

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Joseph has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional motor bikes. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Joseph plans to raise the number of motor bikes to three.  Also, the loan will help him to pay the fees of his children with ease.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for motor bikes

loans.name: Fetuamoamo

texts.en:
Fetuamoamo is 37 years of age and married with two children. Fetuamoamo owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Fetuamoamo needs a loan of WST $2000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment such as knives, spade, axe, sharpener and a wheel-barrow.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2005, Fetuamoamo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Fetuamoamo's 6th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment such as knives, spade, axe, sharpener and a wheel-barrow

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has four children and all of them are currently enrolled in school. Her husband works as a shopkeeper and drives a bus. Jane has operated a general store for the past five years and her primary customers are local residents. She rents a house that has both electricity and piped water. Jane describes her greatest business challenge to be seasonality and her highest monthly expenses to be rent and food. 

Jane will use the loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, rice, and matchboxes. Jane aspires to run her own wholesale business in the future. She joined Yehu because of their efficiency and transparency.

loans.use: To purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, rice, and matchboxes.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is 27 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the  region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. For the past three years, Raymond has been working hard to manage his clothes store, which sells men's, women's and children's wear. 

To help expand his business, Raymond has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cloth to make clothes, and will help Raymond to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Raymond hopes that in the future he will be able to own a big boutique and build a house. 

Raymond is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Raymond who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to make clothes.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and married with four children. She has run a sari-sari store for nine years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Josephine works hard to provide for her family.

Josephine has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF. She has borrowed and paid off twelve loans from NWTF before this one. She will use her loan to buy more items to sell in her sari sari shop.

Josephine aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari sari shop.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena de 41 de edad casado con Antonia de 46 años de edad, que fruto de este amor tienen 6 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Monterico del distrito ecológico de Sivia. Para filomena, el factor más relevante en la agricultura es “ sacrificio, y perseverancia continua”; desde luego que lo pone en practica en su diaria labor realizando los trabajos en su  parcela  agrícola, donde tiene plantas de cacao injertados exclusivamente para producción de yemas, que servirán como semillas para continuar su propagación en otras parcelas. Así ella se dedicará a expender yemas de cacao injertadas, ya que la mayoría de los vecinos de su localidad están empezando a sembrar más plantaciones de cacao pero hace falta unas yemas de garantía que resulte con una buena producción. Es por esta razón que ella empezó a implementar una parcela de cacao injerto. Pero conjuntamente  a ello se dedica  al cultivo de café orgánico y producción de cacao tradicional.
Ella esta contenta con esta labor que realiza por que le agrada desde muy pequeña, generalmente trabaja con su querido esposo quien es el apoyo constante en estas labores, quien lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. Este será su tercer credito con MFP, por lo que ella se compromete por tercera vez en cancelar su credito puntualmente así podrá garantizar para otros prestamos venideros. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles contratará peones para que limpien su campo agrícola donde está instalado su cacao injerto.
texts.en:
Filomena, age 41, is married to 46 year old Antonio.  Their love has produced six children.  They live in their own house in the Monterico community in the ecological district of Sivia.  

To Filomena the most important thing about farming is “sacrifice and the perseverance to continue”.  She puts that into practice in her daily work on her plot of land.  She has cacao plants that are grafted in order to produce buds.  The buds will serve as seeds to continue propagation on other parcels of land.  

She will devote herself to selling the seeds from the cacao grafts.  She will do this because most of her neighbors are starting to plant more cacao, but they lack the grafts that guarantee a good production as a result.  That is why she started to establish a plot of land with grafted cacao.  She also grows organic coffee and produces regular cacao.

She is happy with the work she does because it has pleased her ever since she was very little.  She generally works with her beloved husband, who is her constant support in her work.  He does this in order improve the welfare of their family.

This will be her third loan with MFP.  For the third time she pledges to make her payments punctually.  That way she will be able to warrant future loans.  She will use the 1,000 soles to contract workers to clear the field where she has established her cacao grafts.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Julanda

texts.en: Julanda is married and has five children ranging from sixteen to twenty eight years old. She is honest and a woman with leadership qualities. She practices farming and she sells vegetables such as potatoes. She has been in this business for the last six years. In addition, she works at a local government office so to increase her income. Her business challenge is insufficient capital since this is her first loan. She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy farming products like seeds. She hopes to expand her business so as to get enough capital for running another similar business.

loans.use: To buy more farming products such as seeds.

loans.name: Apolonio

texts.en:
Apolonio is 48 years old and married to Saturnina. They have six children. Two of them attend school. The rest have settled into marriage and live separately from them but sometimes still rely on their parents when financial crises arise. 

As of now, Apolonio's farming business is generating a good income but he still aspires for a better crop production so that he can further help his children when they come to him for help. He is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow. He hopes to make his business more profitable to achieve financial independence and someday lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to grow

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 30 years old, married to Jane, and they have three children. He has been in the farming business for the past two years, earning a monthly income of about Kes 6,500 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Michael will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to venture into large scale beekeeping.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Pauline Pélagie

texts.fr: Pauline Pélagie est âgée de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Pauline Pélagie a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pauline Pélagie ne vit plus avec son mari. Pauline Pélagie a un enfant scolarisé et à sa charge. En plus de son enfant, Pauline Pélagie a un autre enfant à charge. Pauline Pélagie vit seule avec ses deux enfants. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Pauline Pélagie vend depuis une dizaine d’années, divers produits (huile végétale, charbons de bois) et des produits vivriers (conserves, riz, maïs). Pauline Pélagie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Pauline Pélagie contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Pauline Pélagie sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts reçus par Pauline Pélagie ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Pauline Pélagie is 46 years old and lives in Benin.  She left school at the primary level.  Pauline Pélagie no longer lives with her husband.  She has one child, who goes to school, and whom she financially supports.  Pauline Pélagie also supports another child and lives alone with these two children.  She lives alone with the two children.  In order to support herself and provide for the children, Pauline Pélagie has been selling various goods and food products for about ten years (charcoal, vegetable oil, canned goods, rice, maize).  She buys her merchandise at a market in Benin.  With the income that this activity brings her, Pauline Pélagie takes care to her family's various expenses.  In order to meet the needs of a growing number of customers, Pauline Pélagie  is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.  Her three previous loans were well repaid.

loans.use: To buy sacks of maize, rice, boxes of canned goods and bottles of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Alogojesuton 8 Group

texts.fr: ALOGOJESUTON 8 est un groupement est composé de sept personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Marcelline, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 51 ans est mariée à un chauffeur du nom  de Anatole. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Marcelline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par son mari. Marcelline vend des glacières, des sacs et des chaussures et divers autres produits depuis six ans ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses propres besoins. Marcelline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Marcelline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement ALOGOJESUTON 8, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des glacières, des sacs et des chaussures et divers autres produits.

loans.name: Haja

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Haja. She is married, and has two children aged 12 and four years; one is a school-going child. In 2010, Haja established her household utensils business. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 3,849,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Haja requires a loan in order to buy cartons of enamel pans and hot warmers. In the past plans, Haja was looking forward to building a house in a long term plan, considering the economic trend of the country; but now she wants to concentrate on the business. Haja's previous aim of acquiring a much larger business place was not successful but the business did well, therefore she bought some household assets. Her challenge is that some of the goods got damaged while in transit. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of enamel pans and hot warmers.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is the general secretary of the Memorial Methodist church. Revs. Tehpopambo who is the head paster put her in charge 
of the cook stove project to rase money for the church.Rev. Tehpopambo is a pastor at Memorial Methodist Church. Rebecca plans
to sell SE4ALL products like CH-2300 clean cookstoves and solar lanterns to their fellow congregation and community.  She hopes
this project will be very profitable and add to success of the church. The Kiva loan allows them to obtain SE4ALL products, sell and 
make a profit, and easily repay the loan.

loans.use: To pay for Sustainable Energy for All (SE4ALL) products at wholesale to sell retail.

loans.name: Boyaba Group

texts.fr: Latifatou est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle aussi âgée de 32 ans. Elle est dans le tricotage des layettes pour bébé à base de laine chez elle à la maison et cela fait 2 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité. Elle a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter 1 balle de file de qualité appelé Maroc à 60 000 francs et 12 paquets de file de marque appelé Étalon à 60 000 Francs et le reste 30 000 francs pour achat des accessoires, afin de tricoté des habits d'enfants et vendre. Elle applique un prix bas que les autres, le tissage est bien fait avec de jolie motifs et modèle ce qui fait que la vente de ses habits marche bien et en plus de cela elle utilise la qualité de file  marque Nigérian et Étalon. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire des épargnes, de s'occuper de sa famille et aussi de continuer ses activités. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt et à rembourser à la bonne date à ACFIME.

loans.use: Acheter 1 balle de file  à 60 000 francs et 12 paquets de file à 60 000 Francs et le reste 30 000 francs pour achat des accessoires.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jennifer would like to invest in stock market

loans.name: Arif

texts.en:
Arif has his own shop, where he sells wooden materials.
He is 33 years oldand an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Agdam region Kurdlar village, settled in the Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 2 children.
Having borrowed  $500 he bought wood for making doors, windows,and floors.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to start selling iron armatures.
He has run this business for 3 years.

loans.use: To start sale of iron armatures

loans.name: Fieta

texts.en: Mrs. T. is married with two children.  She is 25 years old and never had a job prior to joining SPBD.  When she had children, it was difficult for her and her husband to support their young family.  This prompted her to join the SPBD program in order to start a business and provide for her family’s growing weekly expenses and save for her children’s future education.  After SPBD training, Fieta took out an initial loan to launch a business.  She chose to start a barbeque stand and sell cooked food to passersby in her village.  She says that the business is going well. She is anxious to further invest in it and increase her profits by expanding her supply and product line.  The business is really helping her make things easier for her family.  She hopes that by putting more hard work into her barbeque stand she can ensure that her children can go to good schools.

loans.use: to purchase food in bulk, cooking utensils, containers, and packaging materials

loans.name: Lucie

texts.en: D. T. Lucie is a brave 59 year old woman. She lives with her family in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan. Lucie sells grilled pig meat at Yopougon open market. She has been doing this micro business for more than 20 years. Her husband, who retired from his public administration work ten years ago, is no longer able to cover all household expenses. Lucie is therefore a key family resources provider. Lucie is seeking to become a pig meat wholesaler.

loans.use: To purchase pig meat in bulk

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred deals in automobile parts, a business he has done for 13 years. He is married with two children and he is a member of Zinunula Group. He supplies mechanics around Kayunga with spare part batteries. He is locally based but internationally focused; that’s why he wants to venture into direct importation. He has earned some savings which he hopes to top up with this loan to be able to import batteries from Japan to be able to sell to his customers. This will increase his income. Additionally, the garages around Kayunga will benefit when their needs are met. He has paid back loans ranging from USD $200- $500 on time and he is an honest man.

loans.use: Fred wants to Import batteries from Japan to sell to garages around Kayunga and Mukono.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Mrs. Hem S., age 35, is a mother of four children and lives with her husband (who is pictured because Mrs. Hem S. is unavailable) in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She and her husband work together on their rice paddy, growing crops and vegetables and raising pigs. They generally earn around $2 each day.  Two of her children are currently employed at a garment factory and the rest are enrolled in school. Mrs. Hem S. is humbly requesting a loan to purchase 12 pigs, seed and fertilizer for her farm. She is confident and believes that her business will show improvement after five to six months.

loans.use: To purchase 12 pigs, seed and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Teleofa

texts.en: Teleofa lives in the village of Samatau, where she runs a plantation. She is a very hard-working woman, and one of the best clients we have at the Samatau Center. Teleofa works on her plantation six days a week, taking time off only to bring her goods to market. She is 38 years old and supports several children, all of whom are in school. Her husband works at a nearby hotel, and his income used to be the family's sole means of support before Teleofa secured her first loan, which allowed her to start her own business. Now she has applied for a new loan to improve her plantation. She is grateful for the support she has received, and looks forward to more activity with SPBD in the future.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for her plantation

loans.name: Nurhaya

texts.en: Nurhaya, 37, has a small stall at her house, where she sells snacks, beverages, vegetables, etc., earning USD10 a day with a small profit. Her husband, N., sells baskets and earns USD20 a day. She is requesting a loan of USD125 to expand her business, and as a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Khodr

texts.en: Khodr is a 49-year-old father of 2. He works and lives with his family in the Beirut suburbs. Khodr sells vegetables. This is the third time he is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua because he is planning to develop his business by opening a store. Khodr is striving to support his family.

loans.use: To develop his business by opening a little store

loans.name: Ruth Esther

texts.en: Ruth Esther is a very active and untiring businesswoman of the Doña Ana community of San Cristobal. She is thirty-two years old and a proud mother of two children that go to school. Ruth Esther is multifaceted entrepreneur. She owns and operates a cafeteria which offers a wiD. variety of typical Dominican foods.  Each day, she attends to thousands of people of the close-by neighborhood that visit her regularly to consume her tasty dishes. Ruth Esther also sells women’s clothing in the same community.  She runs that business mostly on the weekends. The entrepreneur explains that her businesses are very profitable. With incomes from her activities, she covers the expenses of her children’s studies and she pays the rental of her house. Ruth wants to expand her business and add new kinds of clothing to her store. She will use her loan to buy clothing in bulk (including men’s clothing) in order to attract more people and increase her sales volume.  That will allow the entrepreneur improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To replenish a small clothing store. Also to buy raw materials for a cafeteria.

location.town: Doña Ana community of San Cristobal

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en:
Mwanaulu is 42 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 15, 6, and 1. Mwanaulu is a charcoal and firewood seller; she started her business in 2005. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 34 year old mother of three school-aged children. She is the proprietor of a beauty salon located in Nyalenda in the Kisumu area of Kenya. She started her salon in 1997 from her small savings.

She requires $500 so that she can move to a bigger space and also purchase cosmetics and other materials for her salon.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To move her salon into a bigger space and purchase more cosmetics and other materials.

loans.name: Carlos Adolfo

texts.es:
Mr. Carlos E. is a gentleman that has dedicated himself to the agriculture and livestock industry his whole life in the district of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. He has been characterized as a very spirited and strong person whose successes are directly applied to his family, composed of his wife and three young children.

The work he does in his sector is through the production of basic grains and raising livestock for their respective commercialization. It is necessary to point out that this is the only income that supports his family that really needs it.

Today he looks for support from Ceprodel to obtain the necessary loan to purchase cows to raise them. With this loan his beloved family will benefit as much as he will.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.
