El señor Carlos E. es un caballero que toda su vida la ha dedicado al negocio agropecuario en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, él se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy esforzada cuyos logros son directamente aplicados a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y tres pequeños hijos.

La labor la realiza en su sector por medio de la producción de granos básicos y la crianza de ganado para su respectiva comercialización. Es de necesidad destacar que este es el único ingreso con que alimenta a su familia que tanto necesita de él.

Hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de vacas para desarrollarlas. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto él como su amada familia.

loans.use: Purchase of cows as livestock

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is divorced and has a 13-year-old son. He runs a small pet store in Melitopol selling aquariums, pet supplies and animal feed in the central city market. His vending facility is attractive, with a nice arrangement of inventory. Moreover, Sergei offers affordable prices and friendly service. He loves this business, which he has been operating for over three years. Today his turnover capital is about $1000, while net profit is approximately $200 each month.

Sergei is requesting a loan of $1,100 to purchase additional merchandise and increase his sales. He is very optimistic about the future, as he plans to develop his business to achieve maximum entrepreneurial success.

Sergei has a perfect credit history with Nadiya Ukraine, and we believe his enterprising spirit and enthusiasm will ensure business success and prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Nadezhda

texts.en:
Nadezhda is divorced. She is an entrepreneur from Korolyovo, a small town in Western Ukraine. It has always been hard for Nadezhda to meet even her most basic needs. To provide for herself, she decided to start her own small business selling clothing and footwear in the central marketplace. Nadezhda has been in this trade for 15 years. Currently, her turnover capital is about $5,000. Her net profit is $600 a month.  

Loans from Nadiya Ukraine have helped Nadezhda expand her clothing and footwear business. Through persistence, hard work, and further loans, she is hoping to increase her sales even more in the future. Nadezhda would like a loan to increase her turnover capital. This loan will not only help Nadezhda's business grow but will also give her a better livelihood.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela, de 36 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, quienes son el significado de vivir y seguir luchando por salir adelante, ella y su esposo Wilson tienen el deseo de salir adelante en su negocio, sobre todo por le futuro de sus hijos.
Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad desde ya hace 3 años, negocio que tiene dentro de su vivienda, el mismo que respalda el sustento económico de su  familia, vende durante todo el día, y lo que le gusta más de su trabajo es que se socializa e intercambia muchas ideas con personas que conocen de negocio. Lo más difícil es no contar con un local apropiado para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.
Mariela trabaja para sus gastos diarios y la educación de sus hijos.
El dinero que pide será para ampliar su negocio, comprar productos comestibles, y sobre todo mejorar la estructura de su tienda, más adelante tener su minimarket.
texts.en:
Mariela is 36 years old and has 3 children, who are her motivation for working hard. Mariela and her husband, Wilson, would like to grow their business to help secure their children's future. For 3 years now, they have run a small grocery shop from their home. What they enjoy most about their business is the interaction with the customers and the exchange of ideas with people who know their business. The most difficult thing is not having a separate shop, which would be better suited for the comfort of their customers. Mariela works to cover household costs and the costs of educating their children. The money she is requesting will be used to grow the business, buy more products, and above all make improvements to the shop, so that one day they will have a proper mini market.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock their small general store and make improvements so that it's more comfortable and attractive for their customers.

loans.name: Zokirjon

texts.en: Zokirjon A. is 34 years old and lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. He sells audio and video accessories in the central bazaar. He has 10 years of experience in this business. Zokirjon has the education of an electronic master. He is a very hard-working man so he has a good reputation and a many repeat customers. Zokirjon is asking for a loan of 3100 STJ ($925 USD) for four months to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 38 years old and is married with four children. She is a qualified nurse but she resigned because she wanted to have more time for her husband and children. Mary, in her spare time, organizes health seminars for women in her locality and enlightens them on how to remain healthy and avoid health problems. Mary sells provisions, drinks and bottled water. She has been in this business for the past three years. Mary is the woman standing in the picture, while her sales girl is sitting behind her. She needs the loan to buy more provisions to sell. Mary says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: La señora Maria Santos Vásquez B. que desde los 16 años de edad, emprendió su taller en la fabricación de cortes típicos, gracias a los conocimientos que le dejaron sus padres, aprendió las diferentes etapas para la elaboración, teniendo en la actualidad 55 años de edad, no ha dejado aun su profesión, casada y con dos hijos aun bajo su cargo aun. Sobresaliendo a través de los prestamos que ha tenido en la asociación ASDIR, ha podido crecer dentro de su taller, la cual ahora solicita un crédito de 5, 508.00 quetzales, en donde lo utilizara para la compra de dos telares mas, como también  materia prima, ya que piensa heredar los conocimientos a sus hijos, por lo cual sus hijos trabajaran para generar mas ingresos y mejorar su condición de vida de su familia, teniendo el fin principal de poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Siendo una persona reconocida en la comunidad de la aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Santos Vásquez B. is a 55-year-old mother of two. She has worked in the weaving of typical native dress since she was 16 years, having learned the different process stages from her parents, and she has never left the profession. She grew the business with loans from the ASDIR Association and was able to grow within her workshop. She is now applying for a 5,508 quetzales loan, which she'll use to buy two more looms and raw materials. She plans to hand down her knowledge to her children, so they can continue the business to generate more income and improve their quality of life for their families, but her first goal is to cover the current client demand. She is a recognized person within the town of Vásquez in the Totonicapán Region.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (To buy two looms and raw materials)

loans.name: Abel De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Habel de Jesús Reynosa tiene la edad de 22 años, habita en el sector de la Francia ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, la esposa trabaja para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar, el también recibe el apoyo de su papá ya que desde muy pequeño se dedica a la agricultura y ellos juntos han logrado establecer su cultivo de piña. Don Habel tiene planes hacia un futuro, de poder establecer mas cultivo y poder construir su vivienda ya que ellos viven en cuarto que le regalo su papá, y su mayor anhelo es poder gozar de una casa digna y un poco mas grande. Con la solicitud de préstamo va invertir en los cultivos de piña en la compra de insumos de abonos y venenos para los cultivos y así vender a mejor precios la producción
texts.en:
Señor Habel de Jesús Reynosa is 22 and lives in the area called Francia in the town of Ticuantepe. He lives with his wife, who works to help him with their home's expenses. He also receives support from his father, since they have worked together since he was very young in agriculture to grow pineapple. Don Habel has plans for the future of having a bigger crop and building his home since they now live in a room that his father gave to them. His biggest dream is to be able to enjoy a decent house that is a little bigger. With the request for this loan, he is going to invest in his pineapple crop and buy fertilizers and in this way sell what he produces at better prices.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his crop like fertilizer to produce a good pineapple harvest

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. started her trade 2 years ago in Apatrapa community, a suburb of Kumasi where she lives. Mercy prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish, and fresh vegetables like pepper, onions, tomatoes etc. Because of that many customers buy from her stand in the market. She is now 36 years old and married with four children. They are currently in school. She wants to use the loan to buy an increased stock of assorted fishes and vegetables to increase her sales and income to support her children’s education and business growth. 

Mercy belongs to a village bank called ‘Adwenpa’ which means Good mind. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make progress in her business by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more in taking care of the household.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fishes, peppers, tomatoes, onions etc.

loans.name: Luz Amelia

texts.es:
Luz  es socia del Bancomunal Maria de la Paz
Luz es conviviente, tiene 53 años  dos hijos de 32 y 29 años, que están casados. 
Desde hace quince años Tiene una bodega donde vende gas, empezó con diez balones de gas, ahora vende mucho mas, su hijo le ayuda en la tienda. 
Ella también se dedica hacer movilidad escolar con su esposo, por las mañanas.
Desde que esta en Finca tiene la oportunidad para surgir como mujer, les enseñan a ahorrar y les ayudan dándoles prestamos, tiene mas amigas que son solidarias.
Luz  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para  cambio de motor de su carro de gasolinera a gas. 
El sueño de Luz es tener una flota de taxis.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Communal Bank "Maria de la Paz". She lives with her partner, she is 53 years old and she has two children. They are 32 and 29 years old and they are married. For 15 years now, Luz has owned a store where she sells canisters of gas. She started with only 10 canister of gas. Now she sells much more and her daughter helps her in the store. She also makes money taking school children to school in the mornings. Since she has been part of the group "Finca" she has had the opportunity to flourish as a woman. The group has taught her how to save money and it has also helped her by giving her loans. She also has made many faithful friends. Luz needs a loan of $325 (1,000 Soles) so that she can replace the motor of her vehicle. The dream of Luz is to own a taxi company.

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Luz needs a loan of 1,000 soles to replace the motor in her vehicle

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Madame S. kossiwa habite le quartier d’agoè telessou, elle a pour activité le commerce de de pagnes et de sucres, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1999, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé où ce commerce est très développé et très rentable, actuellement elle souhaite agrandir son stock de marchandises c’est la raison pour laquelle elle se tourne envers wages pour demander un crédit de 150000F  pour acheter 8pièces de pagnes et 4 sacs de sucres. Elle n’est pas mariée mais elle a un enfant, c’est avec le revenu issu de ce commerce qu’elle arrive à entretenir son enfant.
texts.en:
Mrs Kossiwa S. lives in the Agoè Telessou neighborhood, and since 1999, her business has consisted in reselling pagnes (colorful African cloth) and sugar. She gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé, where this kind of activity is very much developed and profitable. At this time, she would like to bolster her stock. This is why she turned to Kiva's partner WAGES to seek a loan in order to purchase 8 large pagnes and 4 sacks of sugar. She's not married, but she has one child, who she supports with the income she gets out of her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell 8 large pagnes (colorful African cloth) and sugar

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Carloes tiene 26 años, es soltero. Originalmente es de Caaguazu pero actualmente se encuentra viviendo con sus tios en San Lorenzo. Cuenta con un negocio de compra y venta de Aparatos celulares, activaciones, servicio tecnico y venta de accesorios en general. Empezò con un pequeño puesto de activaciones en su domicilio hasta que en el año 2006 pudo abrir su propio local de ventas. Hoy en dia ya cuenta con una clientela formada y necesita este credito para aumentar su stock de mercaderias. Su sueño es poder acceder a estudios universitarios y tambien adquirir su propio terreno o vivienda .
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 26 years old and single. He is orignally from Caaguazu but currently lives with his aunt and uncle in San Lorenzo. He has a business buying and selling cell phones, activations, technical service and accessories. He began with a small activation stand in his home until he was able to open his own shop in 2006. He now has an established customer base and needs this loan to increase his inventory. His dream is to be able to go to college and also to buy his own land or home.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cell phones, cell phone batteries, plastic, leather and rubber covers, earpieces, new faceplates, general accessories

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico is 54 years old and married to his supportive and responsible wife, Aurelia. They are blessed with three children: Cheryl, 34; Heraldy, 30; and Ma. Grace, 27. They live peacefully in the village of San Juan, Quirino, Isabela. Federico works as a tricycle driver in the village. He is glad that he can earn a daily income of PHP 300-500 pesos, which is mainly spent in supporting his family’s needs. He is proud that through his income he was able to send his children to school. However, he feels sad that his children couldn’t seek jobs due to limited opportunities. 

To further improve his business, he would like to borrow a loan of PHP 4,000 for the maintenance of his tricycle and hopefully to be able to start a hog-raising business. His wife is eager to help him with the new business that he is planning to start, while he will continue with his tricycle transport operation. Federico believes cooperation and hard work is the key to successful business.

loans.use: Tricycle maintenance

loans.name: Jubilee

texts.en: Mrs. Jubilee A. is 22-years old, a resident of Misom, Misamis Occidental, and married to Jade A.. She is a new member of PMPC and is currently requesting her first loan. Her proposed project is to start-up a cellphone load retail business near the highway where there is easy access for customers. Her husband works as a motorcycle driver.

loans.use: Start up capital for load retailer

loans.name: Jonna Mae

texts.en:
" Before we were just renting a small parcel of land to grow rice. Now we have our own farm, which we use to provide and support our family's needs," says Jonna Mae L., a 23-year old mother of one child.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase crude oil, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides. The loan will really help to improve their harvest.

CEVI gives their clients with not just loans. They also provide training and insurance coverage to help their small business to grow.

loans.use: To purchase crude oil, fertilizers, herbicides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Sojida

texts.ru: Сафарова Сочида более  лет занимается пошивкой одежды. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 6 лет. Замужем, детей не имеет. Проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 28 лет. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы купить швейную машинку и производить другой вид одежды.
texts.en:
Sojida S. sews clothing. She has been in this business for more than 6 years. She is married and does not have children. She lives in the Tursun-zoda region. She is 28 years old. The client is asking us for credit in order to purchase a sewing machine and to produce a different type of clothing.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing machine

loans.name: Anita

texts.es: La sra. Anita S. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella cuenta con una pulperia, actividad que tiene de ejecutar por mas de 36 años, su familia es bien conocida en el lugar en donde viven ya que son de las primeras familias que vivieron en trojes, ella y su esposo han sacado adelante a su familia, tambien ellos se dedican a la ganaderia y a la agricultura ya que la zona se presta para poder realizar este tipo de actividades. ellos viven en elevadas montañas. la sra Anita a sabido administrar muy bien su negocio, ella necesita el credito para invertir en productos y comprarlos al por mayor ya que asi se tienen mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sra. Anita S. has been selling common foodstuffs from her corner store for more than 36 years. Her family is well known in the area in which they live as they were one of the first families to move to Trojes. Anita and her husband have made a good life for their family. They are farmers and raise both cattle and crops, as the land is ideal for these types of agriculture. They live in Elevadas Montañas. Anita has learnt how to run a good business, and she now needs a loan to buy products at wholesale prices so that she can make a greater profit.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy common food items such as sugar, chicken, soap etc for her store

loans.name: Rafael Pabon Group

texts.es: El grupo “Rafael Pabon” esta representado por la señora Lisbeth Lina y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad en sus pagos. En general las socias se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios como la venta de, ropa, frezadas, abarrotes en tiendas de barrio, salteñas, construcción y a la extracción de minerales. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero los miembros del grupo saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y sus ganas de trabajar. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición de materiales, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso ya que de ello depende el sustento de sus familias y mejoramiento de su calidad de vida. Dentro del grupo existen socios nuevos pero que conocen la modalidad de créditos solidarios y son gente responsable, honesta y con ganas de trabajar.
texts.en:
The “Rafael Pabon” Group is represented by Lisbeth Lina and consists of 12 members who have enrolled in their third loan cycle demonstrating responsibility and honesty with their payments. In general, the members make a living in different types of businesses, such as selling clothing, groceries and regional meals or working in construction or mining. The competition in the commercial environment is quite high, but the members know how to keep making headway thanks to their experience and desire to work. The loan they are requesting will be used to acquire materials, ingredients and tools that will help the group generate more profits, which their families' sustenance depends on, and improve their families' quality of life. There are new members to the group, but they are familiar with loan repayments and are responsible, honest and hard-working people.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. has been selling groceries at Atabadi near Elmina since 2007. She is married and has six dependants. Her husband is a teacher. She has received no formal education. Mary uses her income to meet her financial responsibilities. Mary will use this loan to purchase more groceries for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for resale

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima C. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 59 years old. Zosima is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Zosima owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motor cab for hire to local community members. Zosima has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Zosima joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zosima has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Zosima is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Zosima from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Abam

texts.en:
Abam  E. is married to Grace Numfor and they are blessed with 4 children above 15 years of age. E. and his entire family are living in a house with 3 bedrooms and one sitting room. As a very hard working man, Abam has faced many challenges in life such as the death of his mother and father in the same year and a robbery costing him huge sums of money and destruction of materials. The latter problem made life very difficult for him because he was sponsoring two children in the university at the time. In  the year 2006, Abam saw GHAPE as a source of relief and became a member.
	
Abam plans to buy cows with his loan. Repayment of the loan will start at  the fourth month from the day of disbursement He is convinced that the business will succeed because of the experience he had have in it and he is well known in the community. He is going to provide the community with meat, skin material for the manufacture of other commodities. Not forgetting the trust those in his community have for him.
	
Abam plans to use the profit from the loan and that of previous loans to, pay for his children school fees, feed and cloth his family. With all these, he will enjoy a better and comfortable life. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because it offers trainings before giving out loans, proper follow up is done after the loan is disbursed to ensure proper usage of the loan, and the method of repayment is convenient and comfortable.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of cows

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
A sus 65 años, Elías trabaja arduamente en sus chacras, es casado y tiene 6 hijos. Sus labores agrícolas generalmente las realiza solo, pero durante los días de cosecha, sí necesita la ayuda de su esposa, con quien logra recolectar mayor cantidad de papas. Posteriormente, comercializan sus productos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde los venden a los comerciantes de verduras en menos de media hora, debido a la calidad de sus papas. A Elías no le preocupa mucho el precio del mercado, pues suele vender cada saco entre 30 y 50 soles, y aun cuando tiene un precio menor, logra ganancias, debido a la gran cantidad de producto que cosecha, lo cual compensa su inversión.
Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser muy puntual en cada uno de sus pagos, además se siente muy bien en su banco comunal. El dinero ahora solicitado lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su próxima siembra de papa.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
“Work hard and commitment to God is the weapon in achieving success in life” said Eva A.. Eva is 40 years old and she is married to Elson.  They are thankful because they were blessed with five children: Sanny Boy-20 years old, high school graduate; Jackilyn-16 years old, 4th year high school; Mark-12 years old;Jay-R - three years old and the youngest is Mar-one year old. Her family lives in the village of Rizal West, San Isidro. The couple are striving hard to meet the needs of their family.  

Eva is a hog raiser while her husband is a busy cultivating their rice fields and same time repairing some houses in their village to have additional source of income. The  couple would like to generate bigger capital for their growing needs.  But their income to their hog raising business is not enough so Eva is borrowing  a loan of PHP4 000 to the KIVA lenders to further improve her business and so with their way of living.  The loan will be of great help in purchasing supply of feeds for her hogs.  She is hoping that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: Additional capital for hog raising business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
With her desire to earn more income for the welfare of her family, especially her children, Florence M. is really doing her best managing her mini-restaurant located at Magsaysay Saguday, Quirino. Aside from the mini-restaurant, she also sells some merchandise for an extra income.

Already a widow at the age of 51, Florence strives to earn a higher income to support her daily needs and to give some money to her three children, who already have their own families. Florence said that at her age, she still wants to take care and serve her children. For that reason, she wants her business to further progress; thus, she is requesting a loan from ASKI amounting to 7,000 Philippine pesos. She knows that the amount will be of great help to her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for mini-restaurant business

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en:
Rajab M. is a sheep breeder in the city of Saatli in Azerbaijan. Together with his wife, he has been raising sheep for more than 15 years. This produces the income which allows him to feed his three children and his wife. As well as caring for his sheep, he also cultivates agricultural crops, such as wheat, which helps with the family's diet and provides additional income.

Rajab has asked for this loan to buy lambs in order to obtain a better profit. His greatest wish is to be able to improve his farm by constructing enclosures and establishing better grazing for his sheep.

loans.use: Purchase 15 sheep

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen C. is from the village of Galas. She is 41 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Helen owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling different kind of snacks in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2008, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,500 PHP from PMPC. Helen is requesting a new loan of 10,500 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale and additionally to purchase materials for their footwear-making activity. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale and also materials to make footwear

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita A. is from the village of Tabid, Ozamiz City. She is 63 years old, married and has one adult child. To make a living, Conchita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for almost one year and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In May 2009, Conchita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Conchita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for her future emergencies.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Northwestern Mindanao. It reaches to rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. is from the village of Maluno. She is 28 years old, married, and has children.

Jocelyn owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her business.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI.

Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma M. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old. Vilma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Vilma makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Vilma is just starting this business. In 2009, Vilma joined HSPFI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Vilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin C. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 29 years old. Elvin is married. To make a living, Elvin buys and sells coconuts in the local community. Elvin has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvin is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elvin from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 55 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, ella actualmente es soltera y tiene vivienda propia. Julia se dedica a la venta de comidas, recibe renta de una moto y un auto que presta servicio de transporte local. La competencia  es bastante pero hay bastante demanda sobre todo en el transporte de auto y moto. El destino del crédito es para compra de moto, para ponerla a trabajar al igual que la que tiene. Julia tiene dos créditos ambos en nuestra institución uno como crédito individual y el otro en un grupo, ya que este crédito es un paralelo.
texts.en:
Julia is 55 and has three children. She is currently single, and she has her own home. Julia sells food, and she gets rent from a motorcycle and a car that are used for local transportation services. There is plenty of competition, but there is plenty of demand, especially in car and motorcycle transportation. The loan is to buy a motorcycle to put to work like the one she has. Julia has two loans, both with our institution. One is an individual loan, and the other is a group loan. This loan is simultaneous.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Maknearang

texts.en: Mrs. Maknearang M. is a 32-year-old single woman who lives in Srah Trakuon village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice on. Now she has a problem with her financial resources to support her field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support it. Aside from farming, she is a laborer who can receive a small salary to support herself.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Eliovina

texts.es:
La Sra. Eliovina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años y es madre de 03 hijos todos ya independientes.

Gracias a su optimismo y valentía le motivo por iniciativa propia dedicarse a dar servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo juntamente con su esposo, el se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad para realizar carreras. Con su primer préstamo de 300 soles, compró, repuestos para su motokar. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará repuestos y aceites cómo: lubricantes, bujías, pistones, bielas; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente.

Eliovina se siente orgullosa del trabajo que realiza día a día y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por brindarle el apoyo que necesitaba, su meta es llegar a tener su Concesionario de Motos y Motokares.
texts.en:
La Sra. Eliovina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin y Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 50 años y es madre de 03 hijos todos ya independientes. Gracias a su optimismo y valentía le motivo por iniciativa propia dedicarse a dar servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo juntamente con su esposo, el se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad para realizar carreras. Con su primer préstamo de 300 soles, compró, repuestos para su motokar. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará repuestos y aceites cómo: lubricantes, bujías, pistones, bielas; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente. Eliovina se siente orgullosa del trabajo que realiza día a día y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por brindarle el apoyo que necesitaba, su meta es llegar a tener su Concesionario de Motos y Motokares.

Translated from Spanish by Alex Jaffe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprarà repuestos para su motokares.

loans.name: Antonia Juárez

texts.es:
La Señora Antonia Juárez E. tiene un puesto de venta de frutas y verduras ubicado en el mercado central de la iglesia el calvario1c al oeste  75 vrs al norte, tiene de vender 30 años  empezo con un capital de C$2,000.00 aporte de su esposo  en esos treinta años que tiene de vender le ha dado gracias a Dios por que saco adelante a sus hijas con sus estudios en la actualidad solo tiene una a su cargo.
Su hija le viene a ayudar a vender a su puesto madrugan de lunes a domingo venden desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a sembrar en su finca y vendía ambulante  pero decidio vender en el mercado frutas y verdura, La señora Antonia Juárez ya fue clienta de nosotros tiempo atrás en el 2005-2006 y ahora decidio seguir trabajando con nosotros ya que nesecitaba una mano amiga  ya que le gustaba la forma de trabajar del banco y pues nunca quedo mal entonces las puertas estaban abiertas para ella, y que  los créditos son rápidos y espera seguir trabajando por más tiempo con nosotros.
texts.en:
Sra. Antonia Juárez E. has a vegetable and fruit stand located at the central market, which is one block to the west and 75 “varas” (63 meters) north of the Calvary Church. She has been selling for 30 years and started with capital of 2000 NIO that was contributed by her husband. In those 30 years of making sales, she gives thanks to God that her daughters were able to get ahead in their studies. At the moment, she only has one daughter who is still a dependent.

Sra. Antonia previous grew crops on her farm and sold her produce as a street vendor, but later decided to sell fruits and vegetables at the market. She was a client of ours a long time ago during the period of 2005-2006. Antonia has now decided to continue working with us because she needs a helping hand. She has always liked the way the bank works and has never had any bad experiences. The doors have been open for her. Her loans were approved quickly and she hopes to continue working further with us.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Mrs. Uk B., 45, sells firewood and charcoal that she buys from people living in the forest area. She lives with her husband and three children. She started her business in 2002. To help resolve the financial difficulties of the family, her eldest daughter works as a garment employee. Uk B. and her husband leave home to buy chopped-wood and charcoal and sell them by using a vehicle with an attached trailer. Recently, Uk B.’s vehicle broke while they were using it and this has affected her business and income. Therefore, Uk B. is asking for a loan to repair the broken vehicle. Any leftover money, Uk B. will use for additional business capital.

loans.use: To repair the broken vehicle.

loans.name: Carmen Laura

texts.es:
La señora Carmen  Z. es socia del Bankito Progresista, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca  considerada por los ecuatorianos como la ciudad más bella del país. Una de las primeras cosas que remarcará cuando entre en la ciudad es su fabulosa línea de horizonte marcada por las cúpulas radiantes de sus iglesias; sus calles empedradas, sus ríos serpenteados, agraciados balcones de hierro y bellos jardines forman parte de la atmósfera afable de esta ciudad histórica atractivos que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 54 años de edad,  es madre soltera de seis hijos que se encuentran  de 32, 26, 24, 22, 21, 16 años, vive con su ultima hija de 16 años que estudia en un colegio de la localidad y una de sus hijas casadas con quien comparte no solo la casa sino también los gastos que se incurren en ella, nos manifiesta que la casa es arrendada.

Carmen tiene un pequeño local adecuado en su misma casa donde vende comida desde hace doce años, comenzó por iniciativa propia y por salir  adelante con su familia, su jordana se inicia muy temprano para preparar sus platos y alistar todo para la hora que llegan sus clientes, y finaliza cuando ha terminado todo lo que prepara para la venta.

 Anteriormente ya era socia del banco pero se retiró por problemas de enfermedad y hace un año  que reingreso, con su nuevo crédito va a  comprar  arroz,  azúcar, sal, aceite, condimentos y otros productos necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas.

Tiene como meta  ver a sus hijos progresar día a día junto a sus familias.
texts.en:
Carmen Z. is a a member of the 'Bankito Progresista' (Progressive Bank), and lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca, which Equatorians consider to be the most beautiful city in the country. One of the first things you notice when you enter the city is its wonderful skyline, marked by radiant church domes; its cobbled streets, serpent-like rivers, attractive iron-work balconies and beautiful gardens, all of which form part of the lovely atmosphere of this historic city whose sites of interest attract tourists from Equador and abroad. Carmen is a 54 year old single mother of six children, who are 32, 26, 24, 22, 21 and 16 years of age. She lives in a rented house with her 16 year old daughter, who studies at a local secondary school, and with one of her married daughters who shares not only the house but also the bills. Carmen runs a small shop from her own house where she has been selling food for 12 years. She started the shop out of her own initiative so she could get her family ahead. Her day begins very early to prepare the meals and get everything ready for her customers, and finishes when everything she has made has been sold. She had been a member of Bankito Progresista for some time but she had to pull out due to illness. She has since returned a year ago and with the loan that she is applying for she hopes to buy rice, sugar, salt, oil, condiments and other necessary products for her meals. Her goal is to see her children and their families get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, salt, oil and condiments

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 55-year old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children. Two of his children also work to help support the family. He has been working in the agricultural industry for 15 years. He has been running his own farm since 2001.

He is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. He plans to invest in a new plough for his tractor with the loan. This will be his second loan from Ameen.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to more than 41,000 borrowers and disbursed more than 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To invest in a new plough for his tractor

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma C. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 25 years old. Alma is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling mobile phone credit loads in the local community. Alma is just starting this business.

In 2010, Alma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Alma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Charily

texts.en: Charily D. C. is a married woman who lives in Prk. 2, Tuyom, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: buying and selling rice and a general store business. Her husband, Dionesio D. C., who is 58 years old, works as a driver to earn his living. They have 10 children who are 4 months to 26 years old. Charily joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Charily has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 29,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP - improving the family's standard of living. This time, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP which she intends to use as additional working capital and to buy fertilizer so that she can continue to save up for the future and purchase additional agricultural land. Charily D. C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For additional working capital and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
A hard-working entrepreneur, Evelyn has run a busines buying and selling frozen foods for almost five years from Antipolo in the province of Rizal, earning a reasonable weekly profit. Evelyn’s main challenge has been having a small stock due to the hindrances of small working capital to put into her frozen foods venture. 

In 2005, she joined ASHI, a Kiva partner in the Philippines, and is very grateful for secured access to capital and other services such as savings and insurance. This loan amounting 30,000 Php is to help Evelyn buy frozen food products to increase her stock to match her customers’ demands in the local area. She thinks that commercializing her business and expanding it will enable her to earn more revenue and be able to pay school fees for her three children and cater for other family needs. With access to additional working capital from Kiva supporters, Evelyn is hopeful her dreams of sending her children to a university to complete college degrees will be achieved. Evelyn’s wishes to give her children a brighter future fuel her dedication to her business.

loans.use: To buy frozen food products.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 35 years old and is married. She earns her living by selling a variety of new women’s shoes. She has been in this business for about ten years and the hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m.

Clementine needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. She really hopes that it will allow her to expand her business through purchasing different sizes of shoes for sale. If successful, she will also start selling wholesale.

Through accessing this loan, Clementine has a hope of a better future for her business as well as for her family.

loans.use: To purchase different sizes of shoes to sell

loans.name: By God In Power Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “By God In Power” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to boost their businesses. 

Salamatu J. who is pictured on the left is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Salamatu is twenty-five years old, married, with one child who is still not of school-going age. Salamatu sells groundnuts/peanuts and firewood.  With the help of this loan, she will expand her business by buying more groundnuts and firewood to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy more groundnuts and firewood

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio D. 30 años, vive en Primavera D. Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución), el tiene un pequeño Cyber-cabinas. 

El trabajaba dando mantenimiento a computadoras pero no le alcanzaba para mantener a su familia, por eso comenzó a comprar computadoras para tener un Cyber poco a poco comenzó a comprar impresoras y cabinas D. teléfono. Trabaja todo el día. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar  computadoras para darle una mejor atención a su clienteL., en el futuro quiere tener una línea D. Cyber y así asegurar L. economía D. su familia.
texts.en:
30-year old Julio lives in the suburb of Primavera D. Duran, an area with a deteriorating eco-system. He runs a small Internet cafe. He used to work in computer maintenance but he didn’t earn enough money to support his family, so he started to buy computers so he could open an Internet cafe. Over time he also bought printers and phone booths. He works every day. With the loan Julio wants to buy more computers so he can proviD. a better service to his customers. His goal is to have a chain of cybercafes and thus ensure his family’s financial future.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy computers

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Jehova es mi Pastor lo integran tres féminas luchadoras en la vida con actividades similares, Liseth Carolina B. L. es una de ella y  se dedica a la venta de frutas como limones, naranjas, naranjas agrias, piñas, pitahayas, etc. Ella inició esta actividad hace 10 años cuando después de ser empleada doméstica decidió ser su propia empleadora. Las metas de esta mujer son arreglar su casa y que sus hijos sigan estudiando. Justina del Carmen R. y Yamilett de los Santos S. venden verduras en el mercado de Masaya desde hace más de 18 años.
texts.en:
The “Jehova es mi Pastor” (Jehovah is my Pastor) communal bank is made up of three tenacious women with similar activities. Liset Carolina B. López is one of them. She sells fruits like: lemons, oranges, sour oranges, pineapples, dragon fruit, etc. She started the business 10 years ago when after having been a domestic employee for some time she decided to work for herself. Her goals are to make home improvements and that her children stay in school. Justina del Carmen R. and Yamilett de los Santos Sánchez have sold vegetables in Masaya’s market foro ver 18 years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin O. O. is a single young man. He does not have any children yet but he is determined to make money so that when he gets a family, he will be able to take care of them. He runs a business known by the name 'Designers and Dressmaking'. He makes clothes which include trouser suits, ladies' dresses and skirts. 

His business is located at the busy Haile Selaisie street in Mombasa, Kenya. He has been in this business for the last two years and he says that the business is very profitable and the only major challenge is lack of enough funds on his side and delayed payments by customers. 

He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more materials to make more clothes as per the customers' demand. He sees himself owning a chain of tailoring shops in future. He describes himself as honest, committed to his work, and trustworthy.

loans.use: Materials to make clothing

loans.name: Cinthia Vanessa

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadí de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Cinthia, tiene 26 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tuvo dos hijos uno de 7 años y otro de seis meses, el primero estudia en escuela. Su esposo tiene un local de accesorios para carro.

Ella se dedica al comercio, vende  artículos para el hogar como por ejemplo planchas, licuadoras, camas, colchones, etc. Ella sale a recorrer con una revista donde están todos sus productos, los ofrece y si los clientes le compran al otro día les lleva los pedidos, deja a crédito y cobra los fines de semana o cada quince días. Estos productos ella los recibe en Portoviejo en una distribuidora que le entrega a un precio razonable para que a ella le quede ganancias.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en pagar ciertos pedidos que tiene para estos días, ya que todo su capital esta invertido y tiene que cumplir con los pedidos. Esta en el Banco desde el comienzo y le gusta por la forma como se trabaja en la institución.
 
Su sueño es seguir creciendo en el negocio.
texts.en:
The Nueva Ilusión communal bank meets every 15 days in the Cadí area of the Colón parish, located in the city of Portoviejo, a place known for its hardworking people and its business in farming and cattle farming.

Here we find Cinthia, who is 26 years old and has a common-law husband. They have two children – one is 7 years old and is in school, and the other is 6 months old. Cinthia’s husband has a business selling car accessories.

Cinthia works selling household items such as irons, blenders, beds, mattresses, etc. She goes out with a magazine that shows her products to sell. If the customers buy them, she brings their orders another day, leaves them on credit, and picks up the payments on the weekends or every 15 days. She gets the items at a distributor in Portoviejo who sells them to her at a reasonable price so that she can make money from it.

Cinthia will use this loan to pay for some of the recent orders because all of her capital is invested and she needs to fill the orders. She has been with the communal bank from the beginning and she likes the way that the institution works.

Her dream is for her business to continue growing.

loans.use: To pay for the orders of various items.

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel D. G. is from the village of Simimbaan. She is 23 years old. Marifel is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $88 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marifel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Eneria

texts.en:
Eneria T. is from the village of Mauswagon, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Eneria owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector selling coconut products (copra and coal). Eneria has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Eneria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eneria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Eneria is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP that will be used for corn production. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Eneria from PMPC.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For corn production

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane M. is a Married woman who lives in Brgy. Baod, Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  blacksmith shop and buying and selling of ready to wear clothes. Her husband, Marcelino M., who is 57 years old, works as a blacksmith in their shop to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 11 children who are between 15 and 32 years old.

Mary Jane joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mary Jane has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 28,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for future house repair and support for the education of her grandchildren. Mary Jane M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty N. lives in the Kamwokya Kifumbira neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom attend school.  Betty has a business of selling yellow bananas.  She has been in this business for eight years and she works six days a week.   Betty sells her products at the market.  Betty has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bunches of bananas.     Betty generates additional income through renting rooms.  The main business challenges for Betty include thieves and the rainy season.  Her goal  for her business is to buy directly from farmers.  Betty lives in a home, which she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase bananas

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 42 years old and is married to Damaris Wangechi, who is a farmer. They have three children and support two other members of their family. James has a two-year-old motorcycle business that generates an income of about 38,000 Kenyan shillings per month.

This is his second loan after clearing his previous loan successfully. He wants to use the loan to start a poultry farm to add more income for his family. He hopes to expand this poultry farm in order to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To start a poultry farm

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, married and has one child.

In 2008, H. decided to run his own business, so he opened an electronics and household appliance store. He provides his customers with a wide variety of products. He is becoming well known in the local area and has a good reputation.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to redecorate his shop to attract more customers. He is planning to expand his business and be wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: Redecorate his shop

loans.name: Nelly Paredes' Group

texts.en:
Nelly P. is from the barangay of Catadman, city of Ozamis. She is 50 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Nelly has a carenderia (a small restaurant) and vulcanizing (auto parts) shop. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Nelly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional foods to sell and maintenance for her vulcanizing shop. This will be the second loan taken out by Nelly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Capital for carenderia (restaurant) and auto parts shop

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred, 31, is married with four school-aged children who all attend school. He is a farmer in Kitale town, western Kenya, where he has been farming for seven years. He sells his milk and onions at the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the basic needs of his family.

He recently repaid his previous loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested another loan of 31,200 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will enable him to send his children to a better school. His major challenge is lack of enough animal feed, especially during the dry season.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: María

texts.es: María, es una madre de familia piadosa y estricta, de 64 años. Viuda hace muchos años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su hijo, con quien tratan de salir adelante. María, vende ropa de niños y niñas a sus familiares y amistades de su barrio y le va bien, ya que su buen carácter hizo que muchos la aprecien y prefieran,  por ello que últimamente vende edredones y cubrecamas, de acuerdo al pedio que le hacen. De esta manera  viene trabajando hace 9 años y se siente muy satisfecha de realizar su negocio, ya que le es rentable por lo que se provee del emporio comercial del centro de Lima. Por ello, a veces su hijo la apoya en sus compras y, eso le reconforta mucho, del modo que los vende a precios más asequibles sin mayor esfuerzo. Esta emprendedora madre de familia esta convencida,  que si trabaja constantemente con la misma responsabilidad, en adelante logrará  instalar su taller de confección en su casa y  de ese modo aumentar sus ingresos. El 22avo crédito que tiene con MFP María, dice “que pagará todas sus cuotas,  como las anteriores créditos” y, de ese no perjudicar a los integrantes de su grupo, ya que son personas muy responsables. De obtener el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercaderías para entregar sus pedidos pendientes y, de ese modo continuar trabajando.
texts.en:
María is a pious and strict mother who is 64 years old. She became a widow many years ago and lives, along with her son, in her own house. Together, they try to get ahead. María usually sells boys and girls clothing to her family and friends in the neighborhood, and it is going well because her good personality means that people appreciate her and prefer to buy from her. Lately, she has been selling quilts and bedspreads because that is what her customers want.

She has been doing this work for 9 years and feels very satisfied with her business, as it is profitable. She stocks up at the commercial emporium in central Lima and sometimes her son helps her make her purchases. This makes her feel better because she can sell at more accessible prices without any great loss.

This enterprising mother is convinced that if she works constantly with the same level of responsibility, in the future she will be able to set up a sewing workshop in her house, which would increase her income.

This will be María's 22nd loan through MFP. She says, "I will make all my repayments, just like with my previous loans." By doing so, she would avoid harming the other members of her group, who are very responsible individuals.

She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise to fill her pending orders, and in this manner, to continue working.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (bedspreads and quilts) to meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Lucio; el tiene 28 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio trabaja en un taller de mecánica de nombre Divi Motors el trabaja de lunes a sábado por las mañanas y tardes, el socio anteriormente trabajaba en otras entidades con la finalidad de ahorrar su dinero y comprarse un terrenito para su familia o bien poner un negocio y actualmente está trabajando y ahorrando con este fin, el socio es una persona bien alegre y entusiasta con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

El socio solicita el préstamo para su uso personal como ahorrar para comprarse un terreno o finalmente poner algún negocio propio.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
Sr. Lucio is a member of the Communal Bank “Patron San Sebastian” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

He is 28 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Lucio is employed at an auto repair shop called Divi Motors where he works Monday through Saturday in the morning and afternoon. He previously worked at other entities so that he could save some money to buy a small plot of land for his family or start a business. Lucio is currently working and saving toward this goal. He is a cheerful person who is enthusiastic about moving forward with this family.

The loan he is requesting is for personal use. He will save the money toward the purchase of a piece of land and eventually for starting his own business. Lucio is happy with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: The funds will be saved toward the purchase of a piece of land and eventually for starting his own business

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is a member of Gakuyu group registered under Faulu Kenya. Through Faulu Kenya, he saves his money and he can easily access business loans.  He sells shoes and second-hand clothes so in order to earn a living.  He was previously operating a retail shop.  He has been in the business for six years.  He hopes to open another branch of his business.  With 50, 000 Kes, he will add to his stock of shoes and clothes.

loans.use: To add to his stock of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Balyewunya Mixed Group

texts.en:
Sarah N. is 45 years old, a single mother of four and runs a pub located in the Takajjunge trading center. She sells a variety of highly popular hard and soft liquor beverages which brings in weekly profits of 80,000 UGX. Sarah also supplements her earnings by selling bread.

Sarah has been affiliated with the Balyewunya Mixed Group, Mukono, for the last eight years. With this loan she is going to purchase more crates of both hard and soft beverages to resell.

In this group photo, one lady by the name of Harriet N. is not seen clearly, as her face is obscured behind another client wearing a red gomesi, or dress. She is identified as missing, in addition to other members who were not there when the photo was taken.

loans.use: To purchase both hard and soft beverages to resell

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat, 46 years old, married A. R. and moved to Kot Radha Kishan 16 years ago. Kot Radha Kishan is a small city in Pakistan located in Punjab province and famous for its dairy industry. She lives there in the area of Usman town in a three-room brick house with her family. She is a housewife as well as a working lady. She stays at home and does her household work. She also operates her embroidery business at her home. She crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes which gets good acknowledgment from her community clients. 

Farhat is the mother of two sons. Both are young and getting their education by attending a local school. Her husband operates a milk and yogurt shop in the market. He never compromises on quality and that’s why he has a good number of clients who buys milk and yogurt from him regularly.  

Farhat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to improve his business. Using the loan, he will buy milk in larger quantity to make yogurt from it so he will be able to sell his products to many more customers and increase his monthly profits. 

Farhat is hopeful that by investing loan money into her husband’s business, her husband will be able to  increase his sales and profits which will help her family to have a better standard of living. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Farhat.

loans.use: To buy milk for milk & yogurt sales business.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is 24 years old. She has two children who are ages 3 and 7 years. One child is in school. 

Alphonsine owns a milling machine and she has been running it for two years. This milling machine has enabled her to build a small family house. 

She also owns a shop in which she sells different items that are commonly needed at home. 

She is requesting a loan to buy another milling machine, which she expects will earn her more money.

loans.use: to buy a milling machine

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Baasansuren, 48, is married and lives with her husband and son in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her husband is a driver with a monthly salary of 220,000 MNT, and her son is a student. She runs a food cafe near Ih Buyan local market, in her town. She started her business in 2005. She prepares and sells Mongolian traditional meals including buuz, huushuur and tsuivan etc. Her business is quite profitable because of the good location.  She has managed to build a small cafe. 

She is a polite woman who is planning to continue her business in the future. She also is planning to remodel her cafe in order to improve the surrounding site and to broaden the selection of her menu. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials and some ingredients for her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Janat

texts.en:
Janat lives in Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (father).    

Janat has a business of a restaurant. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week. She sells her products from home, by means of retail.    

Janat has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, cooking oil, rice, beef and sweet potatoes. She also generates additional income through selling cold drinks. The main business challenges for Janat include defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are see her business grow big and to own a fully stocked restaurant.   

Janat lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Union And Strength Group

texts.en: Maira Dalila, Santos Humberto and Santa Margarita, all residents of the Valle region of Honduras, formed the "Union and Strength" solidarity group in June of 2011. Collectively they will serve as guarantors of each others' loans. Both Maira Dalila and Santos Humberto operate small convenience shops where they sell basic foodstuffs, personal hygiene products and other household items. They are requesting loans of 8,000 HNL and 5,000 HNL, with which they will purchase merchandise for their shops. Santa Margarita operates a business selling firewood in large quantities, as well as refreshments, snacks and other basic food items. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 HNL, with which she will buy merchandise to sell in her business.

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase meats, cheeses, vegetables, fruits, dairy products, refreshments, snacks, beverages, basic grains, personal hygiene products, household cleaning supplies and firewood.

loans.name: Kokui

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits de premières nécessités (riz, sucre, huile végétale) depuis 2000, Kokui est mère de 03 enfants. Elle a 34ans et a pour époux conducteur de taxi. Madame s’approvisionne d’habitude au Grand Marché de Lomé et revend dans sa boutique à DJIDJOLE. Ce troisième  prêt lui servira à acheter des marchandises vu que son stock s’épuise pour vendre à sa clientèle.
texts.en: Selling staple goods (rice, sugar, vegetable oil) since 2000, Kokui is the mother of three children. She is 34 and her husband is a taxi driver. She usually buys her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé and sells them in her little store in DJIDJOLE. This third loan will serve to buy merchandise, in view of the fact that she is running low on goods to sell to her clientele.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Noupagagnon I Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe NOUPAGAGNON I sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41ans, 4enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  TAMBA, un des villages de la commune de NANTIEN dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : l’arachide et le pois sucré avec MARIAM 1ère à gauche position debout de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 1hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50.500FCFA par campagne.
