In addition to selling the bolis, both of them sell ice cream, candy and merchandise such as clothes, shoes and acccesories from the house. This is his second loan and he invested the last one in improving the selection of merchandise in his business. In the future, he dreams of having a bigger business in a good location. Setting it up is also his biggest challenge since money is required. Additionally, his goal is to establish a workshop for his son, who is taking classes in automotive technology and vehicular gas technology in the SENA, a national organization that encourages learning.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise, especially clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Thư's Group

texts.en: Thư N. Thị B. (20201050081) is a 28-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. She is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Phú Mẫn2 - 05 (14). Thư is married and has two school-aged children. She owns and operates a business providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 4,300,000 VND a month. In 2010, Thư joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. The loan will be her first from SEDA. Thư plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. N. Thị Lý (20201050082) is a 20-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her service-based business. 2. N. Thị Thủy (20201050083) is a 45-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her butcher shop. 3. Lê Thị Tân (20201050052) is a 34-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her general store. 4. Lê Thị Sợi (20201050050) is a 53-year-old female who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND loan to support her recycling business. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low-income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Thư N. Thị B. (20201050081) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Thư là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phú Mẫn2 - 05 (14). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ làm tóc & làm đẹp cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. Thư thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Thư kiếm được khoảng 4.300.000 VND. Vào 2010, Thư đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Thư đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. Thị Lý (20201050082) là 20 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 2. N. Thị Thủy (20201050083) là 45 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t. 3. Lê Thị Tân (20201050052) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. 4. Lê Thị Sợi (20201050050) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là cung cấp dịch vụ tái chế. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: Doña Maria vive junto con su familia, tiene la edad de 60 años, mujer que desde joven ha logrado las expectativa gracias al apoyo de su familia y esposo que junto trabajan para lograr los objetivos, del negocio  la venta de espejos decorados, cuadros en óleo el cual son muy vendido por ser paisajes bonitos y Nicaragüenses. Estos productos son elaborados por varios trabajadores que tienen, y son distribuidos en diferentes departamentos del país el cual sé dan al crédito y alguno al contado. Desde que inicio su negocio es poder lograr el crecimiento en sus ventas. Es por eso viajan a muchos kilómetros de la capital para poder ofertar sus espejos ya que la demanda es alta. Con este crédito incrementara el volumen de  productos en donde comprara: yeso, pinturas, espejo, pintura para pintar los cuadros, madera, marcos. Lograr con esto aumentar las ventas y cubrir los gastos del negocio como personal.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is a 60 year old woman who lives with her family. From a young age, Maria has been able to live up to expectations thanks to the support of her family and her husband who have worked with her to achieve her objectives. She manages a business selling decorated mirrors and oil paintings of beautiful Nicaraguan landscapes. These products are produced by various workers that she hires and then distributed to different parts of the country. Her sales are made on credit and sometimes in cash. Since starting her business, Maria has been able to increase her sales. For this reason, she travels several kilometers to the capital to sell her mirrors which are in great demand.

This loan will allow her to increase the volume of products she offers. She plans to buy plaster, various types of paint, mirrors, wood, and frames. Maria will be able to generate more sales and cover both her business and personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plaster, various types of paint, mirrors, wood, and frames

loans.name: Yana

texts.en:
Yana is married, with two children. She sells clothing at the main open market in Novomoskovsk town. Yana has been in this business for eight years. Her hard-working habits and enthusiasm encourage other market venders to continue their businesses in spite of difficult economic times.

Yana's business goal is to start a second location to increase sales. She would like to borrow 13,000 UAH to purchase more inventory for the coming summer season. Yana has used micro loans before. She finds them very helpful for developing her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Nyarurooma Adults Group, Bushenyi

texts.en:
Operating a farm has been a tremendous business venture for K. Night from Nyarugote, Bushenyi. Having had a big family of eight children, with a careless husband who is forever thinking of drinking alcohol rather than any other productive work, Night, aged 52 years, worked tooth and nail to start up the sale of bananas which are commonly used to prepare a local dish by customers here in Uganda.

Along with this business Night has a pineapple garden and coffee trees, all of which supplement her income. Thus, she is always able to earn 200,000 Ugandan shillings monthly.

This loan is to help her do the mulching, buy stake poles for her plantation and buy pesticides. This will help her improve her production and sales revenue to enable her take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase mulches, stake poles and pesticides

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is 33 years old. He is married and has three children between the ages of 2 and 8. Two of the children are currently attending school.

He is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for 12 years and has employed three people from his community. His products are milk, which he sells to the tea estate, and tea which he sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority. He also earns income from his posho mill and a powersaw (used for cutting down trees and timber) which he hires out.

His major challenges have been a transportation problem since they live in the rural area, and lack of enough food for his cattle.

Wesley has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 80,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow. This loan will enable him to acquire a quality dairy cow that will increase his milk production and earn him more income. He will also be able to provide enough milk for his family and pay school fees for his children with the extra income.

In 5 years time, he would like to have six dairy cows of good quality.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
This four member group loan, led by Mrs. Vanny K., is based in Preaek Ph'av village in Kandal province. All the members will use their loan for different purposes. 


Mrs. Vanny K. sells sweet potato grill, door to door. Her husband, Mr. Chhat Sambo, is a construction worker. She has a problem in that her cart, which she uses in her business, is broken. To solve this, and to improve her business, Mrs. Vanny K. is applying for a loan to fix her cart. 


She is the mother of four children. One of them is a seamstress in a garment factory; two are enrolled in the local public school and help their parents’ businesses, and the youngest one is two years old.

loans.use: To fix her cart

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua E. is a widow who takes care of seven dependents. She has no formal educational background.

Efua is a fishmonger at Elmina and uses the income she generates to educate, clothe and feed her dependents. She is going to use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke and sell.

With the fresh profits from her increased business, Efua plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Rabina

texts.en:
This is 26 year old Rabina N.. She is married and has no children. In 2005, she established her agriculture business, and works 7 days a week and 8 hours a day to support her family. She used her most recent loan to increase her investment in cultivation.  In the future, Rabina plans to promote her agriculture business. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much needed cash income throughout the year. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: To increase investment in agriculture.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma H. T.   es una señora de 24 años de edad la  cual vive con su esposo en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

El negocio de Vilma es la lechería,  y todos los productos derivados de esta. Sus productos son de  muy buena calidad, y este negocio siempre le ha  dado buenos ingresos, pero necesita crecer.
Es por eso que Doña Vilma está solicitando un Crédito de ¢604.000 (seiscientos cuatro mil colones) para la compra de alambre para la cerca, alimento  y semilla de pasto, para reactivar su producción nuevamente y que sus vaquitas tengan lo que necesitan para dar su mejor leche.

Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo,  y está muy feliz porque asegura que este préstamo le permitirá seguir haciendo lo a ella le gusta y generando ingresos a la misma vez.
texts.en:
Vilma H. T. is a 24-year-old who lives with her husband in a community called Santa Fe, located in Los Chiles, in the Alajuela province. This community is known for being a mountainous area that is very close to the northern border of this country. Its main economic activities are stockbreeding and agriculture, particularly staple grains, sugar cane, and oranges.

Vilma is a dairy farmer, selling all types of products that are derived from milk. Her products are high-quality, and her business has always yielded great profits, but she needs to expand. For this reason, Ms. Vilma is requesting a ¢604.000 CRC loan so that she can purchase wire for her fence, and grass seed in order to reactivate production and to provide everything that her cows need in order give their best milk.

She is a member of the Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe company, one of the 100 organizations that have a partnership with EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and she is very happy because she is sure that this loan will allow her to keep doing what she likes while at the same time earning a living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wire and grass seed

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es: Julio tiene la edad de 45 años, es casado y tiene 3 hijos que tienen las edades de 12,15, y 5, que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere comprar abonos y insumos para el café para aumentar la cosecha de esta año que por ahora está muy mala por falta de las lluvias y pagarlo pues lo debía en un almacén. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva con una producción de mayor calidad y cantidad. También, el no ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos. El tiene el deseo de brindarle a su hijo la educación necesaria a su hijo para que sea en el futuro una persona preparada y pueda enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
Julio, 45, is married and has three children who are 12, 15 and 5 years of age and who are his greatest priority in life. He wants to buy manure and supplies for his coffee plants so that this year’s harvest will be larger because the draught this year has led to poor yields; he also has to pay a warehouse where he has a debt. He has devoted several years to his farm and wants to grow. This is his first loan from FUDECUSUR. He didn’t have any problems with his property but he does hope it will be a productive farm with crops of improved quality and quantity. He has had no loans with other banks. He hopes to give his son the necessary education so that he will be prepared for the future and be able to face life more easily.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Manure for the coffee plants.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: kayi H. est une dame de 62 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 5 enfants, l'activité qu'elle exerce pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce de sacs de charbons de bois. elle a commencé ce commerce en 2001. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays ce qui lui permet de bénéficier d'une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ces ventes. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. elle a constaté une baisse de son stock de marchandises. elle souhaiterai par conséquent  se réapprovisionner et sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat d'une vingtaine de sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Ms Kayi H. is a 62 year old woman, a widow, and a mother of 5 children. She has been selling bags of charcoal to a variety of customers since 2001 in order to provide for her family's needs. She stocks up in the middle of the country, which allows her to re-sell the charcoal with a larger profit margin. She is asking for a loan from WAGES in order to purchase 20 more bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth L. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 45 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from selling food and daily use products in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. This will be the fifth loan that Elizabeth has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Alaida

texts.en:
Alaida L. is from the village of Maribucao, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old. Alaida is single. To make a living, Alaida owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts in the local community. Alaida also makes and sells coconut charcoal. Alaida has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Alaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alaida successfully repaid her first loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional coconuts to buy and sell. Alaida is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes F. is from the village of Misom, Baliangao. She is 54 years old, married and has one adult  child. To make a living, Lourdes owns a business making and selling food. She has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2008, Lourdes joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC which was used as business capital and is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to redeem pawned land. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Lourdes from PMPC. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To redeem her pawned land

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
This village loan group consists of eight members. They are living in Chong Preaek village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chan C., 44 years old, was selected as the village bank president by its members of this village loan group.  Each member of this village will use their money to support a different purpose. 

Mrs. Chan C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow flowers. She does not have enough money to buy a machine to pump the water to grow her flowers. She would like to ask for a loan to buy a water pump to support her flower growing business. Her husband, Mr. Hong Vuthy, 48 years old, works as motorbike taxi driver. He is able to earn some income to support his family. This couple has six children: One is seamstress in a garment factory, one is clothes seller,  three are attending in the local school and the last one is 4 years old and not in school yet.

loans.use: To buy a water pump to support her flower growing business

loans.name: Ledevina

texts.en:
Ledevina M. is from the village of San Jose, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old. Ledevina is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Ledevina owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling feed in the local community. Ledevina has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ledevina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ledevina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ledevina is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ledevina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 42 year old single mother of a child, living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a dream of building a permanent house in the future. For 6 years, she has been operating a retail shop. The business has enabled her to educate her child, but she is faced with a challenge of limited capital to meet the demands of her customers. Joyce needs the loan to buy  soap, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: To buy soap, sugar and salt to sell

loans.name: Alonso Herminio

texts.es:
Alonso Herminio A. tiene 42 años, es casado y tiene 4 hijos (Miguel Angel, 25, Victor Alonso, 24, Johana Alexandra, 22 y Kruzkaya Kayetara, 14). El vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Alonso Herminio es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.   

Alonso Herminio trabaja en cerrajería. El compra y vende sus productos en Matilde Esther, Bucay y Milagro. El solicita el crédito para incrementar el taller. 

Su sueño es tener una cubierta metálica. El mayor desafío que se enfrenta en el negocio seria que los clientes retiren sus obras en el tiempo estimado. 

Sus hobbies son ve el futbol en la televisión y salir a ver el futbol y el indoor que se realiza en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Alonso Herminio A. is 42 years old.  He is married and has 4 children (25 year-old Miguel Angel, 24 year-old Victor Alonso, 22 year-old Johana Alexandra and 14 year-old Kruzkaya Kayetara).  He lives in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

Alonso Herminio is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) rural loan group.  This new group is located in the community of Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.

Alonso Herminio works in a locksmith's shop.  He buys and sells his products in Matilde Esther, Bucay and Milagro.  He is requesting this loan to expand his workshop.  His dream is to have a metal roof.  The biggest challenge he faces in his business is customers not collecting the work he has done on time.  His hobbies are watching soccer on television and going out to watch outdoor and indoor soccer matches which take place in the community.

loans.use: To expand his workshop

loans.name: Zabayo Group

texts.fr: Kiroha S.  est entrepreneur, présidente du groupe Zabayo, âgée de 47 ans, mariée, mère de 9 enfants.  Son conjoint est un enseignant. Elle fait le petit commerce de vente de  boissons (Primus et boissons locales) à son domicile. Elle fait également l’agriculture.  Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ au début de  2010. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits (5 casiers de Primus, 6 bidons de boissons locales mandrakwa) et la location de lopin de terre de 2 hectares à cultiver). En plus, elle ambitionne construire confortablement une maison dans le quartier populaire Majengo. La cliente Kiroha S.  remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Zabayo est constitué de 31 membres.
texts.en: Kiroha S. is an entrepreneur and the leader of the group named Zabayo. She is 47 years old and she is the mother of 9 children. Her partner is a teacher. She has a small business selling drinks (Primus and local drinks) from her home. She is also an agriculturist. She started out her business with her own money, given to her by her husband. She received a loan from IMF Hekima (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of $50 in early 2010. This new loan will help her buy more products (5 boxes of Primus, 6 tubs of a local drink called mandrakwa) and to buy 2 hectares of land to cultivate. Additionally, she hopes to comfortably build a house in the popular quarter of Majengo. Kiroha S. is grateful to Hekima for their actions towards the poor who are excluded from traditional banks. The Zabayo group is made up of 31 members.

loans.use: To purchase drinks for resale and 2 hectares of land to cultivate.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a thirty-four-year-old married woman with four children. She started a small eating joint and raised capital which she used to buy fresh food. She now sells this fresh food in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. She hopes to grow her business to sustain her family. Beatrice wants a loan to buy fresh food to sell.

loans.use: Purchasing fresh food to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa A. es socia del banco comunal San Miguel, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre y  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle,  esta parroquia es admirada por la belleza natural que hay en el sector, su gente es muy trabajadora y se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.

Doña Rosa tiene 40 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 22, 18, 14 y 11 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan a la economía del hogar, su tercer hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija en una escuela del sector. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, con el trabajo de los dos han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Rosa se dedica a la cría de chanchos y pollos a los cuales los vende en su comunidad, también trabaja lavando ropa ajena, esta actividad la realiza 4 días a la semana.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 12 años, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para así crecer más en su negocio. Su meta es terminar su casa ya que le faltan algunos acabados.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa A. is a member of the San Miguel community bank. She lives in the community of the same name in the El Valle parish. This parish is admired for the area's natural beauty. Its people are very hardworking and work in commerce, raising animals and farming. 

Rosa is 40 years old, married and has 4 children aged  22, 18, 14 and 11 years old.  Her two oldest children work and help with the household expenses. Her third son is in highschool and her youngest daughter is in an elementary school in the area. Her husband works as a bricklayer in construction and together they have been able to build their own house. 

Rosa works raising pigs and chickens, which she sells in the community. She also works washing other people's clothes. She does this activity 4 days a week. 

She has been a member of the community bank for 12 years. She will invest the money for the loan in buying pigs to make her business grow. Her goal is to finish her house, since it needs some finishings.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by selling vegetables. Her husband Freddie, who is 44 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living. They have five children who are between 8 and 21 years old. Gemma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gemma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 21st loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to buy more vegetables to sell so that she can continue to save up for her children's education & household improvements. Gemma is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To fund her business operations

loans.name: Abdumumin

texts.en:
M. Abdumumin is a very loving father devoted to the needs of his children, whom he adores. He works raising livestock and every morning leaves home to take his animals to pasture in the surrounding area. His desire is to improve the quality of his animals, but in order to do this he would need to purchase livestock of better breeds and these animals are very costly. Abdumumin needs capital of $1,500 USD, and at the moment he does not have that much money, so he is requesting this loan. He hopes that you trust in his hard work and honesty. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Khaetullo

texts.en:
Khaetullo G. is an entrepreneurial young man who is engaged in cattle breeding. He is a responsible person and a grateful son, who lives with his parents and supports them, according to Kyrgyz tradition. He started his business using initial capital of 10,000 soms (KGS) for purchasing cattle and manages to earn about 9,000 KGS in a month. With hard work and great effort, Khaetullo has multiplied the number of milch cows and with the revenue, he was able to buy a car for his family. 
 
Khaetullo has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy more milch cows, which will allow him raise his milk sales. He is eager to broaden his business because he plans to have a baby. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target an especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Bendicion Group

texts.es:
El comité Bendición se creó desde hace más de dos años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de San Lorenzo y en estos más de dos años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. 
La sra. Ceferina se dedica a la venta de frutas, posee una pequeña frutería donde trata de proveer de los mejores frutos a todas las personas que deseen ser sus clientes, para ella la calidad es la clave del éxito, por ello trata de que sus productos se encuentren en excelentes condiciones para la venta y el consumo.
Ella, como las demás integrantes se preocupan mucho por el bienestar de sus familias, y desean el crédito para poder adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías, en este caso la sra. Ceferina desea poder comprar más frutas para ofrecer, pues la demanda es mucha y desea poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Bendición (Blessing) committee was created more than two years ago through the leadership and support of another committee that worked in the same region. The members of the committee are from San Lorenzo, and in more than two years of very hard work they have grown socially as well as economically. They are known throughout the area as very hardworking women.

Sra. Ceferina sells fruit from a small fruit stand where she tries to sell high quality fruit to all her customers. In her opinion, this is the key to her success. Her goal is to have fruit in excellent condition for both selling and eating. 

Like the other members, Ceferina is concerned about the wellbeing of her family. They all want to use their loan to buy more merchandise. Ceferina, for example, wishes to buy more fruit because the demand is there and she wants to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy citrus fruit like pineapples, oranges, grapefruit, etc.

loans.name: Josephin

texts.en:
Josephine is 31 and married with three children. Her eldest child is 13. Josephine’s husband works as a farmer. She is also a farmer and for the past five years has been working in San Francisco, Agusan del sur. Josephine earns 13,000 PHP a month. 

Josephine is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds. In the future, she hopes to make her livelihood successful.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 7 years, Sylvia has been operating a tailoring business, selling to local customers and passersby.  Her major challenges are seasonality and the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her tailoring business in order to meet her customers' demand. 

With the loan for Kshs 30,000, Sylvia wants to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Vangeline

texts.en:
Vangeline is 35 and is a married woman. She has 3 children. The oldest child is 6. 

Vangeline is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. She has been growing corn and vegetables for 6 and 1/2 years. She earns 10,000 PHP per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to improve her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jesus Tiene Poder Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JESUS TIENE PODER” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rosario. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verdura, cultivo en carpas, venta de verduras, venta de arena, sistema eléctrico, venta de carne. 

La señora Rosario,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de la promoción. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de carne que inicio desde niña con sus padres.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital de trabajo (compra de carne) que comprará de la Ciudad de El Alto y lo venderá mediante repartición a todas partes. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo.
texts.en:
The Jesus Tiene Poder (Jesus Has Power) Community Association started its first loan cycle with Kiva partner Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Villa Exaltacion. It is comprised of eight members and is run by a board of directors headed by Rosario. The businesses that the members of the community association run are varied. Among them we have: vegetable sales, greenhouse farming, (more) vegetable sales, sand sales, electrical systems, and meat sales.

Rosario states that this is the first time that Pro Mujer has been involved by way of an invitation from a promotion. Currently, she has a meat sales business that she started as a girl with her parents.

The loan she will now take is to augment her working capital (for purchasing meat). She will make her purchases in the city of El Alto and sell it by making distributions all over. This work allows her to generate income to support her family; she is married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said she likes everything.

loans.use: to purchase meat

loans.name: Komlagan

texts.fr: Agé de 32ans, et marié à une revendeuse de mèches, Komlagan est revendeur de pièces détachées. Ce montant lui servira de s’approvisionner en marchandises au Grand Marché de Lomé et de revendre dans sa boutique. Une personne l’aide dans l’exécution de ses taches.
texts.en: Komlagan is 32 years old, married to a retailer of hair extensions, and sells spare parts. This loan will allow him to obtain his supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé and resell them at his store. One person helps him in carrying out his tasks.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has operated in the quarry for the last fifteen years, extracting stones to sell in Ndunyu Njeru town. He is 47 years old, married to Hannah, and they have four school-going children. 

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his third loan. He paid for all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy shoes for resale. This will boost the income he gets from the quarry. 

In future, Joseph hopes to become a successful businessman in Ndunyu, owning many different types of businesses.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Srey, 41 year old, is a vegetable seller. Her husband is a carpenter. Their income is $11 per day. She has six children. Four of the children are studying and the other two are working with $3 per day for their income. Every month she has to spend $66 on food, $8 on electricity, $25 on rent, $40 on school fees, $15 on transportation, and $15 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a decorative wood machine for her husband's career. If he has his own machine, it will help him to gain more benefits and he won't have to spend his money to find another machine to use. With her profits, she would like to repair her house to be better than now and to be able to send her children to study at the university.

loans.use: To buy a decorative wood machine for her husband's career

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 35 years old and married with three children aged between 10 and 24. She runs an electrical appliances store in Grassfield, east of Freetown.

Hannah has owned this business for years and sells televisions, DVDs and home theaters at her store. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenges to her business are the rainy season and price fluctuations.

Hannah requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more electrical appliances. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her business to grow bigger. In the future, she would like to supply big companies.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical appliances such as televisions and DVD players.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna, age 50, is a widow with six children. She prepares and peddles snack items, such as rice and cassava cakes. She has had this business for two years. 

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000 in order to buy raw ingredients for preparing snacks.

Lorna has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Lorna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for preparing snacks

loans.name: Rissa

texts.en:
Rissa is a mother of two school-aged children. She is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines where her retail store is located. This has allowed her to have a monthly income of PHP 8,000, part of which comes from impermanent jobs. She has been operating the store for four years and is so glad to have reached that far despite an increasing number of competitors.

A loan of PHP 6,000 from GDMPC will help Rissa to purchase small-sized showcases to organize her stock and determine goods easily. She hopes to obtain a good profit from this investment and maintain a good flow of earnings from the business. She aspires to send her children to a reputable school when they get into college to obtain a proper education and build a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase small showcases to organize her stock.

loans.name: Sonia Diamantina

texts.es: La señora Sonia diamantina desde hace 6 años se dedica al negocio sobre ruedas, en este momento su mayor afición es la venta de ropa usada, zapatos y accesorios para el hogar. Este negocio es parte de su fuente de ingresos por tal motivo desea invertir mas en el para seguir prosperando. Diamantina se ven en la necesidad de pedir un préstamo para comprar ropa de temporada por que en esta época de regreso a clase; mucha gente busca ropa de segunda mano para sus hijos ya que alguna no cuenta con recursos para comprar nueva. Sonia se  ve la oportunidad para surtir su negocio ya que de esta forma podrá obtener mayores ganancias para el sostén familiar.
texts.en:
Sonia Diamantina has had her business-on-wheels for 6 years.  At this time, her main interest is selling used clothing, shoes, and home accessories. This business is a source of income, and for this reason, she wishes to invest in it in order to continue prospering. 

Diamentia needs to ask for a loan in order to buy seasonal clothing, because this is back-to-school season.  Many people are looking for second-hand clothing for their children, since some don't have the resources to buy it new.   Sonia sees the chance to stock her business, as in this way, she can earn more to support her family.

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Grezza

texts.en:
Grezza is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.

Grezza has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

Grezza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Grezza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Qadir

texts.en:
Qadir is a farmer devoted both to his work and to being the father of a family. He works hard raising his cattle, taking them out to graze in the early mornings. Raising cattle is not an easy task but his love for his family gives his work reason and meaning. His monthly profit is 350 USD. AqroInvest has been a fundamental part of Qadir´s business having provided loans which have been used to purchase calves and cow.
Currently, Qadir wants to improve his situation by increasing the number of his cattle which, in the long run, will provide a better income.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle, one cow and fodder

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es: El señor Octavio tiene 3 hijos y es un padre muy responsable con los gastos del hogar el cual también decidió comprar una casa de interés social en el que podría vivir cómodamente en su propio patrimonio. Para Octavio es muy importante darle un techo estable a su familia para que no sufran las inclemencias de tiempo, por tal motivo ha realizado algunas mejoras a la casa para que este acondicionada tal cual son sus necesidades de cada integrante de la familia. En este momento su proyecto es terminar los acabados de la casa por dentro para darle otra vista y pintarla, para eso necesita comprar yeso, pintura y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en: Octavio has three children and he is a father who is very responsible in covering his household expenses.  He decided to buy a house through a government-subsidized housing scheme so that he could live comfortably in his own property.  For Octavio, it is very important to provide his family with a stable home so that they don't suffer from the inclemency of the weather.  For this reason, he has made some improvements to his house so that it meets the needs of every member of the family.  His current project is to finish making some finishing touches to the inside of his home to make it look better and to paint it.  For this, he needs to buy plaster and paint, and pay labor costs.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and pay labor costs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 49 years old and married with 2 children. Mary works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari sari store for 8 years and also earns an income from charcoal retail and raising pigs.

Mary aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell.

loans.name: José Armando

texts.es:
El señor José Armando comenta que su negocio esta funcionando muy bien, pero que sus clientes le están solicitando mas variedad de mercancía que a un no tiene. Es por eso que solicita el préstamo para invertir en más variedad de mercancía.
     Don José Armando a parte del ingreso que tiene de su negocio, es empleado de una fábrica en el área de producción, y quienes le ayudan atender el negocio son su esposa y una de sus hijas. 
Desea mejorar el ingreso de su negocio, la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José Armando tells us that his business is going very well but his customers are requesting a greater variety of merchandise which he does not have.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can invest in a greater variety of merchandise.

In addition to the income he makes from his business, José Armando also works in a factory, in production.  His wife and one of his daughters help him to serve in his business.

José Armando would like to improve his income from his business and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his stationery store business

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.en:
Born in the village of Villa Luz, in the province of Isabela, Prudencio lives with his wife and their four children. 

Recognized by the people of his neighborhood as a serious man, Prudencio, a farmer, would like to expand his crop production so that it becomes a viable source of income. To do that, he needs a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer. 

The income from it will then help him to cope with the needs of his large family and give all of his children a higher education. 

Prudencio is very grateful to everyone who can help him achieve his dreams with this loan.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Robertina

texts.es: Robertina, de 44 años,  una mujer  muy sencilla , vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Melecio, de 57 años y sus 03 queridos hijos Romeo de 16 años, Rafael de 14 años y Edgar de 11 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Robertina, desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de frutas como plátano, palta, entre otros; con la ayuda de su esposo se van a la chacra de sus vecinos para que puedan comprar las frutas a un precio mínimo y llevarlas a vender a su pueblo, donde sus frutas son rápidamente vendidas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder animar a la gente que compre la fruta que produce en su localidad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar sus frutas hasta el pueblo, ya que corre el riesgo de que se puedan malograrse. Con el tiempo piensa en comprar frutas a mínimo precio ya que en su localidad se vende barato y vender en su pueblo a un precio que pueda solventar sus gastos. Este será su préstamo número 02 con MFP, por lo cual está muy contenta por la colaboración que le brindan. En su banco comunal trabaja responsablemente y se siente tranquila de poder trabajar con personas responsables. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, podrá comprar frutas como plátano y palta.
texts.en:
Robertina is 44 years old and a simple woman.  She lives in a home of her own with her husband, 57 year old Melecio, and her three children, 16 year old Romeo, 14 year old Rafael, and 11 year old Edgar, to whom she wants to provide a better future.
Robertina has been selling fruits and vegetables, such as bananas, and avocados, among other things.  With her husband’s help, they work in their neighbors’ fields so that they can share the fruits at lower prices, and take them to town where they are quickly sold.  What she enjoys most is to be able to motivate people to buy the fruits that she produces in her area.  She considers the most difficult part to be transporting her fruit to town because there’s a risk that they will get bruised.  She eventually wants to buy fruits in her area at lower prices, and sell them in town at prices that will allow her to cover her expenses.
This will be her second loan though MFP.  She is grateful for their cooperation.  She feels safe and works responsibly with her communal bank, and is happy to be able to work with responsible people.  She will use the 1,000 PEN ($375) from this loan to buy fruits such as bananas and avocados.

loans.use: to buy fruits.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.fr:
Client de 41 ans, marie et père de 4 enfants dont tous vont a l’école, ayant arête ses études en classe de troisième, avec la charge de sa famille il se lance dans le commerce des chaussures en 2000, avec le peu d’argent qu’il avait reçu d’un parent, il prenait des chaussures auprès de certains fournisseurs et vendait au marche.
Ayant déjà  bénéficie du prêt de Hope, aujourd’hui, il a son propre capital, il achète sa marchandises au comptant , il a fait des bénéfices énormes et a une forte épargne, il a eu a faire  des remboursements avec beaucoup de succès.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, il va renforcer le stock de sa marchandises en achetant des sandales des enfants hommes et dames. Son activité lui procure beaucoup de satisfaction puisqu’il arrive a prendre soin de sa famille , a payer les frais d’écolage de ses enfants et a épargner aussi pour ses projets futurs ceux d’ouvrir un grand magasin pour chaussures
texts.en: This borrower is 41 years old.  He is married and the father of four children who all attend school.  He is educated up to 9th grade.  Having to provide for his family, and with a little money received from a relative, he decided to go into the shoe business in 2000, and started to acquire shoes from various suppliers and to sell them at a market.  Thanks to a previous loan from Hope, he now has his own capital, buys his merchandise in cash, has made good profits and saved a large amount of money.  He was able to successfully pay-off his loan.  A new loan will allow Jean Pierre to buy sandals for children, men and women, and therefore to increase his stock of merchandise.  His activity has been very satisfying since he can now take care of his family, pay school tuition for his children, and save enough money toward future plans, such as opening a large shoe shop.

loans.use: To buy shoes and sandals for children.

loans.name: Anyar Sari 2 Group

texts.en:
Like many Balinese women, Ni Wayan and the other members of the Anyar Sari 2 group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes.  Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Ni Wayan hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but also training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.  
Ni Wayan will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as fattening pigs. With her profits, she will help support her family of three by supplementing her husband's income as a farmer. Ultimately, Ni Wayan hopes that her increased income will enable her to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 62 years old, married to Loise and they have five children.  He has been in the hotel business selling cooked food; chips, ugali and tea to his clients for the last two years from which he earns a monthly income of KES 18,000.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 20,000.  He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer.  He plans to use the funds to purchase food stuffs such as wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, cooking oil and sugar for the hotel.  With the anticipated profits he will repay the loan.

He hopes are to grow his business and open another branch and improve the family welfare.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs for sale: bags of potatoes, sugar, onions and cooking oil.

loans.name: Massavo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MASSAVO est composé de trois personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Philomène est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Philomène est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Philomène est une veuve et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Philomène vit seule avec ses deux enfants. Afin d'assurer ses diverses charges et ceux de ses deux enfants, Philomène vend depuis dix ans, des boules d’akassa (pâte faite à base de l'amidon du maïs) à son domicile. Philomène s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Philomène sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MASSAVO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra surement à hausser le niveau de leur activité et à se faire plus de profit. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: MASSAVO is a group composed of 3 people who all live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that this group requests a loan from ALIDÉ, in order to increase their business. The group representative, Philomène, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Philomène is 42 and lives in Benin. She is widow and a mother of 2. She takes care of her children, who both attend school. Philomène lives by herself with her two children. In order to meet the financial needs of her family, she has been selling akassa [a thick cornmeal porridge] at home for 10 years. Philomène buys the necessary ingredients in a market in Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Philomène, along with the other members of MASSAVO, is applying for a second loan from ALIDÉ. This loan will help them enhance their business and make more profit. The first loan has been successfully paid back.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn to be processed.

loans.name: Kleber Alberto

texts.es: Kleber de 37 años vivve ( Quevedo ecuador ) el decidió ponerse el negocio de restaurant por que le da mayor rentabilidad y no le gusta ser empleado.  El trabaja todos los días solo de 7:00 a 2pm con mucho esfuerzo. A futuro el desea mejorar su vivienda y darle lo mejor a su hijo . con el préstamo comprara ( viveres ) carnes, arroz, aceite.
texts.en: Kleber, 37, lives in Quevedo, Ecuador.  He decided to start up a restaurant business because it is profitable, and he did not like being an employee.  He works on his own every day from 7am until 2pm with a lot of effort.  In the future, he wants to make some improvements to his house and provide the best for his child.  With this loan, he will buy food supplies including meat, rice and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Betty S.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from one of the primary schools in Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, to seek a second loan of 18,000,000 SLL from SMT/Kiva lenders.  Kiva loans provide these school teachers with the means of buying or investing in projects that they cannot afford with their salaries alone. At the end of each month, their school's bursar deducts the borrowers’ monthly repayments and remits them to SMT on their behalf. 
  
Betty, 57 years old, is the leader of this group of teachers. A native of Damawulo village, she has been in the teaching profession for 36 years. Betty is married and has 4 children – 2 in primary school and 2 in secondary school. Betty has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Flor Marina

texts.es: Flor es una mujer de 34 años, soltera y con muchos deseos de tener éxito en su vida, ella labora en una empresa privada y en su tiempo libre se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogos especializados en imagen y cuidado personal. Inició esta actividad en el año 2012, tras considerar que contaba con una gran base de posibles clientes, así que aprovechó sus habilidades comunicativas y emprendió su negocio ofreciendole a sus compañeros de trabajo, vecinos, amigos y familiares con una gran acogida.  En la actualidad ha logrado consolidar su negocio y obtener de este un ingreso adicional con el que considera podrá realizar sus sueños de tener casa propia y al contar con el apoyo financiero a través de una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo logrará responder a las solicitudes de pedidos; productos nutricionales, bisutería, maquillaje y cremas corporales. En esta navidad Flor entregará todos sus pedidos y obtendrá excelentes ganancias.

loans.use: logrará responder a las solicitudes de pedidos; productos nutricionales, bisutería, maquillaje y cremas corporales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cecilia would like to invest in shares on the stock market.

loans.name: Mohammad Zaher

texts.en:
M. Zaher began his business in a small shop near his house selling vegetables and fresh fruits. Due to a lack of money he could not afford to buy vegetables , fresh fruits and other materials, so he decided to take a loan through AFSG to increase his business. With that he left his old shop and took a new shop in the market where he can sell more items and develop his business.

M. Zaher, who works 7 days a week, is happy that he can cover his family financially, and to be able to repay his AFSG loan.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a buffing machine for vehicles

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina K. is married and has one son. She lives in Vinogradovo in western Ukraine. Antonina runs a small business selling china, glassware and pottery at the central city market. She has been in this trade for 6 years. Currently, her monthly gross income is about $2000. 

Antonina decided to start this business because of low competition in the market. Moreover, her family situation forced her to find ways to provide a stable income. Her son had been very sick for a while and Antonina had to work day and night to earn enough so she could buy necessary medication for him. Her perseverance, integrity, openness and natural cheerfulness have been key success factors for her business as they have ensured friendly relationships with her customers who willingly became her loyal clients. We believe her rich experience working in this sphere of business will help Antonina pass other significant business milestones and achieve even more success in her trade.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 49 years old and has five children. She's a member of the Entrepreneurial Women Community Bank and lives in the Moyobamba district of San Martin province. She supplies food stands and kiosks with fast foods, tamales, humitas (according to Wikipedia, in Peru and principally in the central Andes region, humitas are prepared as savory dishes with fresh corn combined with lard, salt, and fresh cheese or with fresh corn with lard, sugar, cinnamon and raisins for a sweet dish. Peruvian humitas are prepared with corn wrapped in corn husks and can be cooked in boiling water, placed in a pachamanca oven, or steamed), juanes (similar to a tamal, except made with rice, spices, a stuffing, and wrapped in the leaf of the bijao, or Heliconia bihai, an Amazonian plant often seen in florist shops because of its extravagant flowers. The stuffing can be fish, chicken, or even simply yuca). She also caters events such as weddings and birthdays. In addition to her catering and food sales, Isabel sells shoes.

She decided to start this business because it is profitable, she enjoys doing it, and her cooking is well received. This way she generates her own income and helps support her home and family. She is very happy with her work because it has allowed her to educate her children. Her goal is to expand by opening a small grocery store and snack shop, thus creating more jobs in her community.

She will use this loan to purchase the ingredients for her products (rice, cooking oil, eggs, chickens and spices) in wholesale quantities. She will also purchase an inventory of shoes in various sizes and models to meet her clients' demand. Her daughter, who lives in Chiclayo, helps her mother by sending her orders from customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Isabel tiene 49 años y 5 hijos, pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras, vive en el distrito de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Se dedica la venta de refrigerios, atiende a kioscos y snaks, abastece con tamales, humitas y juanes, también atiende con este servicio a instituciones, eventos como matrimonios, cumpleaños, etc., paralelamente se dedica a la venta de zapatos. Decidió iniciar este negocio porque se dió cuenta de que es rentable y le agrada, y que su sazón tiene buena acogida. De esta manera genera sus propios ingresos y aporta en la economía de su hogar. Está muy contenta con lo que hace porque esta actividad le permitió educar a sus hijos, su meta es crecer en el negocio, tener un negocio de abarrotes (bodega) y un snack, con ello poder dar trabajo a más personas. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 1000.00 ($ 321.00 aprox.), comprará los ingredientes básicos para la elaboración de juanes, tamales y humitas (sacos de arroz, botellas de aceite en gran cantidad, huevos por javas, gallinas y condimentos), también comprará zapatos en variedad de números y modelos para atender los pedidos de sus clientas, actividad que le apoya su hija quien vive en Chiclayo y desde allá le envía los pedidos.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and supplies for her catering business.  To purchase shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase on her stock.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en: Mrs. Phin S., age 33, is employed at a private company, making $3 each day. Her husband is also employed at a company, making $5 per day. They have one child who is a student. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to build separate rooms onto her house to rent to tenants in her community.

loans.use: To build separate rooms onto her house to rent to tenants in her community.

loans.name: Sobir

texts.en: Sobir A. lives in the Nausky region and is married with 4 children. He has been a MicroInvest client since 2003 because he heard so many uccessful stories from his friends on the MicroInvest loan circle. He started selling food products and has a wide-side assortment of goods and repeat customers because his prices are lower than the bazaar's prices. He has a different assortment of goods: milk-sour products (pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd), meat products (sausages, salami, boiled sausages and the black pudding), vegetable oil, flour products and sweets. He is now requesting a loan to begin selling perfumes.

loans.use: to expand and add a new business line

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Planting rice crop.

loans.name: Nov

texts.en:
Mr. Nov H. and his wife, Ky Noun, married in 1983. They have six children: two sons and four daughters. Four of their children are married and live in separate houses. One child works in a garment factory and the other one is in school.

Mr. Nov has been a motor taxi driver for many years. He carries people from his village to Phnom Penh City and from Phnom Penh to his village. His wife sells vegetables in the village. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Nov is requesting a loan for the fourth time in the amount of $700 to replace an old trailer with a new passenger trailer for his motor taxi business and to buy a water pump.

loans.use: For replacing a motor taxi trailer and purchasing a new water pump

loans.name: Nubia Del Carmen

texts.es:
For three years Nubia C. has worked in a small convenience store in San Rafael, Managua. Over the years, and through investing, she has stocked the store with large quantities of products.

Nubia is very hardworking. Through great sacrifice she has managed better her economic situation and provide her children with the education they deserve.

CEPRODEL has played an important role in her business. They have given Nubia loans which have helped her acquire and sell her merchandise. Once again Nubia requests a loan to continue improving her business and, through improvement, better provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein and Perla Mendoza.

En el municipio de San Rafael en Managua, la señora Nubia C. desde hace 3 años se dedica al negocio de pulpería el cual a través de los años ha venido surtiendo hasta mejorar su negocio invirtiendo en mayores cantidades de productos.

Es una dama muy esforzada que gracias a sus grandes sacrificios en su negocio ha logrado mejorar su situación económica y brindarles a sus hijos sus estudios que estos se merecen.

Ceprodel ha jugado un papel importante en su negocio debido a que la ha beneficiado con créditos que le han servido de mucho beneficio para adquirir su mercadería y así venderla en su local de habitación.Hoy en dia una vez mas acude para obtener el credito y de esta manera mejorar su negocio y por ende las condiciones de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mr. Sok S. is a painter and a tailor and he is married with seven children. He previously applied for a loan from Kiva to purchase a sewing machine, sewing threads and other tools for his tailoring business. That first loan was successfully repaid, and now Mr. Sok S. is requesting another loan to purchase construction tools and a blow torch to help his children's work.  The remainder of the loan will be used to further expand his business. He is very excited to be able to grow his income with these loans.

loans.use: To purchase more construction tools and a blow torch

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix began working on his own to support his family, as he needed quick income to cover the household expenses. He has always lived in a farm and has worked as a farmer since his youth. Twenty five years ago, Felix went to the US seeking better opportunities, and he was able to save enough money to go back home and buy a tractor to work the fields. He still uses this same tractor in his daily work, which affords him income to support his wife and himself.

Felix needs a loan of $300 to be repaid in 6 months to repair and service his tractor. With your help, he will make it!

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer.

Felix inició el negocio para mantener a su familia, ya que necesitaba ingresos inmediatos para el gasto familiar. Su ambiente siempre ha sido el campo y trabajando desde joven en el mismo, se fue a probar suerte a Estados Unidos, hace 25 años logrando juntar un capital que le permitio comprar un tractor pata labrar la tierra, mismo que continua ocupando en sus labores cotidianas que le permiten tener un ingreso para la manutencion de el y su esposa.

El necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 6 meses para dar mantenimiento a su tractor. Con tu ayuda podra lograrlo.

loans.use: Repair his tractor

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel is 40 years old and lives in his own home in the east side of the city with his wife and three children of 17, 15 and 14 years old respectively. Angel is a mechanic and works for a dairy company. He also recieves income from daily rental of two motorcycles that that are used as public transport. There is not a lot of competition in his first area of employment as it is a permanent and secure job, while in the other area the competition is average due to the number of people that are dedicated to the same activity, however we emphasize that also there is the demand for this method of transportation. With this loan he will acquire a motorcycle that costs approx. US$500. Please note that we only have a photo of his wife, who is the co-debtor, as he was not at his job and it is quite difficult to locate him during the day. This is his third loan with our institution and he has proven that he has an excellent record in making his loan repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

Angel cuenta con 40 años de edad y vive en su casa propia que está ubicada en la zona este de la ciudad junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 17, 15 y 14 años de edad respectivamente. Angel es mecánico de profesión por lo que trabaja como tal en una empresa de Lacteos y paralelamente recibe ingresos por la renta diaria de dos motocicletas que trabajan en el transporte público de pasajeros. No hay mucha competencia en su primer rubro ya que es trabajador fijo y seguro, mientras que en el otro rubro la competencia es media debido a la cantidad de personas que se dedican a la misma actividad, cabe recalcar que así también es la demanda por este medio de transporte. Con el presente crédito el adquirirá una motocicleta con un precio aproximado de $us. 500.-. Se hace notar que sólo se tomo foto a su esposa que es la codeudora ya que el no estaba en su trabajo y es bastante difícil ubicarlo en el día. Este es el tercer préstamo en nuestra insitución y el demostró tener un excelente cumplimiento en el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle.

loans.name: Khady Barry

texts.fr:
Mrs. Khady Barry S. is a widow who lives with her children in the Randoulène district of Thies. She has been earning income for more than 25 years, notably by buying and selling grocery items. She has been a member of the loan program for 4 years and has always paid back her loans. She is requesting this loan with a view to bolstering her inventory before the Ramadan period.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

madame khady barry S. est une veuve qui vit avec ses enfants au quartier randoulène à thies.elle mène des activités génératrices de revenu depuis plus de 25 ans notamment l'achat et la vente de produits alimentaires.elle est membre de la mutuelle depuis 4ans et a toujours remboursé ses crédits .c'est dans le but de renforcer ses stocks avant le ramadan qu'elle demande ce pret.

loans.use:
bolster her little grocery store's inventory

commerce de denrées alimentaires

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y el último de sus hijos, de 26 años,
Es una persona que siempre está trabajando para seguir superándose,  desde hace 15 años tiene una pequeña librería bazar donde vende toda las mañanas, todo tipo de útiles de escritorio y algunos artículos variados para regalos, de igual manera, en el stand que arrienda tiene su propia oficina de servicios contables, así, ejerce de manera independiente su profesión, esto le ha servido para que durante años ella y su esposo sean el sostén del hogar y ahora todos sus hijos son personas independientes, ella se siente muy contenta y feliz  porque puede seguir generando sus propios ingresos, a pesar de que las condiciones del mercado han cambiado debido a la competencia que está presente en la misma galería donde está su negocio, ya que cuando ella empezó era la única de ese rubro, ahora tiene que competir con otros puestos iguales al suyo.
Nancy desea seguir adelante, y estar siempre ocupada con el trabajo que le agrada hacer.
Invertirá su prestado en la compra de millares de papeles y espirales que son indispensables para su librería.
texts.en:
