Nancy is 48 years old and she lives with her husband and the last of her children, aged 26 years old.

She is a person who is always working hard on improving herself. For the last 15 years she has had a small office supply store where she goes every morning to sell all kinds of office supplies and a few other gift items . Also her small stand has its own office of accounting services, so to manage her business independently. This has served her for many years when she and her husband were depended on for the household maintenance. She feels so happy that she has been able to keep earning their own income regardless of the job market that has been fierce from all the competition. When she first started her stand was the only one but now there are many located near her.

Nancy wants to keep her level of success and she wants to always be busy with the work that she loves to do. She will invest this loan in the purchase of stacks of paper and notebooks that are of great necessity in her store.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store, especially paper and notebooks.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma baji is a wife of H. A.. She lives in a small area named Yadgar in the city Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. She is the mother of three children: two daughters and one son. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.

Salma baji's husband is an employee in the post office. Salma baji has a business making decoratively embroidered dresses. She has been in this profession for the last 12 years.

She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more material such as clothes, colored thread and sketches so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy material to expand her business

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Mrs. Sina Y., 31, and her husband, Mr. Tuy Morm, 35, live in a small village located twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have one son and one daughter, both of whom are currently studying in a local school. Mrs. Sina, who learned silk weaving from her neighbor, has turned her skill into a business for twenty years. She sells her finished products to a trader in the village who then sells her products in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been working as a fisherman for fifteen years. Beside of weaving and fishing, the couple also grows rice. Mrs. Sina is requesting a loan of $500 to buy silk materials for weaving and to purchase a water pump for farming.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and buy a water pump for farming

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es:
Su nombre es Martha Azucena Q. C. su edad es de 35 años, su estado civil es acompañada, esta Joven tiene 3 hijos de los cuales su hija mayor tiene la edad de 15 años y cursa recientemente el 4 año de secundaria, su otro hijo tiene la edad de 7 años que cursa recientemente 3 grado de primaria y su niña de 3 años que todavía no estudia, su compañero de vida labora como guarda de seguridad, en sus deseos esta en  tener una casa propia ya que en la que habita actualmente es de su mama y también quiere proporcionarle mejoras a su casa de habitación ya que sus hijos necesitan un lugar donde vivir tranquilos.


El tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 27 años, su actividad económica es la de venta de comida donde ofrece sus diferentes comidas como: gallo pinto, tortas rellenas, enchiladas, maduro, queso y huevo cosido, ella inicia este negocio por la necesidad de obtener un trabajo pero quien empieza con el negocio es una tía de esta Joven Martha ya que esta le ayudaba en la elaboración de la comida y al pasar el tiempo su tía se enfermo y le dejo a cargo este negocio y fue entonces como empezó este negocio que tiene actualmente, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar las compras de granos básicos y tiene que viajar para realizar la compra de estos productos.
texts.en:
Martha Azucena Q. C. is 35 years old, lives with her partner and has three children. Her older daughter is 15 years old and recently enrolled in her fourth year of secondary school, her son is 7 years old and recently started the thrid grade of primary school, and her younger daughter is 3 years old and has not started school yet. Her partner works as a security guard. They currently live with her mother and dream of having their own house, where they can make improvements and offer their children a peaceful place to live. Martha has run her own business since she was 27 years old, selling meals which include different dishes such as rice and beans, filled rolls, enchiladas, cheese and hard-boiled eggs. Martha's aunt founded the business, and Martha worked helping her aunt to prepare the food. When her aunt became sick she left Martha in charge of the business, and it was then that Martha founded the business that she now runs. The loan will be used for working capital, as she needs to purchase basic supplies and must travel to purchase these products.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cristhian Esmeralda

texts.es: Cristhian es soltera, tiene 23 años de edad, no tiene hijos, esta solicitando su 7mo credito, el que utilizara para iniciar la construccion de su vivienda en el terreno que esta poniendo en garantia, los creditos anteriores los utilizo para mejorar la vivienda de su mamá donde ella habita en su compañia, ya ques hija unica, pero considera que es tiempo de pensar en ella y aprovechar el tiempo ya que por su edad puede hacerle frente a la construccion de su propia vivienda, si el credito no es suficiente para cumplir con su objetivo, espera quedar siempre bien y continuar trabajando con AFODENIC hasta cumplir con su sueño de tener su propia vivienda con todas las condiciones que todo ser humano necesita para sentirse bien.
texts.en:
Cristhian is single, is 23, and doesn't have children. She is requesting her seventh loan, which she will use to start constructing her home on the land that she is using as collateral. She used her previous credits to improve her mother's home where she lives as well since she is an only child. She thinks that it is time to think about herself and to make the most of this time since at her age she can meet the construction costs of her own home. If the credit isn't enough to meet her objective, she hopes to continue working with AFODENIC until she fulfills her dream of having her own home with all of the conditions that every human being needs to feel well.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Wilfredo Danilo

texts.es:
Este Señor de Nombre Wilfredo Danilo E. N. tiene la edad de 25 años, su estado civil es casado, Don Wilfredo tiene 1 hijo de la edad de 6 años que recientemente cursa el 6 grado de primaria, su compañera de vida labora como costurera, sus propósitos son de incrementar su negocio para lograr mejores ingresos ya que así no tendría problemas económicos como los tiene hoy, sus deseos son de son establecer su negocio por lo que el es un vendedor ambulante y también establecer un negocio para su esposa ya que ambos puedan trabajar de forma humilde y así le proporcione ingresos para su familia sus sueños son obtener una mejor calidad de vida logrando darle mejoras su propiedad ya que con esfuerzo la compro y ahora quiere acondicionarla  para que sus hijo pueda tener un lugar digno y adecuado donde vivir ya que también en sus deseos esta el darle a su hijo todo lo necesario para que el día de mañana no pase necesidades.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es venta de mercadería en general y ofrece lo siguiente: sillas, bolsos, zapatos, ropa, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 3 años, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, Don Wilfredo inicio este negocio por un amigo quien fue el encargado de de que Wilfredo entrara en el negocio por lo que al Principio solo contaba con la poca experiencia obtenida de su Mama por lo que poco a poco le fu tomando cariño a su trabajo y comenzó ofreciendo pequeñas cosas como: sabanas, toallas y cuadros por lo que al ofrecer el producto al cliente mostraba timidez y le costaba por lo que dice que no fue tan fácil ingresar en este tipo de negocio pero no se dio por vencido y lucho para quedarse con esta fuente de ingresos para mantener a su familia por lo que necesita el financiamiento Don Wilfredo tiene que conseguir la mercadería a un precio favorable ya que el realiza la distribución de los productos que le hacen por encargos y así pueda ganarse la eficacia que tiene con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Wilfredo Danilo E. N. is 25 years old, married and has a 6-year-old son who recently began elementary school. His wife works as a seamstress. His intentions are to increase his business in order to earn a better income so that he will not have the same economic problems that he has today. His wishes are to establish his business as a street vendor and also to establish a business for his wife so that both can work and earn a modest living.

Mr. Wilfredo’s family dreams of a better quality of life; he wants to improve his property, which with much effort he bought. Mr. Wilfredo wants to remodel his property so that his son can have a decent and adequate place to live. He also desires to give his son all that he will need for the future.

Mr. Wilfredo sells merchandise such as: chairs, handbags, shoes and clothing. He has run his traveling business for 3 years. He began his business through a friend who acted as the manager. In the beginning Mr. Wilfredo relied on the little experience he had obtained from his mother to start his business. He lovingly grew his business little by little and began offering small things such as: sheets, towels and decorative pictures. While attempting to sell his products to his customers he was a little timid at first which cost him business and it was not easy to commit to this type of job. He fought to remain a business owner in order to maintain the livelihood of his family. Mr. Wilfredo will use the loan to obtain merchandise at a favorable price and sell it to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Uchumi Group

texts.en:
Amina has been a clothes seller in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for 9 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 550. Every day she works at her business from 12am to 12pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Amina is 38 years old, married, and has three children: aged between 16 and 13. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Aziza, Elizabeth, Mariam, and Zuhura. Each woman has her own small business in Arusha.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Vaisuni

texts.en: Vaisuni M., 38, is married with 3 child.  She has four years of experience in the Plantation and the Cattle Farm business. She sells to the public two days per week. She has had 5 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Vaisuni’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase for farming equipments and to pay for her childrens school fees.

loans.use: Buy farming equipments and pay for childrens school fees

loans.name: Mrs. Tom Seab Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank consisting of ten members is located in Prachum Angk village, in Kandal province. They plan to use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Tom S. is the 50 year old Village Bank president. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Hae Sat, is a construction worker. Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than needed to support their household. In order to improve their living, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase a sewing machine to start a new business to earn more income. She has two children who are enrolled in the local school.

Four members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able.

Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of their loan terms. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine and use funds for other purposes to earn more income.

loans.name: Taloa

texts.en: Taloa P. is forty-one, and married with six children.  She has five years of experience in the fabric design business. She sells to the public seven days a week. She has two previous loans with SPBD, a Kiva field partner.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $80.  SPBD loans are Taloa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase fabric paints, materials, printing board, sewing machine and brushes

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru:
Шавкат Шеров мужчина 29 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Женат имеет 4 детей. Шавкату нужны деньги для посева и выращивания кукурузы, он считает что сумма 1500 сомони вполне хватит для того, чтобы  вырастить кукурузу.
 Дополнительный доход в его семью приносит скот, откормом и  купле-продажей, которого он занимается, и выращивает несколько сортов винограда. Помогает ему в этом его отец.
texts.en:
Shavkat S. is a 29 year old man, he works in agriculture. He is married and has 4 children. Shavkat needs money in order to plant and grow corn. He believes that a sum of 1500 somoni is quite enough in order to grow corn. Livestock brings supplemental income to his family, he fattens and purchases and resells it. He also grows several varieties of grapes. His father helps him with this.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Planting corn

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 59 years old and married to Thomas B., who is a farmer. They are blessed with five children namely: Larry, Danilo, Shirley, Nimfa, and Jeffrey. Four of them are already married.

Teodora manages a vending business. Through the aid of a pedicab, she is able to roam to all the houses in their villages to sell her vegetables and fish. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 in order to sustain and expand her vending business.

Her weekly net income from her business is around PHP 1,500. A good neighbor in their village invited her to join the ASKI microfinance program, which is why she applied for the loan. Teodora believes that hard work is the key to a progressive living.

loans.use: To sustain and expand her vending business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Y. Nguyễn Thị (525030624) is a 33 year-old female living in the town of Ý Yên.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Y. owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Y. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3600000 VND a month from these activities.


In 1999, Y. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Y. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000000 VND from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  Y. is now requesting a new loan of 20000000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  Y. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos Alberto P. G. de 42 años de edad reside en Cojutepeque junto a su esposa y su hija. Él posee un negocio de reparación de maquinas de coser, así también se dedica a comprar maquinaria arruinada la cual la repara y luego la vende. El solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar repuestos para las maquinas, tales como motores, fajas, entre otros más.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto P. G. is a 42-year-old man who lives in Cojutepeque with his wife and daughter. He has his own sewing machine repair shop. He also purchases broken machinery that he repairs and sells. He is seeking a loan with which he will be able to purchase spare parts for sewing machines, such as motors and belts, among other things.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for sewing machines

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Đào Thị

texts.en:
D. Dào Thị (536981004) is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has three school-aged children.

D. owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over eleven years and earns approximately 4,200,000 VND a month.

In 1998, D. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

D. is now requesting a new loan of 20,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. The loan will be her 11th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
OFELIA B. is a 54 year-old married woman with 5 children ranging in ages from school-age to young adults. She and her family live in Brgy. Abuanan, Bago City, Negros Occidental.

Ofelia is starting a new business venture - to sell rice products in her local community. For this undertaking, Ofelia needs PHP 15,000.00 as additional capital. She projects that this new business will earn her an additional PHP 2,000 per month, which she plans to use to pay for the tuition fees of her children who are still going to school.

Ofelia has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and she has always paid her previous loans, even when things got rough. She admits that starting a new business in not easy but for her, the future of her children is more important than any hardship or struggle that she might encounter along the way. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: ADDITIONAL WORKING CAPITAL FOR A NEW RICE BUSINESS

loans.name: Débora

texts.fr: Débora est née en 1984 à Kétou dans le Département de Plateau. Débora est mariée à Moïse. Ils ont un enfant ensemble. La famille vit à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. C’est le mari de Débora qui assure les dépenses du foyer. Débora vend des bijoux. Pour acheter ses articles, Débora va au Nigeria et au Ghana, États frontaliers au Bénin. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Débora vend ses bijoux. Il y a dix ans que Débora est dans cette activité de vente de bijoux. Pour mieux développer son activité, Débora sollicite ce premier prêt d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
Débora was born in 1984 in Kétou (Plateau County). She is married to Moïse. Together they have one child. The family lives in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Débora’s husband ensures that household expenses are met. Débora sells jewelry. To buy her goods, she goes to Nigeria and Ghana, nations near Benin. Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, is where she sells her jewelry. She has been in this business for ten years. To develop her business further, she is requesting this loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewelry

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing has been selling used clothes for over 2 years. This business is the source of her income. She is 30 years old and married with 5 children. Blessing hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more used clothes to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Beoun

texts.en: Beoun B., age 33, is married with a young child. He lives with his wife (pictured) in Battambong Province. To make a living, he provides transportation services to people in the town, typically earning $3 per day. His wife is involved in a business of selling groceries and fried meatballs at her house and other gathering places such as parks and markets, earning an income of $5 per day. Both of them have to work hard everyday to ensure a good living for their family. Therefore, B. is seeking to increase his income and improve his business. He is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike to transport meatballs to sell. Also he will operate a motor taxi to earn more income. By doing so, he believes that he will B. able to raise the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Yawa Eugénie

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et est mère de 03 enfants ; son mari est Directeur d’école. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente d’une bouillie dénommée « akassa », très appréciée de la population. Elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 1996, et cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa part financière dans la vie du foyer ; elle vend le plus souvent les matins et a une clientèle assez disparate, composée essentiellement des élèves, des  gens de petits métiers et bien d’autres catégories socio professionnelles. Elle a une expérience bien solide dans le domaine puisqu’elle sait bien accueillir sa clientèle. Actuellement elle a besoin de s’approvisionner en maïs ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 03 sacs de maïs, 02 sacs de sucres et un panier d’arachide. Elle exerce son activité dans le quartier d’Avédji à Lomé
texts.en:
Madame N. is married and has three children. Her husband is a school principal. To earn a living, she sells a much-appreciated porridge known as "akassa". Madame N. started this business in 1996 and it allows her to contribute to the household expenses. She usually sells the porridge in the morning, to an assorted clientele made up mostly of school children, traders and people from many other socio-professional groups. Madame N. has a great deal of experience in her field and knows exactly how to attract customers. She currently needs to stock up on corn, so she is requesting a loan from Kiva Field Partner, WAGES, to buy three sacks of corn, two sacks of sugar and a basket of peanuts. She conducts her business activity in the Avédji neighborhood in Lomé.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and sugar, and a basket of peanuts

loans.name: Kamu

texts.en:
Kamu E. is currently in the business of selling beer at her bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Kamu is 20 years old and is single.   With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business by stocking wines, Heineken beer, etc at her bar to sell.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi K. sells fresh fish at Elmina near Mpoble.  Esi has no educational background.  She is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a fisherman. Esi has been selling fish since 2002. She helps her husband with the payments of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy fresh fish to re-sell and also to be processed for sale at the market. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish (and to-be-processed fish) to re-sell at the market.

loans.name: Margaret Wariara

texts.en:
Margaret N. is married to Moses and they have three children: Carolyne, 9, Sharon, 7, and Angel, 2.

Margaret was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, through existing clients and she is servicing her second loan. She has been selling new clothes for two years. She intends to use the loan to add more stock of clothes and prepare for the festive season (Christmas).

Margaret's business is in a small market and she relies on the customers who frequent the market. With the extra profits she anticipates getting, she intends to add more stock into the business. 

Margaret's hope is to own a big boutique as she believes she is hardworking.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: The loan will be used to add stock of new clothes for sale

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella A. is from the village of Bugallon, Cauayan City. She is 53 years old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Estrella sells personal use products in the local community. Estrella has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $108 a month from this activity.

In 2006, Estrella joined the Kiva field partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Estrella is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used for additional working capital in her business. This will be her 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, de 30 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo (Clemente), de 49 años, y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para sobresalir en la vida.
Muy temprano por la mañana, Norma ordeña a sus vacas para extraer la deliciosa leche que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado de su distrito; ella tiene muchos clientes que la esperan para comprarle, ya que la leche que vende es muy sabrosa y de muy buena calidad.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar a sus vacas, ya que sabe que de ellas depende la economía de su familia, lleva 7 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar la leche hasta el mercado, ya que siempre hay la posibilidad de que se derrame. 
Con el tiempo, desea alquilar un puesto estale en el mercado, ya que actualmente ve de en forma ambulatoria.

Este es el primer préstamo de Norma con MFP y está muy feliz de esta oportunidad, ya que sabe que con ese dinero su negocio podrá progresar; en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida y respetada. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más forraje (pasto) para sus animales, ya que quiere alimentarlos bien para que le brinden buena leche.
texts.en:
Norma is a very hardworking 30-year-old woman who lives in her own home along with her 49-year-old husband, Clemente. She is motivated to work very hard to excel in life. Very early in the morning, Norma milks her cows for their delicious milk, which she later takes to sell at her district's market. She has many customers who wait for her, since the milk that she sells is delicious and of very high quality. Her favorite part of her job is caring for her cows because she knows that her family economic well-being depends on them. She has seven years of experience in the business and finds that the most difficult part is transporting the milk to the market, since there is always the risk of spilling it. In time, she hopes to rent a stationary stall at the market; currently she makes sales on the move. This is Norma's first loan with MFP and she is very happy to have the opportunity because she knows that this money will enable her business to move forward. She is a well-liked and respected member of her communal bank. With the thousand nuevos soles requested, she will buy more feed (grass) for her animals; she wants to nourish them well so that they will provide good milk.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase feed for dairy cows

loans.name: Mildred's Group

texts.en:
Mildred F. is from the village of San Rafael. She is 23 years old. Mildred is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Mildred's Group.

Mildred is single. To make a living, Mildred owns & operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Mildred has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mildred joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mildred has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Mildred is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Mildred from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Roucayatou Abébi

texts.fr: I. Roucayatou Abébi est née le 09 Octobre 1963 à Calavi au Bénin. Il y a près de 20 ans que Roucayatou Abébi s’est installée à Hlacomey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à Akangbé OSSENI, Roucayatou Abébi est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Roucayatou Abébi vit ensemble avec ses enfants  et son mari à Hlacomey. Roucayatou Abébi vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les charges de la famille, grâce au revenu que lui procure son activité. Roucayatou Abébi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Roucayatou Abébi vend depuis une quinzaine d’année, des habits pour hommes et dames, par le système de distribution. Roucayatou Abébi s’approvisionne au Togo et au Nigéria, deux Etats voisins du Bénin. C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Roucayatou Abébi ambitionne augmenter le stock de ses produits, en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Cependant, Roucayatou Abébi n’a pas pu réunir les fonds nécessaires pour y arriver. C’est ce qui a conduit Roucayatou Abébi à solliciter un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Roucayatou Abébi I. was born October 9, 1963 in Calavi in Benin. She settled about 20 years ago in the Hlacomey area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Akangbé OSSENI, Roucayatou Abébi is mother of four children, all in school. She lives together with her husband and children in Hlacomey. Roucayatou Abébi helps her husband with the household expenses, thanks to the income generated by her activity. She has not attended school. To meet her needs over the past 15 years, Roucayatou Abébi has sold men’s and women’s clothing through the distribution system. She gets her supplies from Togo and Nigeria, two neighbouring countries. Roucayatou Abébi is a former beneficiary of ALIDé, having already been granted three loans that she reimbursed in full. Her ambition is to increase her stock of supplies, to better satisfy her customers. However, she has been unable to gather the necessary funds to do so. For this reason she is now requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es un joven carismático de 21 años, vive con su madre, doña Agripina de 56 años, en su acogedora casa propia.
Sus terrenos agrícolas están ubicados en lo alto de los cerros que rodean a su localidad, a los que asiste cada mañana en compañía de su pequeña radio de mano, pues no tiene familiares que lo ayuden en sus actividades agrícolas. Él se dedica a cuidar sus cultivos de papa y arveja desde hace 6 años porque le gusta alcanzar los beneficios económicos que considera son una recompensa a su sacrificada labor, mientras que su madre alimenta y protege a los ovinos y porcinos que cría. Las ganancias que obtienen les permiten solventar los gastos de su domicilio tranquilamente, sin preocupaciones e incluso ahorran para que más adelante puedan comprar animales menores como cuyes y conejos, también desea instalar un negocio de venta de tubérculos como semilla o para consumo y extender su productividad.  

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y desde ya está juntando dinero para pagar oportunamente sus cuotas, al igual que los demás socios de su banco comunal, puesto que siempre se caracterizaron por ser responsables. Para obtener una buena cosecha, Eduardo necesita adquirir abono, fertilizantes y una variedad diferente de semilla de arveja, por lo que solicita mil quinientos nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 21, is a charismatic young man, who lives with his mother, Agripina, 56, in their own cozy home. His farmlands are located on hilltops near his home. Every day he goes to his fields with his small crew of helpers because he doesn't have any relatives to help him with his farming. He has cared for his potato and pea crops for 6 years because he likes to have the economic benefits that his hard work produces as a reward. Meanwhile, his mother feeds and cares for the sheep and pigs she raises. The profits they get allow them to meet their household expenses comfortably and care-free, they even are able to set aside a little so that they can buy small farm animals, like rabbits and guinea pigs, later on. He also wants to sell tubers as seed or for consumption and to extend his productivity. This is his second loan with MFP and he is already saving up money to make his repayments on time, as do his other communal bank members, because they have always been noted for being very responsible. In order to get a better crop yield, Eduardo needs to buy manure, fertilizers and a different variety of pea seeds for which he is asking for 500 new soles.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizer and pea seeds.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma M. is from the village of Carangan, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old, is married, and has one adult child. Thelma owns and operates a grocery store. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Thelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional grocery stock. This will be her first loan from PMPC. Thelma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries for her store

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa, 52, is a borrower who lives in El Seybo, Dominican Republic. She has a perfect repayment record on past loans, and her story is representative of other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Kiva partner, Esperanza International.
Rosa is a single mother of one and lives in El Seybo, a small rural town in the heart of the agricultural east of the Dominican Republic. Life in rural areas of the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate access to healthcare, among other dangers. Despite these difficulties, Rosa has a successful small business making throws, quilts and other home decorations.
With this loan, she will purchase 40 yards of fabrics, lace and other accessories in order to grow her business. This is Rosa’s sixth loan with Esperanza International. With her continued profits, Rosa hopes to keep expanding her business. She dreams of having her own sewing machine eventually. Her profits have contributed to a healthier lifestyle, and Rosa is very grateful to be working with Esperanza. Thank you for your loan to Rosa!

About Esperanza International
Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in 11 offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti.

loans.use: To buy fabric, lace, thread and other accessories

loans.name: Bertha Julia

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Julia S. R., es trabajador de la escuela Marcos Dessys de Chinandega se desempeña como maestra de primaria, es soltera, con un hijo a su cargo.

La señora Bertha Julia solicito el crédito para realizar mejoras en su casa ya que tiene paredes de tablas y necesita levantarlas de concreto poco a poco.
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha Julia S. R. works as an elementary school teacher as the Marcos Dessys School in Chinandenga. She is single and has a dependent child.

Sra. Bertha Julia is requesting a loan to make improvements to her home. The wooden frames for the walls are already built, but the concrete needs to be poured in gradually.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blocks, crossbeams, and nails

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad loves cooking. In 2005, she decided to earn a living out of her passion. She cooked viands (tasty dishes) and started selling first to her neighbors. When she heard of CEVI, she immediately joined to gain financial support for her business. She was happy because she was able to buy more ingredients and was able to cook more.

Natividad is now requesting to borrow 10,000 Philippine pesos. She will use it to buy vegetables and other ingredients she needs for her viands. This loan will help sustain her business.

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Enlazando Group

texts.es:
El grupo Enlazando está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es María de la Concepción S. P. quien se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años de maíz, frijoles, tomates y chiltomas. Ella con el préstamo prepara la tierra para el cultivo de las frutas antes mencionadas. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son  Alejandra del Carmen S. hace años inicio con una pequeña venta y ahora tiene una pulpería en la que invertirá el crédito con la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de productos y Geyling  Arelis  Hernández Guzmán de diecinueve años quien desde hace tres años vende nacatamales.
texts.en:
The Enlazando group consists of three hard-working women. One of them is María de la Concepción S. P.; she has been working in agriculture for several years, growing corn, beans, tomatoes, and sweet peppers. María will be using the loan to prepare her fields for growing the aforementioned vegetables. Her fellow group members are Alejandra del Carmen S. and Geyling Arelis Hernández. Alejandra started a small retail business a few years ago and now has a convenience store; she plans to use her loan to purchase a greater variety of products and increase her inventory. Geyling, who is nineteen, has been selling nacatamales (a Nicaraguan dish) for three years.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: manure, seeds,  plow

loans.name: Okothe Otieno

texts.en:
Okothe Otieno S. is a matatu (minibus) driver with ambitions. Back at home in Awendo, Migori, Kenya, he does sugarcane farming that generates income to sustain his family. He plans to expand his business by buying a motorcycle for a taxi business and would like to obtain a loan of Ksh 50,000 to enable him do that.

S. is 30 years old, a husband, and a father of one child. S. will want to see him, and other children to come, get the best of everything in their lives including an education that will ensure them a bright future.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to start a taxi business

loans.name: Elmina Silvestre

texts.pt:
Elmina Silvestre M. nasceu no Distrito de Marracuene, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, tem 46 anos de idade casada e mãe de um filho de 30 anos de idade, pois não conseguiu mais conceber, o mesmo filho encontra se desempregado do momento. Elmina astudou até 6ª classe, teve que interroper devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa própria e responsabiliza se pelos seus pais que vivem em Marracuene enviando lhes uma sexta básica no valor de 800.00mt mensalmente.
	
Elmina é convidada pela tia para viver em Namaacha na Fronteira de Swazilândia, após sua chegada ela continua com os estudos e quando frequentava a 6ª classe ficou gravida. Anos depois começa a fazer mukero (venda de produtos contra bandeada )  na Fronteira da Swazilândia, mas porque o trabalho é muito pesado ela opta em iniciar com a venda de produtos de primeira necessidade na sua residência. Com o fundo colectado, consegue construir uma pequena loja na sua residência. Tem como melhores produtos  o(arroz e açucar  compra o saco  por 85000mtx4 e 1.800.00mtx2) vende por 1.250.00mtx4 e 2050mtx2) tem receita mensal de 4.000.00mt e consegue poupar  1.000.00mt  mensalmente,conta com ajuda do marido que trabalha no Governo como Secretario do bairro.

Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na HLUVUKU-ADSEMA e Kiva, todos foram no valor de 10.000,para a compra de produtos (arroz, feijão, açúcar e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da mercadoria para a sua loja. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do prazo. Futuramente pretente adiquirir mais empréstimo e construir uma loja grande para satisfazer a sua clientela.
texts.en:
Elmina Silvestre M. was born in Marracuene District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is a 46-year-old married woman, and she has one son who is 30 years old. She was unable to have any more children, and her son is currently unemployed. Elmina finished sixth grade but had to interrupt her studies because of an early pregnancy. She lives in her own house and takes care of her parents, who live in Marracuene, by sending them 800 meticais' worth of food and household goods every month. Elmina was invited by her aunt to come live in Namaacha, which is on the border with Swaziland. After her arrival, she continued with her studies, and when she was in sixth grade she became pregnant. Some years later, she began to work in mukero (sale of contraband goods) on the Swaziland border, but because the work was very hard, she decided to begin selling basic goods from her home. With her savings she built a small store in her home. Her best products are rice and sugar, which she buys by the sack for 850 meticais per four sacks and 1800 meticais per two sacks, respectively. She sells them for 1,250 meticais per four sacks and 2,050 meticais per two sacks. Elmina manages to save 1,000 meticais per month. She counts on the help of her husband, who works in government as the neighborhood Secretary. This is Elmina's third loan with Hluvuku-Adsema and Kiva. The others were for 10,000 meticais each, and were used to purchase products (rice, beans, sugar and other items) to increase the inventory of her store. She is confident that she will pay back the loan ahead of schedule. In the future, she intends to apply for more loans and build a large store to meet her customers' needs.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, beans, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She is going to use the money to buy materials for her home. She is going to change the roof of her house, since it has problems and water is leaking in. She is also going to take care of some unexpected expenses.

loans.name: Togtohhorol

texts.en:
Togtohhorol D. is 34 years old and lives with his wife, son and daughter in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His son is a local middle school student and the daughter goes to a kindergarten, while his wife works with him. 

Togtohhorol currently operates three separate businesses in his town with the help of his wife. Their businesses include a cafeteria and food sales and a transportation service. Togtohhorol spends most of his time managing the cafe during the summertime and works at the transportation and meat sales businesses in winter. The couple started all of their businesses in 2002 after Togtohhorol had a car accident and was injured in 2001. They have found success in all three ventures and have a strong customer base throughout their community. 

For the future, the couple is planning to expand their cafeteria. Togtohhorol is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of food products, meal ingredients for his business, in order to increase their working capital.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: M. Emilienne est née le 30 Juin 1972 à Allada, dans le département de l’Atlantique. Mariée à AHOUISSOUSSI Alain, un chauffeur, Emilienne est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Emilienne vit depuis dix sept ans au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, avec sa famille. Les charges de la famille sont supportées par Emilienne et son mari. Emilienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Emilienne prépare et vend de la nourriture (riz, pâte de maïs et de cossette d’igname, accompagnés de diverses sauces) à Allada. Emilienne  achète ses produits dans les marchés d’Allada. Emilienne mène cette activité depuis huit ans et a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés auprès de ALIDé. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et d’augmenter le volume de ses ventes, pour se faire plus de revenus, Emilienne sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Emilienne ambitionne plus tard acquérir sa propre parcelle.
texts.en:
M. Emilienne was born on June 30, 1972 in Allada, in Atlantique county. She is married to AHOUISSOUSSI Alain, a chauffeur, and is a mother of five children, some of whom are in school. Emilienne has been living with her family in the Dogoudo district in Allada for seventeen years. Family expenses are covered by her and her husband. Emilienne did not attend school. To support herself, she makes and sells food (rice, cornmeal mash, and yam chips served with various sauces) in Allada. She purchases her supplies at Allada markets. She has been in this business for eight years and has already benefited from three loans, which have all been repaid to ALIDé. With the goal of bolstering her business and increasing her sales volume, so as to make more revenues, Emilienne is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. Her ambition is to acquire her own plot of land later on.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 2 sacks of rice, 1 sack of yam chips, 1 sack of corn, 1 container of oil, and some condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cheese, fresh cheese, cream and cheese curds.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre muy trabajador, dedicado a su familia, con  cinco hijos desde joven aprendió el oficio de técnico en reparación de todos electrodomésticos, soldadura, así como la venta y compra de vehiculo. Con ahorros logro comprar un vehiculo lo que ha venido circulando, compra y vende y le queda buena ganancia.
Gracias a sus esfuerzos de trabajo en electrodomésticos, y cuando no trabaja en soldadura para lograr comprar su canasta básica, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa ya que esta laborando como domestica.  Y sobre todo el  apoyo de la institución en donde ha  logrado hacer toda su casa de concreto pues todos sus doce ciclos lo ha invertido en mejora a su vivienda.
Con este financiamiento terminara de hacer el porche, poner piso ya que aun es de tierra, a si como mejorar el techado que esta en malas condiciones.
Para el es de mucha alegría cada día mejorar para un bienestar familiar que junto Afodenic se ha hecho posible.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hardworking man who is dedicated to his family of five children. He learned to repair household electrical goods and welding when he was young, and also buys and sells vehicles. With his savings he bought a vehicle that has been circulating. He buys and sells and gets a good profit. He works hard in the electrical repair business, and when not doing that he welds to be able to buy his basic food, and he has the help of his wife who works as a domestic maid. And above all, the support of the loan institution through 12 loan cycles has enabled him to improve his home and build it from concrete. With this loan, he will finish making the porch, put in a proper floor over the current earth floor, and improve the roof, which is in bad condition. For him, it is a pleasure every day to improve his family's well being, which working with Afodenic has made possible.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials in iron, zinc, and flooring to finish building a porch

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Angelica; ella tiene 61 años de edad y es viuda y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida en un triciclo, ella vende en unas de las calles del Cusco llamado Av. Diagonal Angamos desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio y tener un restaurant para vender la comida. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  productos para preparar la comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Angelica is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco.” The bank is located in the District of Wanchaq, Province and Department of Cusco. Angelica is 61 years old and widowed with 5 children. She divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling food from a three-wheeled cart on a street of Cusco called Av.Diagonal Angamos from 6 AM to 5 PM. She sells food door to door and wants to improve her business by having a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to purchase products for food preparation. She is grateful to those who are helping her fulfill her dream through this forum and is committed to completing her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products for food preparation

loans.name: Ndeye Fatou Diop

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye Fatou Diop N. est  une jeune  femme  mariée de 25 ans qui habite à Bambilor. Elle est électricienne de profession (réparation et installation).En même temps elle évolue dans le commerce  et s’active dans l’achat et la vente de pièces détachées depuis 2003 .Elle est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis octobre 2009.Elle na jamais bénéficiée  de prêt antérieur .Elle sollicite un prêt de 500  000f prévu pour l’achat de pièces détachées destinées a  la vente. L’augmentation de ses revenus lui donne la possibilité de soutenir son mari à gérer la dépense quotidienne  mais aussi de supporter ses charges personnelles.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndeye Fatou Diop N. is a young married woman, aged 25, who lives in Bambilor. She is an electrician by profession (repairs and installation). At the same time, she has developed a business buying and selling spare parts since 2003. She has been a member of the Bambilor local fund since October 2009. She has not benefited from any previous loans. She is seeking a loan of 500,000 F to buy spare parts destined for resale. The increase in her income gives her the possibility of supporting her husband in managing the daily household expenses, as well as providing for her own needs.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: achat de piéces détachées

loans.name: Mpara Church Leadrers Group

texts.en:
Kasim is a young man aged thirty-eight. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda and is married with five children. He has a retail shop which he hopes to expand into a wholesale shop in the near future. He dreams of having a permanent house as he is currently residing in a semi-permanent one. 

Kasim is a member of Mpara Church Leaders group in which members access credit by each member being a guarantor for the other. Kasim intends to use the loan proceeds to buy more  sugar, beans, rice and soap to sell in his shop.

loans.use: Buying more  sugar, beans, rice and soap for resale

loans.name: Lenielyn

texts.en:
Lenielyn B. is from the village of Hinaplanon, Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 29 years old. Lenielyn is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lenielyn owns and operates a retail store where she sells vegetables like squash, eggplants and stringbeans. She also buys and sells electronic loads (prepaid cell phone credits) from several networks like GLOBE and SMART. Lenielyn has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 8500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lenielyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lenielyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell and for working capital. Lenielyn is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken by Lenielyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena L., from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Orienta, is 49 years old, married and has four grown children. To make a living, Elena owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling snacks such as rice cakes and cassava cakes in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, she is now requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients and use as working capital. This will be Elena's sixth loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As working capital and to purchase additional ingredients

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan L., 30, is a professional silk weaver living in Takeo province. She has been weaving silk scarves since 2005 and is able to make about US$2 of profit each day. Her husband is a construction foreman, typically making US$2.50 everyday. This couple has four children and three are in school.

Yan L. would like to take out a loan of US$600 to purchase more silk.

loans.use: To purchase more silk.

loans.name: Oeurn's Group

texts.en:
This loan group consists of four members who live in Stueng Chrov Village in Kandal Province. They have selected Mrs. Oeurn C. to be the group leader. The members will use their portions of the loan for different purposes, all of which will improve their families' living standards.  

Mrs. Oeurn C. is a housewife who cooks food for her family and looks after her children. Her husband, Mr. Mech Srey, is a traditional Khmer healer who earns some money to support his family. Mrs. Oeurn C. has a problem because her husband is ill, so Mrs. Oeurn C. is requesting a loan to insure her husband’s health. 

She is 50 years old and the mother of four children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, one is a beautician, and the others attend the public school.

loans.use: To insure her husband’s health

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 40 years old and is married, with four children aged between seven and fourteen years old. Her husband works in construction. Bernadette has been farming cows for four years and employs two people to help her manage the business.

Bernadette has requested a loan to renovate her house. She plans to reinvest any profits she makes from her business and she would also like to save for the future.

loans.use: To renovate her house.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia belongs to the “Pro Desarrollo” cooperative bank, which is located in the Pisac District of the province of Calca. She is 45 years old, married and has four children. 

Florencia is requesting the loan to invest in her handicrafts business in Pisac. She will take her handicrafts to Chile and Bolivia to sell on a frequent basis. With the loan, she plans on buying more inventory for her business.

She is very happy with the loan granted, and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her handicrafts business

loans.name: Otgonjargal

texts.en:
Otgonjargal is 41 years old and lives with her husband and three children, aged 7 to 18 in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house in the outer ger districts of the city. Her oldest son studies at high school and her daughter and younger son attend secondary and primary school. Her daughter is preparing for the International Mathematics Olympics and she is a top student. 

Otgonjargal is in charge of operating the small food store in her family’s yard with regular help from her husband.  The grocery store is in a small cabin that must be kept warm by constantly keeping a fire burning in the winter.

In 2003, when she first began operating a business, she served  customers with a telephone service at an outdoor market. In 2005, she and her husband together built a small house and she opened a small grocery store. Her store sells candies, bakery products, purified water, juices, breads, vegetables and other small foods. Besides food trading she also sells small bags of firewood and coal. 

In 2010, her family bought a small truck with her business earnings. Now, her husband sells coal and firewood from the truck. With this loan of 800,000 MNT, Otgonjargal’s family wants to expand their food store to sell a wider variety of foods, firewood and coal before the Mongolian Lunar New Year Holiday. 

In the future, Otgonjargal wants to expand the store’s size.  Her goal is to improve her children education, so her children can become very smart in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of food products to sell in the grocery store

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Mrs. Thol S. is 36 years old and her husband, Mr. Thol Prem is also 36 years old. They have been married since 1998 and have four children - three sons and one daughter. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Mrs. Thol S. stays at home. The main source of their income is from her husband’s business. He is a wooden house constructor. He does not have enough materials to work, so Thol is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials for her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.name: Abrhan

texts.es: Abrhan,28 años, es soltero, Socio del Banco Comunal Solidaridad, es taxista y tambien está estudiando para ser Chef. El préstamo que está solicitando lo utilizará en el pago de seguro de su taxi, compra de llantas. Es su primer ciclo en Finca Perú, ingreso por la invitación de una socia, porque le hablo que se puede ahorrar. Su sueno es ahorrar para poder comprarse otra movilidad.
texts.en:
Abrhan is 28 years old, single, and a member of the Communal Bank “Solidaridad” (Solidarity). He works as a taxi driver and is also studying to become a chef. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for the insurance on his taxi and purchase tires.

This is his first loan cycle with FINCA Peru. He joined at the invitation of another member because he says that he wants to save. His dream is to save enough money to buy another vehicle.

loans.use: Pay for the insurance on his taxi & purchase tires

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: Rosa Elvira A. de 44 años de edad, reside en el departamento de La Unión, ella vive junto a sus tres hijos, Rosa, Karen y Carlitos, todos menores de edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una venta de tortillas y una pequeña tienda en su misma casa de habitación. La venta de tortillas, en este país, es muy rentable por el hecho que éstas son parte de la dieta diaria de las familias salvadoreñas, razón por la cual se venden mucho. Rosa es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia, quien se esfuerza a diario por brindarles lo mejor y poder solventar todos los gastos del hogar y también pagar los estudios de sus hijos, lo cual es de mucha importancia para Rosa quien es madre soltera. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz de manera que pueda contar con mayor cantidad de materia prima para la elaboración de su producto y también abastecer con mas productos demandados últimamente por sus clientes en la tienda en la que distribuye productos de primera necesidad como jabones de lavar ropa, detergentes, pan dulce, leche y algunos granos básicos como el frijol y arroz.-
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira A., age 44, resides in the Department of La Unión.  She lives with her three dependent children, Rosa, Karen and Carlitos, who are in school.  Rosa has a business selling tortillas, and a small store located in her home. This type of business is very profitable in El Salvador because tortillas are part of the daily diet of its citizens.  For this reason, Rosa is able to sell a lot of her product.  She is a hardworking individual who is devoted to her family.  Rosa strives each day to provide them the best and pay all of her household expenses and also pay for her children's studies. This is very important to Rosa because she is a single mother. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a large quantity of corn since it is the main ingredient used in making her product.  This will also allow her to stock more products in her store which are in high demand by her clients, such as soap for washing clothes, detergent, bread, milk and staples such as rice and beans.

loans.use: Purchase corn for making tortillas

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 48 year old Adama S.. She is married, and has 2 children. In 2002, Adama S. established her plastic utensils business. She began her business on a very small scale with a little financial support from her husband. She opens her business 6 days a week and 10 hours a day.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000, to buy more plastic utensils. She intends to use the proceeds from this loan to help her husband educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more plastic utensils.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 35 years old, married and has three children. Her oldest child is 10 years old and the youngest is 7.

Maribel is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for 10 years. Maribel usually earns about 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from this farming. She works hard to improve her earnings and be able to sustain her children's education.

Maribel's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Henrry Augusto

texts.es: Henrry tiene 27 años de edad. Vive con su pareja y 1 hijo en un caserío cerca de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino y caprino. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 08 años, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los vende a los negociantes que suelen visitar las zonas. Cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Henrry solicita un préstamo para comprar más animales y alimento balanceado. Con esta inversión, podrá aumentar sus ingresos  mejor cubrir sus gastos familiares.
texts.en: Henrry is 27 years old. He lives with his partner and 1 son in a hamlet near to Olmos, a quite commercial agricultural area in the province of Lambayeque, which is located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He works raising and selling sheep and goats. He has been doing this for 8 years, and he knows perfectly how to do it. When his animals reach a good size and weight, he sells them to the middlemen who often visit the area. He has established customers in the area. Henrry is requesting a loan to buy more animals and livestock feed. With this loan, he will be able to increase his income and better cover the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy more animals and livestock feed.

loans.name: Safura

texts.en:
Safura R.  is 49 years old. She is married and has two children. Safura works cultivating a small farm, which she has done for six years. She grows different types of vegetables such as potatoes, onions, and carrots. 

Every day she gets up very early to work on her land. Safura drives to the produce market in the capital to sell her products, while her sons and husband take care of the daily work on the farm. Safura is very proud of the work she has done together with her beloved sons, and grateful that they have been able to acquire the comforts they have in their home. 

They have made good use of their previous loans. Safura is applying for a loan of 1,000 Azerbaijani new manats. The loan will be used to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides that they need for their farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Tedungal Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est né le 12 Octobre 2010. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui ont comme activité principale le petit commerce. 

La femme debout à l’extrême droit est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants.

Elle vend des fruits au marché hebdomadaire de sa localité. Et comme activité secondaire elle vend le petit déjeuner Elle maîtrise bien cette activité pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant plus de cinq ans.

Avec son nouveau prêt elle compte s’approvisionner en mangues en partie. Pour le reste acheter divers accessoires pour le petit déjeuner.

Elle envisage de mieux soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The group Tedungal was established on October 12, 2010 at the inauguration of the Banc Villageois Dialicounda Kawral. It is composed of ten women who work in small-scale commerce. Note: Since Banna G. and COUMB. S. are not clearly visible in the photo, they are considered absent.

Ms. CoumB.  S. (standing at the far right in the photo) is the group’s official. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of eight children. She sells fruit at the weekly market of Diaobé. And she sells breakfasts on the side. She has a good command of this business because of her experience in it for over five years. 

With her new loan, she plans on stocking up on mangoes, in part. For the remainder, she will buy various accessories for making breakfasts. She envisions supporting her husband better in covering family expenses.

loans.use: to buy accessories for breakfast-making

loans.name: Sop Sa Serigne Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Sa Serigne du Banc Villageois de Ndiongué est composé de quatorze femmes qui sont du même village; elles ont le culte du travail; font du petit commerce et la transformation d'huile d'arachide.


Ngaya est âgée de 41 ans,elle est mariée mère de deux enfants; c'est la responsable du groupe.Elle fait du petit commerce et de la transformation d'huile. Elle achète ses produits dans les marchés hebdomadaires et vend dans le village. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine depuis cinq ans. Sur la photo elle est à gauche et tient un cahier et un livret dans sa main et couverte d'un châle noir.


Elle souhaite avec son prêt acheter des marchandises pour renforcer son commerce.

Elle aide son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes. Avec ses bénéfices, elle compte augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sop Sa Serigne of the Banc Villageois of Ndiongué is comprised of fourteen women who are from the same village; they are religious about their work in small-scale commerce and in the processing of peanut oil.

Ngaya is 41 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She is the group’s official. She has a small business for producing oil. She makes her purchases at the weekly markets and sells in the village. She has good experience in this domain over five year's time. In the photo, she is the person at the left holding a notebook and booklet in her hand and wearing a black shawl.

She would like to use her loan to buy some merchandise for bolstering her business.  She assists her husband with day-to-day expenses. With the profits, she plans on increasing her savings.

loans.use: to buy peanuts and beans to be sold

loans.name: Angoritas De Ingenio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANGORITAS DE INGENIO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Rosa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, venta de chantilin, tejido de bitles, producción de pelotas, producción de zapatos, venta de fruta

La señora Rosa, indica que es la primera vez  que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que ingreso por invitación de la promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido, que aprendió de una amiga.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra lana para tejer por mayor. Este producto los comprará por mayor de la Ceja y posteriormente elaborados los tejidos los venderá a pedido en diferentes puestos. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y  tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro.
texts.en:
The lending bank "Angoritas de Ingenio" will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focal center Los Andes. It is made up of 8 members and is directed by a board headed by Rosa. The association members have varied businesses including: weaving tablecloths, selling cakes, weaving bridles, making balls, making shoes and selling fruit. 

Rosa indicates that it's her first time working with Pro Mujer and that she joined at the invitation of the promoter. Currently she has a weaving business, which she learned from a friend.

The loan that she will take out now is to buy wool for weaving in bulk. The bulk products will be bought in La Ceja, and once she makes the products she will take orders to sell them to different stalls. This work allows her to generate income to support her family. She lives with her partner and their two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the savings.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary  is a married woman with six children, three of whom go to school. She doesn't take care of additional family members. Mary sells bananas. She has been in business for the last five years. Mary sells her bananas in the market.  She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more  bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are seasonality and transportation.  She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Sop Borom Darou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sop Borom Darou du Banc Villageois Sop Borom Darou Mousty est créé depuis le 10 décembre 2010;il est composé de dix huit femmes qui habitent toutes le même quartier et font du petit commerce de produits divers:habits,parfums,draps de lits,bijoux etc....

La responsable madame Adji âgée de 39 ans est mariée sans enfant mais a deux en charge, elle s'active dans le petit commerce d'arachide de chaussures, bijoux, habits enfants et femmes. Elle est à droite sur la photo est habillée en boubou bleu blanc.


Elle achéte ses marchandises dans les grandes villes et revend dans son quartier.

Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité.


Elle appui son mari dans la gestion des dépenses familiales avec les bénéfices obtenus mais renforce aussi son épargne.
texts.en:
The Sop Borom Darou solidarity group of the Sop Borom Darou Mousty was formed on the 10th December 2010. It is made up of eighteen women who all live in the same quarter and sell various items for a living, e.g. clothes, perfume, bedsheets, jewellery etc. 

The group leader, madame Adji, is 39 years old and married. She has no children of her own, but has two in her care. She sells peanuts, shoes, jewellery and clothing for women and children. She is on the right hand side of the photo, wearing a blue and white boubou (robe). 

She buys her goods from the nearest large town and re-sells them in her quarter. This loan will enable her to boost her business levels. 

With the profits she generates from the business she supports her husband in meeting the family's needs, and also puts some money aside for savings.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, clothes, jewellery and peanuts

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 48-year-old woman, married and living in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has two grown children. She is engaged in a cross-stitching business activity to earn a living. She has been doing it for three years. A monthly income of approximately PHP 3,000 (~$75) is generated from this activity.  

She has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 at GDMPC to buy materials needed for cross-stitch designing or crafting. Evelyn has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year. She plans for more beautiful designs to sell in order to get more orders to increase her usual income.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for cross stitch designing.

loans.name: Erick Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Erick  vive en la ciudad de Managua y visitó la oficina de Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la inversión de su pequeño negocio de pulpería donde vende diferentes tipos de comestibles.

Por medio del crédito, él va a realizar la compra de la carne, el pollo, los perecederos, el arroz entre otros productos para incrementar su iventario en la pulpería para satisfacer a su clientela y así obtener utilidades para la manutención de su hogar que tanto depende de él.
texts.en:
Señor Erick Enríquez lives in the city of Managua.
