Señor Erick visited the CEPRODEL office to request a loan for investing in his small grocery store where he sells different food items. With the loan he will be able to purchase beef, chicken, perishables, rice and other products to increase his inventory, satisfy his clientele and thus and get better returns with which he will support his home and family, who depend on him.

loans.use: to invest in his business by buying chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Shakila's Group

texts.en:
Shakila is married and her husband is a master tailor. His shop is located in the nearby market from where he operates his business. He is known among his clients as an expert in his work and receives regular orders every month. 

Shakila is also a seamstress and offers her services to her neighboring clients on reasonable rates. Her good stitching helps her in getting more orders every month which allows her to manage the household expenses. 
 
She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. 

Shakila has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her clothes sewing business. With the loan, she will purchase a new sewing machine that will allow her to complete the orders in a shorter period of time and make more income. She has been operating her business for the past 15 years and is very much sure that after the loan investment she will be able to operate her business better and improve the living standard of her family as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shakila.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for sewing business.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 32 years old and lives in the town of Masidi in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is single and has 4 children. All of his children are currently in school. Robert has a business selling produce like maize, which he has had for 1 year.         

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more produce like maize, beans for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Robert hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Robert hopes to expand his business. 

Robert is a member of BRAC’s Small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business, and that has changed the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more produce like maize, beans for resale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, an optimist 34-year-old, has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for almost six years. Her daily profit of P200 goes toward meals and allowances for her two children.

In order to gain more profits, Marites is requesting a loan of P6,000 to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, breads and instant noodles to sell. In the future, she hopes to establish another business to increase her income so as to support her children's education and lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, breads and instant noodles to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
El señor Gonzalo es origen de la comunidad de Kolque Koya Alto de la Provincia de Tiraque del Departamento de Cochabamba actualmente casado con 7 hijos a cargo de ellos

Prácticamente la actividad económica a la que se dedica el señor Gonzalo es la agricultura, la producción de tubérculos y cereales en su comunidad de Kolque Koya, que está ubicado a cinco kilómetros al este aproximadamente de la localidad de Tiraque.

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de insumos agrícolas, semillas, abono e insecticidas, el objetivo del cliente es incrementar su producción agrícola al año siguiente, y así de mejorar las condiciones de vida en su familia
texts.en:
Gonzalo is from the Kolque Koya Alto community in the province of Tiraque, department of Cochabamba. He is married and raising seven children. His main source of income is agriculture, and he farms tubers and grains in his community of Kolque Koya, located about five kilometers to the east of Tiraque.

He will use the loan to buy agricultural fertilizer, seeds, and insecticide. His goal is to increase his crop production for the following year and improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: buy agricultural fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and manure.

loans.name: Chansan

texts.en: Chansan, 30 years old, sells groceries, earning $7 per day. Her husband is a farmer who sells palm products, earning $2 per day. The couple has three children: two are studying and one is only 3 years old. Each month, Chansan spends $50 on food, $10 on electricity, and $10 on school fees. She would like to request a loan of $1,200 to buy a plot of land for farming. The loan will help her family have more land to farm to get more rice to sell and support the family.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land for farming

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Most Cambodian people who live in the countryside prefer to do farming for their livelihoods. One among them is Mrs. Sreng, who is 47 years old and the mother of 5 children. She has been engaged in this business with her husband since 1993 in Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh. Together, they typically earn an average of $4.00 per day and work hard to support the family. 

During this season, Sreng is taking care of her rice crops that are growing. She has to take out small plants that are not useful and keep the level of water in the rice field in good condition. However, there are many insects increased that always come to damage her crops. Sreng is applying for a loan to buy insecticides to protect her crops. 

With the rest of this fund, she’ll buy some fishing supplies that can be used to catch fish, crabs, and other creatures from the water for daily food. This loan will help support some part of her living.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and some fishing supplies.

loans.name: Lideres De Villa Rica Group

texts.es: La Sra. Yanina   es casada, tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Lideres de Villa Ricra” grupo  conformado por 10 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Yanina trabaja desde hace  3 años en la venta de productos de belleza a domicilio este negocio surge con la idea de obtener mejore ingresos ya que Yanina nos cuenta que empezo con un capital de S/. 200 soles y compro algunos productos de belleza, hoy en dia tiene clientes fidelizados. y cada dia su negocio es mas rentable, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicacion  ha logrado mejores ingresos economicos y su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería Lapiz labial, cremas, esmalte etc , Sabemos que Yanina  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Yanina is married and has one school-age child.  She is currently a member of the "Líderes de Villa Ricra" community bank.  This group has ten members who work in different commercial activities.  Yanina has been selling beauty products from home for three years.  This business came about because she wanted to make better income.  Yanina tells us that she started out with 200 soles in capital and bought some beauty products.  Today she has loyal customers and her business becomes more profitable every day.  Thanks to her effort and commitment, she has managed to improve her income and her family enjoys a better quality of life.  In order to continue growing, she has requested a new loan to buy merchandise such as lipsticks, creams, nail polish, etc.  We know that Yanina will achieve her goals with a lot of hard work and effort, and that Edaprospo's loans will help her.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Gerelmaa is a 31 year-old clothes seller in a supermarket called “Sunday”, located in downtown Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her husband and her 3 children in a rental house. She has been selling clothes for 3 years and has thus gained some experience in her business. Currently her wages are the main source of income for her family. Therefore she always tries to increase her earnings by improving her business day by day.
  
Now Mrs. Gerelmaa needs some money to purchase winter clothes to sell for the upcoming season, because these clothes are more expensive than other seasonal clothes in Mongolia. This represents a significant opportunity to increase her income for the year.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothes to sell for the upcoming season

loans.name: Katiuska Antonieta

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Esperanza y Progreso se reúne cada quince días en la ciudad de Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Katiuska, ella tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad los mismos que estudian en escuela, el esposo es profesor de una escuela en Manta.
 
Ella además de trabajar como empleada publica también tiene un bazar en su casa, en el cual vende todo tipo de productos de bazar, como ropa, zapatos, tarjetas, peluches, entre otras cosas  y también realizan trabajos en serigrafías, bandas, cintas de reinas, entre otros trabajos. Por sus ocupaciones ella tiene a una chica que es la encargada de atender el local a quien le pagan un sueldo mensual por su trabajo. Su mercadería compra en Guayaquil y en Ambato, tienen más de 10 años con su negocio y que les va muy bien.

Este  crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, peluches y bisutería. Esta desde hace 11 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha ido aumentando su negocio. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida personal.
texts.en:
The Esperanza y Progreso (Hope and Progress) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Montecristi, known for its rich, pre-colonial culture, and for its nationally and internationally known arts.  It’s also a place known for its famous straw hats.

Katiuska lives here, is 39 years old, married, and has two children, ages 10 and 8.  The children attend school and her husband is a teacher at a school in Manta.

Besides working as a public employee, she also has a shop in the home where she sells all types of products, such as clothing, shoes, cards, stuffed animals, among other things.  They also make silk-screens, sashes, and other things.  She has a young girl to whom she pays a monthly wage and who works in the shop and serves customers.  Katiuska buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and Ambato.  She’s had this business for more than ten years and things have gone well for her.

She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing, shoes, stuffed animals, and costume jewelry.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for 11 years and enjoys it because the loans have helped her to grow her business.

Her dreams are to move ahead with her business and personal life.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her shop.

loans.name: Assétou

texts.fr:
Âgée de 31 ans, Madame Assétou est mariée et mère de 3 enfants résidant dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie avec son époux et ses enfants à Kaboïla II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Assétou après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente des spaghettis depuis plus de deux ans. Elle mène son activité au domicile conjugal. Pour la qualité de ses produits, elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle qui vient acheter en gros pour les revendre en détail. 
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a un an, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel, le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
 Vu son expérience dans l’activité au quartier, Madame Assétou vend ses marchandises au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée très généralement de femmes. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce 2ème prêt, 40 cartons de spaghettis de qualités différentes auprès des grossistes. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 130 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
31 years old, Madam Assétou is married and mother to 3 children. She lives as part of a large traditional extended family with her husband and children in Kaboila II, one of the popular neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the republic of Mali).

After having managed many businesses without success, Madam Assétou started this business buying and selling spaghetti over two years ago. She manages her business from her marital home. Due to the quality of her products, she is very much in demand by her clients who come and buy wholesale to resell the products retail.

In order to satisfy her clientèle which is increasing more and more, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso a year ago. She is on her second individual loan; the previous loan was correctly reimbursed.

Due to her business experience in the neighborhood, Madam Assétou sells her merchandise for cash and credit to a clientèle that most generally consists of women.

With this second loan she plans to buy 40 cartons of spaghetti of different types from the wholesalers. 

With the loan she envisages making a monthly profit of 130 000 FCFA which will be used primarily to expand her business, contribute to family expenses and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy spaghetti.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: Candelaria is responsible for her family. She devotes herself to her hog-raising business. Her husband works as a farmer in the village. They both work hard to support their children's needs. Candelaria said that she will do everything to lift her family out of poverty, and that is why she is also engaged in buying and selling fish in the village. Candelaria is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase feed and vitamins to sustain her hogs and to buy different kinds of fish to sell. She hopes that she can get the amount she has requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins to sustain her hogs and to buy different kinds of fish to sell.

loans.name: El Senor Es Mi Pastor 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Dominga is the coordinator of her group El Señor es mi Pastor (God is my pastor), and her story is representative of both her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti.

Dominga’s group is surrounded by sugar cane and is located in one of the rural areas surrounding San Pedro de Macoris, an area known for its baseball stars. This is where Dominga makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their five children.

Dominga runs a colmado, a small grocery store, where most of her neighbors buy their daily meals. She is excited to be taking her fourth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying rice, beans, sugar, flour, canned food, and other items. 

Dominga will use the profits from her loan to reinvest in her business and save to build a house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, flour, canned food, and other items

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: La señora Leonor tiene 47 años de edad, es soltera, su hija e hijo que tiene se encuentran estudiando en la universidad, ellos tienen becas de estudios y alimentación, por eso disminuyen gastos de estudios. El domicilio está ubicado en la comunidad Tapera a 45 Km. de nuestra ciudad. Ella produce y vende maíz, maní, también trabaja de portera en la unidad educativa de su comunidad, los ingresos que obtiene son, para cubrir gastos en ropa y otros que tienen sus hijos en la Universidad, Está solicitando crédito para compra de material escolar y tener más para poder venderlos a los estudiantes de la escuela de la comunidad, además será para la compra de herbicidas para el fumigado de maíz y maní que tiene. El mayor deseo de Leonor es mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de sus 2 hijos que tiene y así  puedan salir profesionales para  tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Leonor, 47, is single and her son and daughter are students at the university.  They have scholarships for their studies and food, so their expenses are lower.  Their home is in the Tapera community, which is 45 kilometers from our city.  Leonor grows corn and peanuts, and also works as concierge at the community school.  Her income is used to cover clothing and other expenses for her children at the university.

She is requesting a loan to buy school materials to sell to students who attend the community school.  She also will buy herbicides for her corn and peanut crops.  Leonor's biggest desire is to improve her income to cover her children's expenses so they can become professionals and lead a better life.

loans.use: To buy school materials.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mamadou est cultivateur établi dans le village de kassack sud, il est âgé de 64 ans, il exerce cette activité de culture rizière depuis son enfance avec ses parents, avec ce prêt il va acheter du semence de riz de la variété sahel 108, de l'engrais, de l'herbicide et du carburant.

Il compte s'investir d'avantage dans ce domaine afin d'avoir une autosuffisance en riz dans son village natal et dans la vallée du fleuve sénégal, il veut aussi diversifier les types de variétés de riz qu'il cultive car cela va lui permettre de faciliter la commercialisation au moment des récoltes.

loans.use: Achat de semence de riz(variété sahel 108),d'engrais, d'herbicide et de carburant

loans.name: Nonviwowo Group

texts.fr: NONVIWOWO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Christine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 36 ans. Christine est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Rigobert. Le couple a quatre enfants,tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Christine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Christine vend des poissons depuis vingt ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Christine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Christine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe NONVIWOWO, un sixième crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des poissons.

loans.name: Tusigaigoa

texts.en: Tusigaigoa is 39 years old. She operates a business of selling elei print, samoan cocoa,banana, taro,fruits in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. Tusigaigoa has requested for a loan to buy banana tube, taro roots, paint color, paint brush, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, pick-up(car) to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2009, and hopes to use her business profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube, taro roots, wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, pick-up(car)

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 43 years old and married with 3 children.

She has been roasting green maize for 3 years. She will be using the loan to purchase more supplies of green maize to roast, and she hopes this will help her to educate her children well and provide well for them.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and to support her husband in building a house for their family.

She is in her second loan cycle and has borrowed KES 15,000 to be repaid in 12 months.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies of green maize to roast.

loans.name: Cira

texts.es:
Cira cambió de rubro ahora se dedica a la venta de comida, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo vender toda su mercadería.
 Ella es amistosa, alegre y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por acoger a los sobrevivientes del desborde del río la década anterior, actualmente convertida en el brazo pujante de producción manufacturera y comercio en general, de clima cálido tropical muy húmedo.
Cira es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa recogido y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla dentro de su entorno familiar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza, su vida la comparte con sus hijos que estudian y trabajan, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de metal con piso de Cemento y techo de calamina, que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida como, carne asada al sartén, empanadas, pollo frito, refrescos y sodas, actividad que realiza en su domicilio de lunes a domingo en horas del día, “cambié de actividad por la demanda del sector y la comodidad de vender comida en la puerta de mi casa…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque existe demanda de comida en el lugar. La ventaja de su negocio es que lo realiza en su propio domicilio, la desventaja es la falta de un refrigerador con puerta de vidrio para almacenar los refrescos a la vista. Su sueño es tener un snack grande, ella desea comprar un refrigerador de restaurante para enfriar las gaseosas y que estas sean visibles por los clientes. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Cira solicita un préstamo para comprar un refrigerador con puerta de vidrio para almacenar gaseosas.

loans.use: para comprar un refrigerador con puerta de vidrio para almacenar gaseosas.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en:
Madeleine A. was born in Tsévié in 1968. She did not do very well in school, so she quickly switched to selling cooked rice. She has already repaid a loan of $150. She is married and the mother of two children. An honest and devoted woman, Mrs. A. provides nearly everything for her family, since her husband’s income is not enough to cover their family needs. To enhance her business, she is requesting a loan of $850 which will allow her to open a pub featuring traditional dishes on the menu. She will then be able to augment her income to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1968 à Tsévié, Madame A. Madeleine n’a pas fait de brillantes études. Elle s’est vite convertie en revendeuse de riz préparé. Elle a déjà obtenu et remboursé un crédit de $150. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants. Honnête et dévouée, Madame A. est puisque tout pour la famille, car le salaire de son mari ne suffit pas pour couvrir les besoins de la famille. Pour accroître ses activités, elle sollicite un crédit de $850 qui lui permettra d’ouvrir un bar restaurant aux menus traditionnels. Ainsi, donc elle pourra augmenter ses revenus améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.

loans.use: To open a pub serving traditional dishes.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 32 years old and married. She has six children. The first born is a girl of 14 years in primary six, the second is a boy of 12 years in primary five, the third is a girl of 9 years in primary two, the forth is a boy of 7 years in pre- primary, the fifth is a boy of 3 years and the last one is a boy of 1 year.

Justine has been rearing chickens for the last two years. She is rearing 200 chickens and collects 180 eggs every day. She would like to increase her stock to 500 chickens. She would like to maximize the space that is not in use by stocking more chicken. The bigger the stock, the cheaper the feed and higher the profitability. She would like to expand her business and be able to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: To increase the stock of chicken from 200 to 500 chicken.

loans.name: Margarito

texts.en:
“I need to extend my house, since it is quite small. Now, there are four of us, all brothers, living here. To tell you the truth it’s very uncomfortable due to the limited space we have. We only have two rooms, one bathroom and the kitchen”. I’m requesting for a loan of $1000 for the construction of an additional bedroom.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

“Necesito ampliar un poco mi vivienda ya que es muy pequeña, ahora vivimos 3 hermanos y yo pero la verdad ya resulta muy incomodo debido al poco espacio que tenemos para dormir solo tenemos 2 habitaciones, un baño y la cocina”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción de un cuarto.

loans.use: Construction of a bedroom for my house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more fruit for his micro-business

loans.name: Morie

texts.en: Morie is thirty five years old and married with two children.  Her husband is a local fisherman who earns only little income to sustain the family expenses.  She sells kitchen utensils in the market of Magburaka town to supplement her husband’s income. With her previous loan, she increased her stock of plastic items demanded by her customers in the community.  She needs an additional  loan to expand the business.

loans.use: Expand her variety of plastic goods for sale to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Hadijja

texts.en: Ramahani is a 27-year-old mother of two and resident of the Maziwa area in the Buguruni community. She runs a small restaurant in the Kisiwani area. She has been running this business  for the past ten years. She wants to remodel her restaurant to meet the health standards and guidelines set by the city council. She needs $325 to make these changes.

loans.use: Remodel restaurant to meet health codes

loans.name: Chak

texts.en:
Mrs. Chak L., age 56, is a housewife.  Her husband makes trellises to sell, earning around $2 each day in profit.  They have six children, three who are construction workers, two who are employed at a golf course, and one who is a student.  

She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase a boat with an engine for her husband to operate a fishery business.  This additional business will expand her family’s income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia O. trades in clothes. She is 48 years old and married with 8 children. She has been a LAPO member for 4 years. She asks for the loan amount of $450 in order to buy more clothes to sell. She learned her business for three months and started in 2005.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Mapatano A Group

texts.en:
Grace M., age 40, is married and has 3 children (ages 18, 16, and 10). For the past 8 years, she has been running a business selling charcoal and juice. The business is open from 8 am to 3 pm daily, and Grace typically earns a monthly profit of about US$154.

Grace hopes to receive a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members who sell sarongs and soft drinks, and run a restaurant, a shop, and saloon.

In the picture, Grace is the first one on the left.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Houwayda

texts.en:
Houwayda is a 36-year-old woman who lives in Nabatieh in southern Lebanon. Houwayda is married and has five children. She makes bread, a kind of bread that is called 'saj' in Lebanon.

Houwayda is applying for a loan to buy necessary provisions such as flour for her small business.

loans.use: To buy provisions such as flour.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha G. V. is a member of the Communal Bank Indo America which is located in on the street Jr Fitscarral No. 246, in the district of Calleria in the stated Ucayali. Bertha is 42 years old and a mother of nine children, and her husband as chauffer.

The first loan which Bertha received from “Manuela Ramos” was S/.1,400 ($525) . Bertha invested this sum in a moto-taxi.

Bertha awakes every morning at 7:00 AM in order to prepare breakfast for her husband and children. She then spends the rest of the day doing house work and other chores.

With the currently requested loan of S/.1,400 ($525), which will be repaid in 6 months, Bertha will pay for the maintenance her motor-taxi and buy an additional motor/taxi.

Bertha is very happy that she is able to help with the expenses of the home and support her children as needed. She is grateful for the assistance that “Manuela Ramos” has given to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein and Perla Mendoza.

La señora Bertha pertenece al Banco Comunal Indo América, ubicado en el Jr Fitscarral No 246-A, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 42 años y es madre de 9 hijos, su esposo es chofer. Bertha con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decide invertir en la compra de un motocarro.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un motocarro, se levanta a las 7 am para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo, de allí se dedica a los que haceres de su hogar.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,400, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, pago para el mantenimiento mecánico de su motocarro y para la inicial de otro.

Bertha esta muy contenta, por que puede apoyar en los gastos familiares como también a sus hijos cuando ellos lo necesitan, y esto le hace estar llena de orgullo, ella esta muy agradecida con el apoyo que le da Manuela Ramos para su negocio

loans.use: Maintenance of her current moto'taxi and purchase on an additional moto-taxi.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin M., 55, is widow with six children; five sons and one daughter. Her husband died in 1965. Three of her children are married and live outside the family home. Of the other three children, one has full time employment, another one  raises cows  at home, and the last one is in school. The family lives on an Island in the  Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

 Rin has been a weaver since 2005. It’s skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who will take it to sell in Phnom Penh. Before started this business she sold Khmer noodles and sweets in the village.

Now Rin is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase silk material for weaving and to fill in the land around her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and fill in the land a round her house.

loans.name: Nat Chan Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-five people in Khsom Village in Kandal Province will be comprised in one Village Bank loan. Mrs. Nat C. is a Village Bank President and she is a Chinese noodle seller in the local village. Though her business activity now is more improved, Mrs. Nat C. wants to start another Khmer noodle business which she can sell together with Chinese noodles in one place. Thus, Mrs. Nat C. needed to ask for a loan to deal with this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Srun Huoy, always assists in his wife's business. Mrs. Nat C. has five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the two others are studying at state school. Previously, Mrs. Nat C. obtained a loan from Acleda Bank to build a new house.

loans.use: To start another Khmer noodle business in order to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Wara Group

texts.es:
This group is made up of both new and old members, it is expected that the performance will be good, the groups generally make their first payments punctually. They have different activities, and there will be constant monitoring especially on payment dates.

Name of member, Activity, Years in the field, Sex C. C. CARMEN ROSA, Meat sales, 6, Female R. C. JHONNY ELEUTERIO, Mechanic, 10, Female C. R. EPIFANIA MARGARITA, Furniture sales, 6, Female T. M. GLADYS ISABEL, Fabric sales, 1, Female G. Q. ISRAEL, Cell phone sales, 2, Female R. V. LUCIA EMMA, Female C. G. CELEDONIA, Female V. M. MODESTA BETTY, Female M. C. NOEMI MARIELA, Female Y. L. MARGARITA, Female C. L. EULALIA, Bolt sales, 2, Female C. C. NATALIA, Hardware store, 8, Female

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

WARA este grupo está Conformado por antiguos y nuevos socios, se espera que el comportamiento sea bueno, los grupos generalmente los primeros pagos efectúan con normalidad, tienen diferentes actividades, actualmente son cumplidas, el seguimiento se hará constante especialmente en las fechas de pago. Nombre del socio Actividad Años en el Rubro Sexo C. C. CARMEN ROSA VENTA DE CARNE 6 Femenino R. C. JHONNY ELEUTERIO MECANICO 10 Femenino C. R. EPIFANIA MARGARITA VENTA DE MUEBLES 6 Femenino T. M. GLADYS ISABEL TEJIDO MANDAS 1 Femenino G. Q. ISRAEL VENTA DE CELULARES 2 Femenino R. V. LUCIA EMMA Femenino C. G. CELEDONIA Femenino V. M. MODESTA BETTY Femenino M. C. NOEMI MARIELA Femenino Y. L. MARGARITA Femenino C. L. EULALIA VENTA DE PERNOS 2 Femenino C. C. NATALIA TIENDA DE FERRETERIA 8 Femenino

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Louisa

texts.en: Louisa E. sells sweets (biscuits, toffees and others). She is single and is focused on developing herself. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Valeryi

texts.en:
Valeryi offers taxi services in Ivano-Frankivsk. He has been working in this sphere of business for 2 years. Valeryi admits he has benefited a lot from financial assistance he has received from Nadiya Ukraine. Currently, his business has grown to the point where he receives about US$ 40-50 daily. 

Valeryi is hoping to buy a better and trendier vehicle in the future to offer more high-class services to his clients. At this point he is only saving some money to make his dream come true. Valeryi thinks this 5000 Grivna loan will help him move closer to the fulfillment of his plans. He is hoping to spend this amount on painting the body of his vehicle to give it a fresh look. Some day when he saves enough, he is hoping to buy a newer but affordable vehicle.

loans.use: to paint his car, used as a taxi

loans.name: Stella Valimba's Tuinuane Group

texts.en:
Stella V., age 60, is married with 5 children. She has a chicken business which she started more than ten years ago. She works all day long from her house and is able to make a monthly profit of about $86.

Stella has taken out one previous loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business by buying more chickens and chicken feed. She hopes for a new loan to use for the same purpose as the last one. Stella will share this loan with her group, Tuinuane, which totals 21 members. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture Stella is 1st on the left 3rd row, in a blue blouse.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and chicken feed
